Author: Mike W.
Title: Does not turn
Body: Front wheels are in a fixed position thus preventing the user from being able to turn without the risk of tipping the stroller with the baby in it. Do not purchase, very dangerous.

Author: InxDisgust
Title: Incredibly short
Body: I‚Äôm 5,10‚Äù and my wife is 5,6‚Äù and we both found this stroller too short and uncomfortable to use. For the price it does offer a lot. But it is flimsy feeling versus a full size stroller. It‚Äôs light and would be perfect for traveling if it wasn‚Äôt so short.

Author: Razzy
Title: Excellent
Body: I have a Nuna stroller for daily operations and purchased this one for frequent travels. I like the light weight and how little room it takes. Just came back from Mexico and it did an excellent job. Look forward to more trips with this one.

Title: Rolling issue
Body: Purchased for an upcoming cruise the stroller is nice however the wheels hardly rotate making it hard to control the stroller direction.

Author: Kryss

Body: Nice stroller the price was decent. Arrived on time.

Author: Perfect for traveling and quick runs!
Title: Truly enjoy this stroller whenever my family and I have to travel with the little one.
Body: It's extremely convenient, quick to fold/unfold and super light so you don't feel burdened carrying it around. I just wish it were bit sturdier, because sometimes it can feel like a toy stroller.

Author: Ashley S.
Title: Doesn't work
Body: We bought this for a vacation to use. Wheels don't turn and are un even.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Great stroller for travel
Body: Bought this stroller for traveling via airplane. Wanted something light weight and easy to fold up. This surpassed my expectations! It‚Äôs offers a smooth and safe ride and it doesn‚Äôt feel cheaply made. Only thing is the bottom basket is small. It wasn‚Äôt an issue for me but wanted to mention it for potential buyers! Included a picture of my 15 month old son for reference. He is the 90th percentile for height) so if you have taller kiddos this stroller is great!

Author: chrishay davis
Title: This is a more temporary stroller.
Body: This stroller works very well I really like it for the price. It‚Äôs very light and easy to carry around great for traveling. But my only issue is that when I wet on my trip to Jamaica my stroller got beat up between plane transfers. Now my front wheels get stuck and won‚Äôt turn properly. Other than that this is a good stroller.

Author: vanessa day
Title: Sorry but not worth $60
Body: I got the open box one for $40 and I‚Äôm not happy with it. It‚Äôs juat a basic umbrella stroller with a cover that hardly shields my son, and a fanny pack that looks like the zipper will fail after one use. I‚Äôm returning it. :/

Author: Ashley Castro
Title: No luck
Body: Got this stroller as we're taking a family vacation that requires flying and I didn't want to take out heavier and expensive stroller with. I've heard of this brand and know they make good umbrella strollers so I figured I'd buy it ahead of time to test it out. I was super excited when we go the stroller but when I put it together and tested it out on a store run, the front right wheel didn't fully touch the ground (picture one, tad hard to tell). I exchanged the stroller as I couldn't use it with ease and just two days later we got a new one. Well that one was even worse. The back right leg was bent at an odd angle (picture two). Picture three is the how we received the stroller (giant box, wrapped in thick paper. We didn't get the first stroller like that.) so I had a feeling even before opening it that something was wrong. I'm just fully returning it at this point. Bummer since I did like how my daughter sat in it and the features. Not sure if this was on the Summer company or Amazon but we just didn't have luck with this guy. Get what you paid for kind of situation or just rotten luck? Not too sure ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Author: patton
Title: Uneven stroller
Body: Hi there. We just received the mini stroller today, Saturday 4/22. After putting it together, we took it for a test stroll and noticed one of the wheels the top right wheel does not touch the floor/ground. It‚Äôs about an inch or more off the ground which makes strolling our 2 year old not smooth as you can imagine. If you could please let us know what we can do to get one with all four wheels touching the ground that would be great. We are using for our trip coming up and will need it for the airport. Thank you.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Easy , affordable !
Body: It is easy to put together , only wheels really needed to be attached . Durable for bumpy roads . Though closing it is not as swift, and takes some getting use to .

Author: Vprz
Title: Works well
Body: Easy to set up and works well

Author: Shauna Pollmann
Title: Ok value
Body: For what you are paying, it is an ok value. It is sturdy enough, portable and great for quick trips. It does not lay back very far and the hood does not shade very far. But my biggest complaint are the front wheels. They do not turn very easily or comfortably. You have to manually pick up and move the stroller occasionally, especially on carpet. If you plan to use this stroller a lot, spend a little more money and get a higher quality product.

Author: Teresa A. Todd
Title: Pushes and turns easily
Body: Got this for my niece and it pushes and turns so easily. The wheels are great.

Author: keshelton
Title: Exactly what I was looking for!
Body: Love this umbrella stroller! My grandson has very fair skin so it was important for me to find a stroller that was light weight but had a canopy on it. This is perfect! It also has a small attachment to hold water bottle, phone, sunglasses, etc.! There is a ‚Äúcargo‚Äù area underneath so I can place his light weight blanket and jacket in case it is chilly when we go out.I would recommend this umbrella stroller!

Author: Bria Look
Title: Great for travel
Body: Our full size stroller set was way to heavy for travel and this umbrella stroller is a great alternative. It was easy to put together, is lightweight but sturdy at the same time. The pink is such a bonus!

Author: Rami
Title: Amazing for the price!
Body: We bought this stroller over a year ago and kinda just bought it in a hurry for a trip we were taking by plane. For the price we mainly just hoped it would get us through the airport and last till we got home. Now it has been on 8 trips through the airport including being weighed down with multiple backpacks and getting gate checked each time. It has sat next to snowy east coast beaches, been up and down rocky Alaskan trails, and has done miles and miles on city sidewalks. During it's downtime it resides in the trunk of my car where it is usually smashed by a Costco box or jammed aside to make room for more kid stuff.Another handy feature is that it collapses very easily by using a foot on the latch then one hand to push the handles to the ground and it latches itself closed. At this point it can be carried in one hand while wresting a fit throwing toddler in the other arm or you can use one hand to push it along when your toddler is in a walking mood. Everytime we get this out to use it I'm amazed that it's still just plugging along.As far as reclining it is easily adjustable and ours has seen many stroller naps. Its not able to lean back super far but at least enough to where the kids head doesn't fall forward while sleeping.One small flaws is one of the snaps for the umbrella top broke early on so when the stroller is folded up it just kinda flops there but can be easily snapped back onto the frame each time.It seems obvious but I should also mention that the tires are definitely umbrella stroller tires.. they are not handy for off-roading.. We have done it, but yes it definitely makes for a rocky ride and I wouldn't suggest this as a off road stroller.Another couple details are that the fabric can be removed from the frame by unscrewing about 8 screws. It's a bit tedious but is handy for when the fabric needs to be washed due to a potty training accident. The straps are good and very adjustable it has fit as little as a 6 months old baby up to our three year old toddler and I think we still have more time with it.Anyway, we love this stroller and would 100% buy it again. Everyone should have this as a travel stroller that lives in the trunk.

Author: ferrets4ever
Title: Light weight
Body: Got this for my great granddaughter and it is perfect. Very light weight and easy to maneuver. Nice quality product.

Author: Margaret Garvin
Title: Crazy convenient
Body: Awesome stroller for the price! I didn‚Äôt wanna drop a couple hundred dollars on a stroller so I grabbed this one and hoped for the best. It‚Äôs good quality, easy to fold up, and stores small enough to not take up all my trunk space. We love using this for our outings and it fits my 3 month old comfortably with room to grow.

Title: Great stroller
Body: I bough this to use for my granddaughter. It is lightweight and easy to fold. It wheels quite easily.. Definitely recommend.

Author: Carla Alaniz

I was not expecting this thing to be so cheap and flimsy and the wheels not ride smooth. For $60 I wasn‚Äôt expecting perfection but this thing is not worth the $. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô4 and this thing is pretty short as well.

Body: This stroller is trash, I actually requested my money back and I never do that. The wheels are so cheap, it‚Äôs horribly made, the cup holder are a joke and the back of the stroller is Velcro and detached. Another example of me being fooled by all the good reviews!

Body: Nothing wrong with the quality of use of this just didn't realize how big it still was when collapsed, was hoping for something more compact. Having to buy an ultra compact stroller now which is a few hundred, wish this would just compact more so I didn't need to purchase another one.

Now this one for a trip to Disney for my grandson it literally fell apart before the end of our trip. Do not purchase!!I gave it one star but it‚Äôs not worth that.

It's a good lightweight stroller, easy to pack up and throw in the car. We use the Baby Jogger for NYC because it's a tank, this one probably wouldn't last a few months with the amount of mileage we put on our everyday stroller, but as a lightweight travel backup stroller it got us through a day at the zoo no problem.

Body: This is a typical umbrella stroller that could‚Äôve been purchased cheaper at Walmart. And it does not recline back as far as product description states.

Body: This is an excellent airport travel stroller. It's very lightweight and easy to fold. Only downsides are that the canopy pops off every time you open or close the stroller. The maneuverability is also not there with this stroller. I have to tilt it onto the back wheels to turn it as the front wheels refuse to comply. Still giving it 4 stars because of the low cost and small profile when folded.

Works just fine for sidewalks and is a great size for in the locker room. I would not use it for a long walk. I do not recommend for off sidewalks. Great economical stroller for non-heavy-duty strolling.

Body: One of the parts arrived damaged. The plastic part of the strap that adjusts the seat recline was broken in two pieces, out of the box, so I can't adjust the recline position.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Disappointing
Body: I am sad to write a negative review on this stroller. I was given the link by a friend and she described it as the best stroller ever. My experience was the opposite. Starting with the CONS: The front wheels were nearly impossible to move. They were the type that you have to push around to get them going in the opposite direction. The fact that they are plastic instead of rubber did not help. I used this stroller one time. For 15 minutes in a store. Within the first minute of use I knew it was getting returned. I actually had to tip the stroller backward with the front wheels up to get it to move. PROS: Easy to put together, light weight, easy to fold. Overall not worth $50 and not comparable to a $15 Walmart stroller. And that says something because those really suck too.

The only complaint I have is that the seat is a little narrow. My kid is 3 yrs old about 28 pounds. She‚Äôs very slender yet tall , however with just a winter jacket she seems to have no additional space around her shoulders. She seems comfortable however I wish they would just add a few more inches so she can use it up to the weight mentioned on the package. Seems like she will be outgrow it fairly quickly.

Imagine, I‚Äôm expected to keep the box to return it for a refund. If not, it‚Äôs a 20% credit. 20%!!!! They didn‚Äôt even offer to send a new one for me to then return this one in that box. Author: BrillSyl
Title: Compact Stroller for Travel and Occasional Use
Body: The Summer 3Dmini Convenience Stroller is lightweight and compact, and a decent choice for parents on a budget. However, the front wheels do not seem to make proper contact with the ground, which can be frustrating. Additionally, the stroller folds quite sharp and can be difficult to close. Overall, it's a good option for trips but may not be ideal for daily use.

Author: Richard
Title: Packaging
Body: Nice compact stroller, but it was received damaged and it seems it was a previous return

Author: Angel R
Title: Perfect for quick trips
Body: Absolutely love this stroller for quick trips. I bought it to use for doctors appointments instead of bringing the full sized stroller.This one folds easily, it's light weight and doesn't take up much space.Love that it has a storage compartment and 2 cup holders.Definitely recommend this stroller.

Author: Julie
Title: Great buy!
Body: You can't beat it for the price. Great for when you want a lightweight stroller, but loads better than a typical umbrella stroller. The handles are high, and you're not tripping over the stroller as you walk. We got two!

Author: Barbara Johnson
Title: Poorly Made
Body: I used this stroller for maybe two weeks before it started peeling and the seat ripping.

Author: Toni
Title: Just Ok
Body: I had ordered this brand before and it was the best stroller but it was a more deluxe model. This one is not as sturdy for my 50lb boy but it turns terribly. I more drag it around a turn them it rolls. It is light and does the basic job but I honestly regret buying it.

Author: Nate
Title: the folding mechanism is a bit is a hassle but over all great
Body: the folding mechanism is difficult to manipulate with your foot but this stroller is light weight, sturdy, and very easy to navigate with in congested areas

Author: LN
Title: Perfect for a certain southern California theme park
Body: We got this for my 40 pound 2.5 year old for his first trip to Disneyland. Lightweight and incredibly easy to fold and take on the train or monorail. If I was being picky I would like the back to be a little taller to go behind the head but my kid is pretty tall so that could just be the issue. Pushed well plenty of storage and great price. It lives in my car truck and is holding up great!

Author: Jefferson
Title: Fine for taller folks!
Body: I'm 6'1 my wife is 5'9 and we've struggled with the portable umbrella type strollers that feel like they were made for kids to tote their dolls around. This one works pretty well and is tall enough that I don't have to hunch over when I push it. The canopy is a little stiff and doesn't cover my kids legs, but we don't plan to use it in bad weather. Assembled pretty easy and much better quality than any we've tried before.

Author: Brittany Marion
Title: Good Stroller not Heavy or hard to assemble
Body: I'm 55 and this stroller sits high enough so that I won't have to bend down to walk with it.Mainly bought this for my Son because I'll be doing a lot of walking.Perfect for me.

Author: ZJ Kim
Title: Don‚Äôt pay full price
Body: This is a convenient stroller to use at restaurants or the mall. I got it on sale for less than $30, I don‚Äôt think I would pay $50+. My 3 month old likes it and even falls asleep in it. The stroller is so small I don‚Äôt even need to fold it to fit in my trunk, so that‚Äôs nice.

Author: Marylin Anders
Title: It‚Äôs what the mommy wanted
Body: Loved everything the mom to be was so excited to receive it. Thank you so much I even got a personal thank you across the room. ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è

Author: JCS
Title: Everything you need!
Body: Easy to put together. Love the recline feature, drink holder, larger wheels, and canopy. This has been a game changer! I‚Äôm so happy I got it. My previous umbrella stroller wheels were never good and it made getting around anywhere outside difficult. This one has kept up with our Vista 2 stroller. I really love the storage and drink holder!

Author: Leticia espinoza
Title: Me sirve mucho para mi ni√±o de 4 a√±os
Body: Es amplia a pesar de q es peque√±a mi hijo puede dormir su siesta muy comodamente cuando andamos fuera de la casa

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Not made for tall people
Body: My husband has refused to even use this stroller. After pushing for a short walk, it hurt his back. I then used it for a walk and I have to agree. (We are both tall people)

Author: CeCe
Title: Perfect for travel.
Body: Loved this stroller for travel. I took it on a cruise and saw a couple others we looked at each other and said Amazon! Highly rated and recommended. I told my brother to buy it when it went on sale.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Easy to assemble
Body: This stroller seems to be as advertised. The only thing I would change is the amount of basket space on the bottom. I will say most strollers this style do not have any basket space so even a little is a plus. It did not take long to assemble and everything just snapped into place. I notice in reviews some said they couldn't get it to latch or fold. If you look at the back there is a metal bar. When you push that down it is open securely. To fold you lift up that bar and it folds right up. I hope that helps.

Author: Ashley sweat
Title: Just what I was looking for
Body: Bought because we wanted a small compact stroller. This is perfect. Reclines a decent amount for sleeping baby. Also has cup holders and small enough to not take up too much space

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Great stroller
Body: Durable. Great price good quality

Author: Teresa
Title: Great quality
Body: Was looking for a mobile stroller for travel but a little more better quality than the umbrella stroller I bought from Walmart. This was perfect! A little heavier than I expected but still overall great purchase.

Author: JOROET FERRER
Title: Light. Easy to assemble
Body: I bought it at a very good price, it is light. perfect for traveling

Author: Robyn
Title: I've owned better
Body: Its a nice looking stroller and is very compact when closed. The recline is great and pretty easy to change positions. The cup holder is handy as is the pouch.However... The canopy keeps popping off and my mother pinched her hand trying to collapse it down. I closed it myself and I can see it being easy to hurt yourself there. The basket is very small and the crossbars in the back make it almost impossible to use (esp. when the little one is reclined.) Feels like a WELL used shopping cart pushing it around.

Author: Pedro
Title: Si tienes un beb√© grande este coche no es para ti mi beb√© de 10 meses no cabe bien..
Body: Si tienes un beb√© grande no compres este coche no sirve para nadaMi beb√© de 10 meses no cabe bien!

Author: Monica Guy
Title: Don't waste your money
Body: This was a waste of money. Falling apart not what I expected quality sucks.

Author: Aleksandra Kapral
Title: Amazing
Body: If you are looking for light stroller that won't take up room in your car than this is a MUST. Super easy to assemble, very light weight, strong material, compact when folded, the belts are safe and secure on the child. The seat is adjustable for comfort which is a great plus for when child is sleeping. The hood is large and covers a huge portion of stroller keeping child away from rain, uvs, or simply darkens so child can sleep. Had drink compartment and zip up storage, plus basket underneath. Drives very smooth on concrete and flat surface. On rocks and dirt not so much. The tires could be a little bigger for easy movement.

Author: Chynna O.
Title: Off balance, hard to steer
Body: Purchased stroller for a trip and was a little disappointed: Hard to control/steer, wheels were off balance and did no roll smoothly.

Author: Torie Work
Title: Not impressed
Body: I bought this stroller strictly for traveling to Disney World with my 1 year old. I did like how small and compact it got, but every other feature was terrible. It was very sunny, the shade cover does nothing. It doesn‚Äôt stay attached to stroller and fell off more time than I can count. It does not recline even the slightest. The compartment in bottom is so small, I couldn‚Äôt put anything in there. The thing tips over as soon as you take baby out if you have any kind of weight on handle. It is not the easiest to maneuver and if you are tall (I‚Äôm 5‚Äô7‚Äù) you pretty much need to bend over to reach the handles. I mean it was cheap and we managed but seriously not a good choice. I regret even buying it and feel terrible for how uncomfortable my baby must have been this trip.

Author: c
Title: Easy to use
Body: Light weight. Very easy to use

Author: Lydia E Diaz
Title: Inaccurate description of delivery
Body: The package was NOT handed to Me the customer & I‚Äôm aware the stroller box was previously opened however it is missing a tire

Author: Wanda ozoria
Title: Encantada üòÅ
Body: Muy practico

Author: Chelsea
Title: Great for travel!
Body: Got this for the airport because I wanted something that folded up small. This worked perfectly! The storage on the bottom is a little tight, but that‚Äôs to be expected. I recommend this if you are looking for something light and easy to travel with!

Author: Patricia M.
Title: Damaged wheel
Body: One of the wheels is damaged. I can‚Äôt return since I need to use it for tomorrow but just not satisfied.

Author: Vinu
Title: Very flimsy stroller
Body: Build is not so great and comes apart after few uses

Author: Justine Robb
Title: Didn‚Äôt work for us
Body: I bought this stroller for our 14 month old to go to Disney. Loved how light weight it was and didn‚Äôt take up much room in the car, but I bought this one because it had a basket and the way the bars cross in the back made it impossible to get to it when my son was sitting in it so I returned it and went with a different option.

Author: Kristen
Title: Love!
Body: Love this stroller! Had an older version and it was great - this one is even better

Author: straight
Title: Foolish Grandmama
Body: Cheaply made. I paid 49.00 and saw three days after mine was delivered the price dropped to 29.00. I wouldn‚Äôt even pay the 29.00 if I could repurchase. Foot latch at bottom requires a person to bend down to unlatch. The maneuverability is definitely lacking when you turn a slight 30 degree corner. Front wheels just do not rotate.

Author: Es muy peque√±o ni cabe ni la bebe
Title: Que es peque√±o
Body: El estilo me gusta pero el tama√±o no

Author: Jess
Title: Review of stroller
Body: I am not sure how anyone can fit a 5 yr old in this comfortably. My 4 yr old is 40 inches tall and 38 lbs she was too tall for this especially reclining. The basket has a bar in the way to put a big bag in and out without a hassle. I would not recommend this for a child over 2

Author: Harley
Title: Very nice quality.
Body: For the price I am very impressed with this stroller. I wanted something smaller for my 2 year old that didn't take up as much space in my car and this worked out great. Very easy to put together and to operate.

Author: Charles Davis

Author: Kayla Trimble

If we hadn't been in the Florida sun I would have taken it off and tossed it. It snaps into place easily, but will snap back off just as fast.It was light weight and what we needed, but I would have spent more for a better shade if I'd known how terrible it would be.

Author: Rebecca Acevez
Title: Not the best but better than the basic umbrella
Body: Fabric is pretty thin and the canopy doesn‚Äôt stay snapped on, I‚Äôm going to have to purchase some zip ties. I got my stroller on sale for 34.99 and it‚Äôs worth that price. I would be really bummed had I paid 60 for this. It‚Äôs decent but I think 60 can get you a better stroller.

Author: Chelsea V
Title: Great for travel
Body: Nice stroller, easy to operate. Basically no assembly. The visor you pull out really doesn't cover too much of the sun. But I used this for a day of walking around downtown San Diego for hours. My 19th month old liked it, and actually fell asleep in it for about an hour. You get what you pay for.

Author: Adriana Padilla
Title: Falling apart
Body: Love that it‚Äôs light weight but it‚Äôs little falling apart when I haven‚Äôt had it for long. I take care of my baby‚Äôs things but handle tore off, umbrella broke off completely and super hard to open and close. Wheel is starting to loosen up. We don‚Äôt use it heavily too. Waste of $ not worth the price.

Author: jh050914
Title: Front wheels don‚Äôt turn
Body: Seriously what kind of stroller wheels don‚Äôt move in the front?! You can‚Äôt even steer it. I bought as an open box item from Amazon warehouse and I understand why there were so many available. I don‚Äôt recommend this unless you‚Äôre always walking in a straight line.

Author: Glenda
Title: Nesesito cambiar
Body: Se parti√≥ en dos el cochesito

Author: heidi
Title: Jungle certified
Body: Bought this stroller for our mission trip to Costa Rica, it was a life saver! This stroller survived the airports/flights, being shoved in tight spaces on long bus rides, going through the jungle and worked well at our construction sight. Absolutely a 5 star purchase!Only note is that it doesn‚Äôt recline as much as our other two strollers, that wasn‚Äôt an issue for our child‚Äôs naps but I could see it being an issue for others. Also the canopy comes off easy BUT I think that‚Äôs fine because it also goes on so easy so it was perfect for us!

Author: RetroMetalMomma
Title: garbage
Body: this item not only did not work properly. Amazon is trying to make me pay 17 dollars for a box to return this non working stroller. All four wheels do not touch the ground at any one time and it is not safe for a baby to sit in.

Author: Diane
Title: Nice stroller!
Body: I used this stroller for the first time yesterday with my almost 6 month old granddaughter. It seems to be a really good stroller! Lightweight and very easy to steer! I havent tried folding it yet, but it seems to be quite easy to do. For the price, I'm very happy with it!

Author: Haley
Title: Love it!
Body: I like that it has many features of a full size stroller with the light weight and compactness of an umbrella stroller!

Author: Lulu
Title: Fantastic
Body: My grandson is almost 8 months and isn't quite sitting yet. So I can put him in here while my 2 1/2 year old grandson walks with me. Fantastic stroller.

Author: Martin De La Plum
Title: Medium size - good for travel
Body: It is bigger than the umbrella strollers. But not as big as out bassinet stroller that is ridiculously big.What I like is the size and the build. It seems well made and thought out for the most part.My daughter is about to be 3 (2yrs 10months) and this stroller is barely big enough for her. When she is in it, the back of her head is right to the edge of the backing. This is concerning as I was hoping this would be good for at least one year of use but I believe she will out grow this in the next 6-9 months. The back is like an umbrella stroller that the seat is basically like a hammock no real back support just like a hammock. This is not an issue when the kid is awake but a bit uncomfortable for them when they fall asleep. Also when my daughter sits on it you can see the back wheels give a bit as if not able to support her weight. Which I'm sure we may have issues should be try to use it on anything but a smooth surface. This is a shame as I've seen cheap umbrella strollers sturdier than this.The basket is useless as it is hard to reach and rather small.

Author: Bryan Luna Oquendo
Title: Cuando el nene se le monta se tranca solo con todo y el seguro!!
Body: Me agrado todo sobre el coche me parece un tama√±o perfecto pero se tranca solo cuando se le monta el nene el seguro de trancarlo se sale y se tranca

Author: Fay.
Title: Easy to fold
Body: Wheels don‚Äôt all correspond in spinning together when stroller is in use

Author: Elsa Puli

Body: carriage is just right for my 2 year old and it's light weight not to heavy especially for someone like me who uses the train alot and bus .

Author: CaroleH
Title: Great for Grandmas!
Body: I have three new grandsons...3, 8 and 9 months. I bought this stroller for when they visit to make it easy on my kids,

Author: Janet taylor

Body: It allows a mother to go room and always be with baby without always holding them.

Author: Natalia
Title: Terrible
Body: This article was not on ‚Äúexcellent conditions‚Äù instead we received a stroller with missing parts, very poor conditions, this shouldn‚Äôt be for sale, this item should be thrown away

Author: Keisha palacios
Title: Muy peque√±o
Body: Muy peque√±o

Author: Jess

Body: I bought 2 of these, last minute totally on a whim, because I didn't want to pack my giant double stroller for a trip or check it on the plane.Pros: lightweight, easy to fold and unfold, folds up smallCons: sunshade doesn't stay on, the storage basket on the bottom is practically unusable, seat is weird so my 9 month old kept sliding down and slouching really far, overall very cheap and unsturdy feelThey did the job on our trip but I likely will not use them again.

Author: Erika yat
Title: Muy bajo pero lindo
Body: Pr√°ctica

Author: Molly Gresenz
Title: Great for traveling
Body: Bought this for traveling with my toddler. It folds up easily (can fold and unfold with one hand if needed) and is great for the airport. The basket under the seat is small, but the cupholder and pocket on the handles is a great feature for parents. Overall a good deal for the price and have made it my everyday stroller thanks to the compact size.

Author: DM
Title: Great for Airport Travel
Body: I was in search for a stroller to travel internationally with. I was a bit scared to bring the stroller for the travel system that I already had because your items aren‚Äôt always treated with care by handlers. This stroller seemed to be a great fit for my needs, and it definitely was. It was easy for me or my partner to open or close quickly. Our child was almost 7 months, and she fit just fine. The straps are very secure and the stroller rolls very smoothly. Now, I use it for quick outdoor walks, and I plan on traveling with it again. It takes up less space than my graco travel system stroller, and that was another big plus

Author: Melly-Mel
Title: Don't recommended
Body: No back support. It's easy to folder and light weight however my 1 year old seems uncomfortable. There isn't any back support at all. I don't recommend at all. Very disappointed with this purchase.

Author: Sara Black

Body: I bought this stroller because it's taller than most regular umbrella strollers and it's alot easier to push around with the extra height. It has good storage and moves around well.

Author: Connie S

Waste of money :( I‚Äôd advise spending more to buy a higher quality stroller that will last.

Body: Design is ideal. Small, but that's why we bought it. Wheels however are junk. One of the wheels doesn't sit level and only turns/spins a portion of the time. Have attempted to reach the company and have had zero response. They have replacement wheels available, but not for this model. Very frustrating to use.

Author: Nilsa
Title: Great compact stroller !!!
Body: This is a great product for the price. Seems sturdy enough to hold up during a trip. We keep it at the grandparents so we don‚Äôt have to bring the monster stroller.PROs:Folds up easilyComfortableHas storageHas good Sun coverageCONs:Wheels aren‚Äôt the bestStorage basket is hard to accessHandle can get uncomfortable after pushing a whileIf they added an adjustable handle for different height users I‚Äôd give it 5 stars!

Author: Chelsie
Title: Good enough
Body: Pros:Price pointComes with a carrier for cups and keysEasy to foldCan hold with one handDoes the job, easy to keep in trunk without taking up too much space.Cons:Not as ‚Äústurdy‚Äù feeling as I expected. I had a chicco version of this stroller and it was way sturdier. It was heavier and thicker while still being lightweight. It got stolen, that‚Äôs why I ended up getting this.It isn‚Äôt the most smooth or easy to maneuver. It‚Äôs ok, and I don‚Äôt hate it but it isn‚Äôt the best. Seems like everything we go to move it, it takes a second to get it going smoothThe brakes just feel cheap. Are they on? Are they off? Did they catch?I wish it had a pedal to collapse. My other one did. I don‚Äôt love that I have to get down and unclip it.Good for travel, wasnt too spendy, love the all black. It‚Äôs good enough.

Author: WC

Body: Initially bought this for something smaller to take on vacation and it worked great. It's super lightweight and folds up to save on storage space. It's so lightweight that trying to hang a bag on it while taking a break can cause it to tip if it's unoccupied and the fabric cupholders aren't the best but the main con is the foam wheels. They are not the most durable and can affect maneuverability some but for the price it suited our purposes just fine. Definitely recommended for a cheap, lightweight stroller option for travel.

Author: Leslie
Title: Love this stroller
Body: This is the perfect travel and everyday stroller. So happy with the value and worth of it. I bought this to take on a cruise and it was perfect. I was able to take it everywhere I needed. It‚Äôs compact but big enough to hold your child and other things. Love the cup holders and extra pocket storage

Author: Mich

Author: Alejandra Perez

Author: Trenten

Author: Linda M. Ruiz

Body: I returned it because my granddaughter was climbing out of itBut I liked it‚Äîeasy to use & lightweight

Author: Cindi Nandez
Title: Does it‚Äôs job, but‚Ä¶

Author: M.E.
Title: great but ...
Body: its pretty great, I got it to have as a constant in the car so the big one doesn't take up the whole trunk, but now I'm wondering what the quality is like on the cheaper ones. This one isn't bad. I was just expecting a little more. Guess I need to recalibrate my non inflated view.the issues with this is that the sun shield keeps popping off. the other is that my daughter keeps sliding down in the seat, so she's caught by the crotch buckle (more being held like a baby body carrier than a seat), doesn't look comfortable. I like that the back is curved like a hammock for her especially since the big one is flat and hard. and it folds up nicely and slender.

Author: Brian P. O'Malley
Title: Not easy to fold
Body: It‚Äôs okay to assemble but folding it down is hard with two hands let alone one hand and busy toddler. The latch that gets locked into place is metal (or looks like it) and it probably easy to kick up if you‚Äôre wearing thick gym shoes or steel toed boots but I tried when I was wearing flip flops and it‚Äôs a no go for me. Why aren‚Äôt there ever any demo videos with someone folding the stroller down also has a kid scrambling in the other direction? We take public transit so no car seat to keep him strapped in while fiddling with the stroller. Womp. Returned this.

Author: Kelli VB
Title: Poor Quality
Body: Unfortunately this stroller isn‚Äôt worth purchasing. The front wheels do not turn and it is very hard to maneuver. I think the stroller I received was defective.

Author: Rigo

Body: Stroller looked as if it had been used.The wheels connectors were dirty and one wheel had a scrape all the way around. The stroller itself was light weight and looked sturdy, but it wasn't in a new condition.

Author: Natalie Larsen
Title: Perfect for travel
Body: We got This for a vacation and had to take it over some pretty rough ground.We half expected it to fall apart but it is still in good shape and we‚Äôll take it on our next trip.Strong and lightweight.

Author: Jpr
Title: Awful product, doesn't fold up 80% of the time
Body: It is horribly constructed and requires way too much kicking to fold it down. It clogs up our apartment hallway and the whole point of it was to be easy to fold up. I can't even return it

Author: Rachel
Title: Great travel stroller
Body: Bought this stroller as a lighter weight option to travel with. I am used to the UppaBaby Vista which is just too bulky for an airplane. For $60, this fit the bill for what I was looking for. It folded up easily, was lightweight, and my 21 month old toddler was comfortable in it in the airport and while waiting in lines, etc. I am 5'10 and the handles were tall enough to push easily. This could be a good stroller to keep in your car for the park or the mall. Under storage area is small, but to be expected for a travel umbrella stroller like this.

Author: KW
Title: Baby Shower Gift
Body: Bought for a baby shower gift and new Mom had it listed on her Amazon registry. She seemed very pleased with it. All I can say is that I was pleased with the price but not over the moon about wrapping the awkward package. Ha!

Author: Kat
Title: TOO SHORT
Body: i have to bend a little to push it, it's too short for me and im 5'5...

Author: Onehappymama
Title: Great travel stroller
Body: This stroller is very light weight, easy to fold/unfold and does not take up much space in the car. It‚Äôs sturdy, looks good and a life-sever for travel and quick trips. The basket is rather small and this stroller does not come with tray or any other accessories. But it does have a canopy that‚Äôs easy to put on and take off. Overall, it‚Äôs a great stroller, but with our family‚Äôs needs, we use it only as a ‚Äúsubstitute‚Äù to the main travel system which is great but a bit too bulky for travel or just quick outings/running errands.

Author: Coffeegal
Title: Broke in less than 4 mos
Body: I purchased this stroller because it was lightweight and compact for getting around in the city. It mostly only traveled 4 blocks to and from daycare. My kid weighs less than 35lbs. It shouldn‚Äôt have broken. I hate throwing things away. This should have been durable enough to last. Now this one will be in a landfill. A waste for the earth and my pocketbook.

Author: B D
Title: such a pain
Body: bought this for toddler to travel overseas to have at the airport, it would not fold and was quite embarrassing and made life so much harder to get through TSA when i bought to make life easier, the breaks would randomly flip so in the middle of pushing child around the wheels would jam, it also was just super uncomfortable and not supportive for my kid to sit in that they hated sitting in it, i recommend saving your money and a headache by not buying this

Author: Sarah Smith
Title: Review and rating
Body: It‚Äôs very little weight and easy to manage. It‚Äôs great for the price

Author: Areli martinez
Title: CUTE!
Body: This is a very manageable stroller, small, light weight. My only issue it that the shade part comes apart from stroller too easily

Author: Egypt D
Title: The best
Body: I bought this stroller as a gift for my sister, but I absolutely love how easy it is to fold down and his lightweight also has a bunch of storage space for the baby, I would definitely recommend to everyone

Author: Kenna Willis
Title: Great for price!
Body: Easy to bring along anywhere!

Author: Shelby Fezy
Title: Pretty decent for price!
Body: This is a pretty great little stroller! We bought it last minute for a trip! The lower basket holds a good amount, and the cup holder has extra storage which is so nice! The only part I don‚Äôt care for is the sun shade. It‚Äôs awkwardly shaped and doesn‚Äôt work well most the time. Also, it‚Äôs missing Velcro on one side to help wrap the sun shade around the frame. It‚Äôs not the biggest worry as I honestly just glued it. Overall, I‚Äôve used it for two trips and I will continue to use it!

Author: Nilofer Ahmed
Title: Very Tiny Storage space
Body: The storage space underneath the stroller is very very tiny,its soo small, you can't fit anything there so i had to buy a mesh storage bag that i hung on the side to put usefull stuff. The stroller is good over all, Its easy to fold and saves a lot of space.

Author: Dilshad zeba
Title: Waste product not durable
Body: Foot closing of the stroller is so cheap quality have bend in 3 months can't even use now try finding spare pay but couldn't find i request the summer to contact me via email n help me find the spare part.

Author: Katia
Title: Bueno
Body: Buen producto

Author: marlee
Title: It‚Äôs ok
Body: I don‚Äôt mind this stroller however the sun shade part drives me nuts. It‚Äôs not super simple to attach and it falls off easy. I do like how this stroller is a little more durable than other umbrella strollers.

Author: Mahir Gonzalez
Title: Perfecto!
Body: Calidad y precio va genial! Es ligero y c√≥modo. Mis hijos duermen en el carrito en paseos largos.

Author: customer
Title: semi recline lightweight stroller
Body: Very compact and light weight.Wheels locks for storage.Wheels spin 360 while using it.I wish it reclined more but it doesnt due to the cross bars on the back of the seat.Find myself tilting stroller back on 2 wheels to allow child to recline and lay down.Hood with ventalation on the back is a plus.Great for the price,Light and compact.Closing it is difficult with sandals or open shoe.Have to use the top of foot to unlock and lift metal bar.It is very hard to do.I bend down with my hand and cant seem to get it either.

Author: Bubba's sidekick
Title: The walker
Body: The walker, it‚Äôs a cute little walker and perfect in so many ways except I did not find it so light weight when it comes to working with the baby. Don‚Äôt get me wrong it is not heavy but it is not just perfectly lightweight I hope that makes sense. Second it is not so easily to fold. I leave mine open in the garage and use it to walk around in the area of our home. I don‚Äôt fold it up and stick it in my car as I wish that I was able to do easily I‚Äôve had others that I found much easier to work with. I would absolutely recommend the stroller for justice reason because it is really easy to work with it roles very easy it is a great stroller for taking walks. Again in so many ways the stroller is perfect unfortunately being a grandmother I‚Äôve had many strollers to compare it to and the folding part it‚Äôs not that easy. So if you‚Äôre going to use it to keep at home and walk around with this would be the perfect stroller.

Author: Alina Kolloge
Title: Not for tall people
Body: We needed a cheap stroller for an international trip and it's been working okay so far, but it's a bit uncomfortable to push since the handles are low and can't be adjusted. If you're 5'8 and taller you won't be able to really stand up straight while pushing it.

Author: Jon Ramsey
Title: Nice lightweight stroller
Body: This stroller is nice and lightweight. Easy to fold and unfold. Wish it had more storage on then bottom but overall a great buy. Great for traveling

Author: Jenna M
Title: very convenient for short time travel
Body: Easy to fold, light, use less space in the truck. Basically u cant expect more for a 50 bucks item given the inflation. I like it so far.

Author: Happy
Title: Nothing wrong with this stroller.
Body: Should we just get the cheap China one? Yes. The fold-lock latch sticks sometimes and the plastic hook that keeps the stroller in the folded position is a little chintzy, but otherwise this stroller is perfect for what you'll need it for. I can open and close it with the use of one arm. Fits diagonally or slanted upright in the back of a compact SUV, or lay it down across the backseat footwells. The buckle is simple and easy. Adjustments are easy. Glides smooth, wheels are grippy, has a little clearance for curbs, very lightweight. Excellent storage underneathe for how small it is.My only complaints, but which I assume are common to all strollers: 1) even in the upright position, there's some slouching (hasn't seemed to matter), 2) pushing stroller one-handed is difficult, 3) cupholders are too small. Yes, ladies and gentlemen, these cupholders will hold soda cans but not your coffee mug.

Author: Mohsin Lodhi
Title: Doesn't move properly
Body: The front wheels don't turn. I've had friends and family mess with it because everytime someone uses it they wonder what's wrong with the front wheels.Otherwise it was easy to build and it looks nice but if it doesn't move properly than what's the point?

Author: Daevinee martinez
Title: Great buy
Body: Great buy. Thanks

Author: Jaspreet Kaur
Title: Good for fold
Body: I like it

Author: Gutture

Title: Not good

Author: Amazon Customer

They keep wanting a picture of the problem, but the problem is when you push the stroller and front wheels don‚Äôt work worth a darn, especially trying to turn and maneuver the front!

I didn‚Äôt receive the sun shade with my order and have not received a response for weeks. So costumer service is not great.It‚Äôs not a bad lightweight stroller for small trips just could use some updates.

Author: Johnaldon Alik
Title: So comfortable
Body: Love it, easy to use or carried, lightweight.

Author: Maddie
Title: Some issues
Body: I find it annoying to fold up, and the front wheels lock up sometimes while trying to walk with it. It‚Äôs extreeeeemely lightweight, which is great after switching from a heavy graco stroller

Author: OHIO Shopper

Body: Front wheels do not turn and right wheel does not touch the ground. Sun shade comes off constantly.

Author: B. Montell-camacho
Title: Good stroller for about 4 months
Body: This was an okay stroller for about 3 1/2 months to 4 months of light use. Then it completely fell apart. I contacted the seller and after about 2 weeks waiting for a response they said the warranty is for 90 days only and good luck. the latching mechanism to keep the stroller open or close is not good, it has unfinished exposed metal that broke and not the stroller is unusable. i would not recommend

Author: Christina soto
Title: Poor quality

Author: Fito Gooddeeds
Title: it fits perfectly
Body: it's good!

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Nice stroller
Body: Nice stroller. Light weight. Easy to put together. Easy to open and close. I wanted this stroller for the 5 point harness. Only thing I think could be better is the foot rest. The foot rest isn't wide enough and is so flimsy . Grand child foot keeps slipping off even with shoes on that have traction on the bottom of the shoe.

Author: Michael T. Fitzgerald
Title: Worst Customer Service Ever!!!!
Body: I have a 3D mini stroller that I bought in May 2022 via Amazon and a bolt/cap and two spacers fell off. Much like some other reviews I saw here, I wanted to obtain replacements.I called Summer Infant (as neither the Consumer Contact Form nor the Live Chat function were working) at their the offices in Rhode Island and was on hold for over a half hour with with three callers ahead of me and then was disconnected just before 5pm when they were about to close.I called the next morning and was on hold for another half hour with two callers ahead of me and eventually chose the option to be called back. They called me back and informed me that they would not provide a replacement nut and spacers, my three month warranty had expired, and my only solution was to buy another stroller despite the fact that is only five months old and broke due to poor manufacturing.I then found out that Summer Infant was bought by an Atlanta-based company called Kids2 in June 2022. I'm not sure if Kids2 will continue to operate under the Summer Infant brand but, if they do, they should stand by their products and do something about the absolutely terrible customer service and the essentially worthless product warranty. Will not buy Summer Infant products ever again.

Author: Amanda Panza
Title: Great cheap stroller
Body: My daughter is 10 month and 23lbs. This stroller is perfect. Its lightweight, folds small, and easy to use. Front wheel locks are a pain at first but after they are clicked off then no problems.

Author: Kim Seymour
Title: A great stroller
Body: I like the different adjustments it has to lay back or sit up. Easy to maneuver and turn.

Author: Amber Bailey
Title: Good but could use some upgrades
Body: This is a good stroller for the price, but I wish the cup holders were a bit wider and more sturdy, they're made of a soft material so it's easier to knock the drinks out, and the back of the stroller where your baby lays against comes forward and isn't kept back when your baby leans forward.

Author: Barbara C
Title: Nice and easy
Body: I purchased this stroller as an alternative to a heavy duty one. It has become the most used stroller because it is so light and easy to fold. The box did come damaged, but the stroller did not have any damage on it.

Author: ellebelle317
Title: worked well for international travel
Body: It's not perfect, but for the price, it's a pretty good light stroller. We took it to Spain, it was really helpful through the airports and on outings. It's not super sturdy, and whenever we needed to lift it up to carry down some steps or up a curb, it felt like the stroller was going to close on us, even with our toddler sitting in it... like the latch would get undone and it would start to collapse, so we'd have to push it back in place. But it did the job and returned in one piece. Glad we bought it.

Author: April Vaino
Title: Great buy
Body: This is everything I wanted in a lightweight stroller to walk my daughter and keep my son it. It's sturdy enough to hold things and protect my son's eyes from the sun. It's worth the 50 bucks. I bought a 30 dollar on from Walmart,it fell apart and sucked so bad. I definitely recommend this.

Author: Jerrilyn Hernandez
Title: Not easy to push
Body: Nice light weight stroller but hard to push because of the wheels

Author: Heidee Yvete Lopez
Title: Great buy!
Body: Very practical, easy to assemble and my daughter loves it. It‚Äôs great for travel.

Author: Lynn K.
Title: More features than cheap umbrella strollers, but not great
Body: I bought this stroller for airport travel with my 1 year old. He‚Äôs now 2 and I feel like I‚Äôm waiting for the back wheels to snap off. They are very wobbly; the back axles bent about 6 months into owning it so they make me nervous. It‚Äôs also hard to steer. I need two hands to turn and it pulls left. I also own a $20 stroller that doesn‚Äôt have these problems. This one is nice for the height (I‚Äôm 5‚Äô8‚Äù and don‚Äôt have to bend over), the extra storage, and cup holders, but I wouldn‚Äôt buy it again.

Author: Dani
Title: Sooo easy to use
Body: Loved this stroller. I personally don't like those big bulky strollers so I got this one for my 8 month old and its perfect for her. Fast, and easy to handle. I didn't really like the thing that goes over their head to protect them from the sun because every time I pull it over it pops out all crooked from one side, and I know its on right. other than that its greattt

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Had to Return
Body: I have to return the stroller because the front left wheel doesnt even touch the ground...

Author: ARS

Body: Product broke dure first use. At the airport, had to buy superglue to complete my trip

Body: Perfect for my little one and easy to carry

Author: Jazzmeen M.

Body: Just purchased this stroller for a family vacation and out of the 4 front wheels only 2 actually spin the others barely touch the floor . Other then that the stroller is great! Light weight, easy to fold, and the perfect size.

Author: Sheri B.
Title: Nice, inexpensive stroller
Body: This stroller is great for me to keep at my house to take my grandson for walks. It was a good price and folds very easily. Much better than the umbrella strollers available when my kids were young.

Author: Brea
Title: Stroller has been everywhere and is great!
Body: This stroller has been on an airplane (checked at gate) on all vacations, used every day for short walks and folds so easily. Light weight and gets the job done! Love it!

Author: Maria
Title: The seat is too short
Body: My baby is short for her age but still she seems to be slipping off the seat. The seat needs to be much longer/deeper.

Author: Adriana Cabral
Title: No es lo que se ve
Body: No me agrado

Title: GLIDED W/ EASE FOR 50LB*4YR*OLD
Body: I was super surprised at how well this glided without much force at all while pushing my 50 pound 4 year old all around the Perry Fair. We ordered two days before leaving, and it worked perfectly.... way better than we expected. Definitely reliable if your child is too heavy to carry when they get tired in the store, at an event, or on vacation!!

Author: Tim
Title: Works it‚Äôs intended purpose.
Body: My only complaint is the hood pops off anytime you fold it up. Otherwise a great little stroller!

Author: Brenda Castro

Body: My son is 7 months and 20lbs. He loved this stroller so so much! Its very sturdy and light weight. The only detail that was a little disappointing was the fact that the front wheels dont turn much. I find my self having to pick up the front wheels a bit for sharper turns.

Author: Piffy Rose
Title: Ehhh
Body: It‚Äôs super lightweight so I love that but I mean hey 50$ price I shouldn‚Äôt spect much it‚Äôs more like a baby doll toy stroller it‚Äôs hard to push especially with a heavy baby it‚Äôs easy foldable but pushing it is a mess .

Author: Laura Quinones
Title: Perfect for my needs
Body: I bought this to take my grandson places instead of using my daughters stroller that was way to cumbersome for me. The height is perfect if you are shorter. I love the pocket that holds your phone keys etc! Not as much room underneath as my daughters but enough to put a smaller diaper bag. My grandson is two and loves it. He easily climbs in and out of it. The only downside is the top doesn‚Äôt always stay attached..

Author: Andre P.

Body: Easy to use & lightweight. Was peeve for our cruise vacation.

Author: Kendall
Title: Good but the canopy doesn‚Äôt stay in place when folded
Body: Was looking for an inexpensive lightweight stroller, and this is perfect. We‚Äôve taken it to baseball games and it folds up to where we can put it under our seats. Only thing I don‚Äôt like is that the canopy that just snaps in place always comes unsnapped when we have it folded up so then it just sticks out and is a nuisance to resnap. For the price and the quality of the rest of the stroller it‚Äôs not a huge deal, but do wish that worked better.

Author: Rebecca
Title: Not much better than a cheap Cosco Umbrella Stroller
Body: I'm not impressed with this stroller. I was hoping it would work well, but the wheels are really cheaply made plastic and can hardly handle corners. I would rather carry my toddler than push this thing. I was hoping to take it on a trip, but I plan to purchase a McLaren Mark II now.

Author: Teresa Rioux
Title: As expected
Body: Love easier that car seat & huge stroller

Author: stefanie
Title: You get what you pay for
Body: Don‚Äôt expect a stroller that‚Äôs going to last very long. From the day we got it the umbrella part that goes over the child constantly popped off. It never folded right so we ended up just taking it off. I ordered this stroller in January of 2022 and already am having to purchase a new stroller. It did not last long at all and we had very little use of it so it wasn‚Äôt overused. Do not recommend this stroller.

Author: Lori Golden
Title: Do not purchase this stroller. It is flimsy and flipped over easily. I do not recommend this product
Body: I did not like the way this stroller flipped over so easily. No padding or support for carrying a child.Not safe.

Author: Marley j
Title: Easy use
Body: Got it for my one year old and she loves it.

Author: Ailyn Guzman
Title: Muy bueno
Body: Muy bueno

Author: Dchiz
Title: Better than expected
Body: I was a little worried after reading all the reviews but made the purchase anyway based on price. I wanted it to take on vacation with my toddler grandson because the one his parents have is too big and bulky and takes up too much room in the car. It arrived just before we left so we took it in the box and assembled it upon arrival at our vacation spot.It was easy to assemble, and based on reviews, we made sure we knew how the lock mechanism worked on the front wheels that keeps them either going straight or being able to turn freely. As others said, it WAS hard to engage the mechanism at first but honestly, we left them in the free position.The stroller was lightweight, easy to fold and easy to maneuver. We LOVED the built in zippered storage pouch with cup holders! Also, the canopy‚Äôs extra Sun visor was great for our little guy and there was plenty of airflow around him. Having storage underneath was an extra bonus for such an inexpensive stroller.The only thing that was at all a problem was the positioning of the vinyl footrest. It seemed to be at an awkward height so if he was using it, his knees were bent and up high - and if he extended his legs, they hung over the edge. Regardless, we loved the stroller. We used the stroller for 9 days, on concrete, on gravel, on grass - basically everywhere we went while in South Dakota. In fact, my daughter in law was so pleased with it that she ordered one as soon as we got home! She now keeps it in the car for regular use - and the big bulky stroller that was great for infants is now relegated to the garage ( for the next one ). And the one I bought stays at Nana and Papa‚Äôs house so we have it for any of the grandkids who are visiting. I would recommend this stroller to anyone thinking about buying it.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Baby shower gift
Body: They loved it

Author: Victor Clore
Title: So far so good
Body: I was expecting the wheels to be a rubber type material though they ended up being some type of plastic-ish. Maybe the lack of rubber adds to the light weight design? We‚Äôll see if it stands the test of time.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Wish I could give this zero stars
Body: We wanted to use this stroller for Disney. For some reason the stroller wheels don't work and was very hard to turn. UPS stated I needed to box it back up myself which of course I threw away the box and it doesn't fit it a extra large shipping box so I was very annoyed and angry. UPS wanted to charge me 45 dollars for them to pack it up. Hopefully they accept the box I put the stroller in tomorrow.

Author: Brooke-Lyn VanKleeck
Title: Eh
Body: The stroller is not the greatest but it gets the job done. The sun visor keeps coming undone every time we fold it up and we almost lost it when we took it on an airplane. You get what you pay for and is a ‚Äúgood enough‚Äù stroller and is a good option if you‚Äôre looking for something in the cheaper side.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Lightweight but cheap construction
Body: I bought this cause I was needing a lightweight compact stroller. I have used it twice now and I can not get the front wheels to turn plus one will not touch the ground!!!! I have them all unlocked but yet it just won‚Äôt maneuver well at all!! Waste of money!

Author: Teresa
Title: Don‚Äôt spend your $ on this
Body: Very flimsy all around! I do not recommend this product would rather spend more for a better stroller.

Author: Adrienne Serneels
Title: Love it.
Body: Item is great for quick in and outs for f the vehicle.

Author: Arvind Pandey
Title: Nice quality product
Body: I love this product.

Author: Kaytlyn smith
Body: Great stroller

Author: Byron
Title: We have used it for a few months but everything sounds ! The tires lock and it does not turn well.
Body: We have used it for a few months but everything sounds ! The tires lock and it does not turn well.

Author: isle
Title: Shoddy workmanship on one wheel
Body: Got this as a gift on our baby registry. When I put it together the front left wheel (right wheel when you are looking at it) was a little higher than the other wheels and not quite touching the ground on the wood floor in our living room. I hope this is not a problem once the weight of the baby is put in. Furthermore, the button to lock and unlock this wheel is almost impossible to activate. The only way I can activate/deactivate it is if I take the wheel off the stroller and then push as hard as I can on the button.Therefore, I am a little frustrated with the workmanship, but not enough to deal with a return.

Author: Nancy M
Title: Poor quality
Body: This stroller is a one and done. The wheels are so thin. They are like super thin, rubber balloons. The front wheels do not swivel so turning is a pain. One front wheel never hits the ground. Super cheap. Returning.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Considerable downgrade from older model (2019)
Body: Comparison to older model is a serious downgrade. The old one was my favorite and still works but unfortunately was in in laws garage and smells like smoke.New one:Doesn't recline as far as it used to.Canopy too transparent. Light shines through.Balance has improved, less likely to tip from behind with things hanging on handles.**Forward tipping hazard where backrest shoots forward when going down steep inclines. Strap them as tight as possible due to this, I can see a recall as it is NOT safe to go down forward inclines pitched further than 45 degrees or so. **Cup holder is great.Mechanism to fold has lost quality.I was still surprised the stroller was in this price range given inflation but instead they have cut down on the quality to keep the price point low. I will probably keep it due to it being a bargain but would recommend other options especially if this will be your go to stroller for travel.Please be mindful of the forward tipping hazard and make sure your babies are strapped tight! Could easily be fixed by having the backrest fasten to the back frame. Zip ties would accomplish this.

Author: XPA
Title: Convenient!
Body: Wanted a smaller stroller for traveling. Loved everything about it just wish it would recline a little more and it would be perfect!

Author: Dolly
Title: Wheels don't turn
Body: I dislike that the wheels don't turn and that the hood comes off when you fold it up I use it for a 10 month old toddler.

Author: Carina Meneses
Title: Love it and easy to use!
Body: Love it!

Author: Maryjane
Title: DONT buy broke
Body: 7 months and it broke supper fastSupper flimsy the weeks won‚Äôt work correctly just pay extra and get a good one

Author: Andrew Truhn

Body: Everyone has and loves the stroller, but the way the seat slants forward and down was causing our child to slump in the seat. She always looked and acted uncomfortable. I'm not sure why it is build that way, perhaps it is better for a larger child who's legs can bend at the knee past the seat and feet can rest on the foot strap. Anyway, we returned it because the price was too high for something we didn't love.

Author: Katie J Ireland

Body: Very basic and plastic. For maybe children over 8-12 months. I should have purchased a basic umbrella stroller

Author: ELIANA KARINA ROMERO
Title: F√°cil de abrir y cerrar
Body: Lo recomiendo

Author: Brittany
Title: Such an awful stroller
Body: There‚Äôs nothing I like about it. It‚Äôs hard to turn, the wheels skid and don‚Äôt turn easy. Forget about the storage underneath.. I can‚Äôt even fit my small backpack(purse) underneath. The shade doesn‚Äôt cover anything.FIND SOMETHING ELSE. You‚Äôll regret this purchase

Author: Mama2four
Title: 5 stars!
Body: We bought this stroller prior to taking my 3.5 year old to Europe for 10 days. It was a lifesaver!! It glides smoothly and is a good height for an adult to push it around. It is sturdy yet not heavy at all and easy to open/close. I don‚Äôt know what we would have done without this thing on our trip! We walked miles every day whether it be airport or site seeing and even in gravel at times. It never had any issues! Very durable.

Author: iceblueeyez

Body: Lack of storage basket limits usefulness when traveling or shopping.

Author: Christy Gregory

Author: JP

Body: The front wheels made it impossible to steer. The one I received turned in opposite directions. The canopy kept falling off making it dangerous to keep on the stroller. I returned the stroller.

Body: Easy to fold.

Author: All4shoes

Author: Karen Ann Swindler

Body: Easy and convenient to use.

Author: Amanda Rodriguez

Author: Jacs
Title: Lightweight, easily foldable, decent little stroller
Body: I received my stroller and it was missing the sun shade, so I reached out to the company for parts and warranty as directed by Amazon. Spoke to a lady named Maddy who advised me to send pics and proof of purchase for them to replace the entire stroller since they didn't have a sun shade on hand. This conversation happened on 8/24 and I sent the requested documentation as soon as we hung up the phone. Fast forward almost a month (9/15) and multiple attempts to reach Maddy again and I finally received an email stating my replacement had been shipped and when I receive it I was to cut the old ones straps so it would be unusable and send them photos of the damage I had done. Well, my answer to that is simply no, I am not about to destroy a perfectly good stroller. I have responded to her request stating as much and offering to return it if they'd like, I'm sure it'll be another month before I hear from them, if at all. Customer service with this company is shoddy at best and although I do like the stroller if I had it to do over again I wouldn't purchase from them. I'd honestly give the stroller 4.5 stars, it's a great little stroller, maneuverability could be a little better but other than that I really like it and so does my grandson. The company gets 1 star, not good to work with and VERY slow to respond or fix a problem.

Author: Diane Seymour
Title: Not user friendly
Body: The concept is great but the ability to use it with ease is horrible. The wheels do not turn, my granddaughter almost flipped over. Do not waste your money.

Author: Angela Quezada
Title: Missing
Body: The stroller was missing one of the wheels

Author: Mayra Sanchez
Title: Lightweight and easy to carry
Body: This is my 3rd time ordering this same stroller. That‚Äôs how much I‚Äôve loved it! The only problem with this newer version is the Sun visor. When I fold the stroller it makes it dent so bad it doesn‚Äôt work well. Also, almost every time I told it the sun visor falls off. With my two previous strollers, the visor never dented that way and it also wouldn‚Äôt fall off. That‚Äôs my only reason for giving it 4 stars instead of 5.

Author: jasmin totah
Title: Cheap
Body: Cheap

Author: Stephanie
Title: Amazing!
Body: This is great, better than I expected! It‚Äôs easy to use the manual makes it‚Äôs a lot easier. I highly recommend this stroller and it‚Äôs good for the price. Save yourself some money and get this stroller.

Author: Ashley
Title: Perfect on the go
Body: We bought this for my parents who watch my baby. They needed something that won‚Äôt take up a lot of space, but is comfortable enough to take on long walks. They‚Äôve been using it all summer and it has been working perfectly! No complaints at all.

Author: Kennia Lopez
Title: Super liviano

Author: Dana Gray
Title: Great stroller!
Body: This is a super light weight stroller but feels sturdy at the same time. Very easy to move and maneuver, but my favorite part of is the cup holders/storage. There‚Äôs a little fanny pack type pouch up by the handles and deep, wide cup holders that hold the wider bottom sippy cups. My daughter seems really comfortable in it. The only thing I don‚Äôt really love is the canopy. I wish it could be pulled down further at times, but otherwise I Definitely recommend!

Author: Tara K.
Title: Check For Sharp Edges!
Body: The stroller itself is what you‚Äôd expect for the price. My usual stroller was way too large for taking my son in to the exam rooms at the doctors office so this fit the bill.But buyer be warned, check the stroller for sharp edges! Apparently mine has a sharp spot by my sons arm & well, the picture shows the end result of that.

Author: Ausra
Title: It‚Äôs just OK
Body: It is impossible to fold back and forth with one hand or foot. You would definitely have to put the baby down in order to do that. And it‚Äôs kind of all crooked. When you open the sun shade, it‚Äôs twisted one way. So it‚Äôs not the best purchase.

Author: Amber
Title: A great stroller, but not perfect
Body: This stroller has a lot of pros to it, it has cup holders that are sturdy, it has a convenient zipper pouch up front perfect for phones and keys, light weight, folds decently easy once you get the hang of it, it has a basket storage underneath, and the wheels come off easily for small spaces. My 40 toddler fit well and the visor covers well. No tools required for assembly. The wheels are okay but they do not turn the best, you do need to make wide turns with this stroller but still a great deal

Title: Ease of use - slim storage
Body: Started with large bulky jogger which was great for an infant and closing up from sun and elements but not convenient for navigating. This stroller has made my life so easy! Smooth ride, compact and easy to bob & weave. Awning has great coverage but thighs and toes are often exposed... Only concern but can easily cover with socks/pants/blanket.

Body: Pros - It is light and portable. Reasonable well made considering the price.Cons - the latch mechanism that keeps the stroller open doesn't work great and we've had it collapse a few times during use. The arms for pushing are also a little short and close together for me but good height and spacing for wife.Bottom Line - if you're looking for something reasonably priced for travel, then this is a good choice. If this is your main stroller I would spend a little more money and get better quality.

Body: I like the possibility to have an light, easy and go stroller. But is way too light. Has a no sturdy sit (back support) . My baby tried it, she move to pick up something and all the stroller came with her. For sure will go to returnPros:Easy and very thin folding strollerCons:No for heavy babiesNo for curious babiesWay too lightNo sturdyNo good back support

Author: cathy nilsson
Title: Decent travel stroller
Body: I bought this stroller when looking for a good travel stroller. Overall, this worked out pretty well for those needs. It is lightweight and folds down fairly easy which were the biggest things I was looking for since I wanted it mostly for airport/travel use. Between this and the next model up, the main difference that was noted was the next model up came with a carrying strap, but it was $40 price increase. I felt like that was a big price increase for not a lot of added features. So instead of spending $40 for that, I bought a carrying strap separately for like $15 that just clipped on to this stroller when folded down and saved us a little money that way. It worked out perfect.The biggest downside is that the front wheels do not turn so the maneuverability is not as smooth as I‚Äôd have liked. Also, It does have a carry basket on the bottom but it is pretty small, so we weren‚Äôt able to use it for much.Overall, decent travel stroller.

Title: Fantastic, better than an umbrella stroller
Body: If you need a smaller, light weight option, this is perfect. Much nicer & way more support than an umbrella stroller. Easy to maneuver & fold. Love it!

Title: Lightweight, but the wheels‚Ä¶
Body: The wheels are this semi-hard plastic and are already torn up after walking on a sidewalk for 45 minutes‚Ä¶. The front wheels won‚Äôt rotate either‚Ä¶ pretty frustrating. I do like how light it is and it does fold up easy.

Title: Elevated Umbrella Stroller
Body: We wanted an umbrella stroller that was a little bit sturdier than those $15 ones and one with under seat storage and this perfectly fits the bill. We also love the two cup holders up top and little compartment for a phone/keys/wallet. We love this stroller and would definitely suggest it.

Author: Gloretta Durrant
Title: Couldn't Have Survived Our Vacation Without It!
Body: My 2 1/2 year old never uses a stroller but this was a godsend for our overseas trip to Atlantis Paradise Island Bahamas. First of all running here there and yonder in the airport is a given but we had always gotten away with her sitting on the carry on luggage. Atlantis is a huge themed park resort with rides, restaurants, pools and beaches super spread out. As athletic as my baby is she wouldn't have been able to go as far and as fast without this stroller. The best part was the shade that it provided. My daughter had complete autonomy and was able to hop in when she was ready, pull the shade down when the sun or rain was out and hop out when done. Not once did she beg me to carry her. I can't imagine this trip without it!

So after carrying a 30lb baby for max 2 hours the stroller is almost broken and unsafe..DEFINITELY DO NOT RECOMMEND‚Äúdownfall I have found is the wonky wheels, it makes turning a little difficult due to the front wheels not being able to swivel. The stroller is definitely still worth the price and good for certain usage. Probably not everyday use though.‚Äù

One front wheel does not rest on the ground unless there is weight applied to the front. It's weird because even much cheaper umbrella strollers haven't had that issue for us. But it seems to work okay so far once she's sitting down. I like that even though it's small it has storage underneath.

Title: BEST‚Ä¶FOLD UP STROLLER‚Ä¶EVER!!
Body: I bought this stroller to take to Disney for our 2 year old. My husband rolled his eyes like ‚ÄúANOTHER Amazon purchase?‚Äù But as soon as we unloaded it and started rolling around Disney property he says ‚ÄúYeah..ok, this was a good purchase. Keep it.‚Äù MOM WIN! It‚Äôs a comfort height, which even though we‚Äôre both not very tall it was comfortable to push. The grips have a soft grip so our hands didn‚Äôt sweat. The wheels turned very easily and could lock if we wanted them to. We loved the under storage area and the little bag with cup holders. We kept his sippy cup and sunscreen in the cup holders and was able to zip small things like his cars in the little bag. One of the best umbrella type strollers I‚Äôve ever used! Would ABSOLUTELY recommend this!!

Title: Hot
Body: This is a very light weight stroller good for sidewalks, not great for gravel or unlevel ground. Our biggest complaint is it gets very hot quickly.It is easy to fold but takes both hands. The parent catty is nice that it has a zipper compartment!

Title: Great
Body: I bought this stroller for my Wife to use in Colombia. It traveled on the plane fine. It‚Äôs easy to use and carry, which is my main reason for getting it because we‚Äôre on the fifth floor with no elevator. It maneuvers well, the cover provides good shade for our baby and it looks good too.

Body: Awesome product all around but the wheels are kind of cheap. After a few trips through the dirt they squeak and harder to push. Noticeable when compared to our full size stroller. Still glad we bought this product.

Body: This stroller is lightweight and easy to fold. It has a 5 point harness. That was a factor in buying this stroller compared to some others that were a little cheaper. The problem I have is one of the front wheels does not touch the ground so it doesn't roll. There is no amount of adjusting I can do to make it even with the other wheel. Because of this, it is harder to maneuver. It is disappointing because otherwise, it would be a good stroller for the price.

Steering the stroller with one hand is difficult since the stroller keeps going to the side where you push it. To adjust the seat is annoying too and it does not hold. But what to expect for this price.

Body: We took this to Washington DC for a family trip.Pros: maneuvered well and was super light weight. Durable (we walked all over the city and the stroller held up well). Very small and easy to maneuver on subway or through crowded areas. Smooth rideCons: the shade popped off every time we folded it, so that was slightly annoying but not a big deal because it just snaps on.I wish it folded slightly more compact, but at this price point I can‚Äôt complain. The storage basket is quite small, plan to wear your diaper bag.TLDR: Great stroller for the price, did what you did needed and I enjoyed how well it drove. The ride must‚Äôve been smooth too because my son had no problem falling asleep in it

Body: I wanted to love this stroller, but the cup holder situation on this thing is awful.. and you can't really use the basket underneath because the bars are in the way. It is disappointing because these are the two features I really liked about this umbrella stroller, but now I'm wishing that I didn't buy it. I would've been better off just getting a cheaper umbrella stroller from walmart that didn't have those features because it's not like I can use them anyway.

Ended up deciding on using a baby carrier so I never tries using this until we got home from our trip. We took it out shopping and the left front wheels don't touch the ground. We tried fixing it but nothing. It won't maneuver. Literally unusable. We were past the return window and we currently live outside the US. I'm so mad that we paid for this and then turned around and took it to recycling. DON'T PURCHASE

Title: Great Travel Stroller!
Body: This is a life saver! We traveled with family for a week, and the Summer 3D mini was so lightweight and easy to carry. As first time parents, we didn‚Äôt really look into travel strollers. Since we live in a place where the snow can get pretty thick, we bought a jogger stroller that has really huge wheels. We traveled with that and it was so difficult to carry as it was heavy and the wheels were just too big.So if you are looking for a lightweight and easy to travel with stroller, do not hesitate and get this one. You will not regret it. Easy to install, too!

I used this stroller like 3 times and don‚Äôt like it. I am returning it. It is light weight. And folding it also easy. But it doesn‚Äôt provide back support. Author: AmazonAholic
Title: Garbage- READ!
Body: What do you expect from a fifty dollar stroller? Not much. But, I expected all the wheels to turn and touch the ground. One of the front wheels doesn‚Äôt touch the ground all the time. The front wheels don‚Äôt turn 360* or even 180* so you have to tip it back onto the back wheels to make any sort of ‚Äúsharp‚Äù turn. It‚Äôs short. I‚Äôm 5 seven and it‚Äôs almost too short for me, my husband can‚Äôt push it at all without hunching over. We got this for a cruise where our jogger is way too big, and since we already have 2 other strollers we wanted something we could just use for a week and donate.. I took this on a trial run to the pediatrician and from the car and up the elevator I hate it. Definitely returning this stroller and scrambling to find something better.Pros:lightweightCompactAesthetically pleasingReclinesCons:Bad craftsmanshipToo short if you‚Äôre 5‚Äô8‚Äù or tallerPlastic wheelsWheels don‚Äôt spin 360*
