Body: This is perfect! Exactly what I wanted. Small & compact but still had spot for drinks and keys, and I love that there is a harness buckle and not just the lap buckle like the cheap strollers. I wish I would have known about this sooner.

Author: Melanie
Title: Bought for travel - Not impressed
Body: I bought this stroller for my small toddler to bring with us on a family trip. I wanted something lightweight, cheap-ish but fairly sturdy, and easy to maneuver. I like to think I'm pretty easy to please and try to give the benefit of the doubt, but I can't really do it with this one.Granted, you get what you pay for, but if this is what I get for $50 I may as well have gone super cheap and bought a $15 stroller from Walmart or Target. It was like the same thing and I wouldn't have expected anything more.The front wheels barely touch the ground and won't move forward after I reversed or turned. I had to bend down and turn the wheels the correct way again to move forward or the stroller would get stuck. When a stroller can't perform the basic function of moving, it's crap no matter how many other good features it has.The detachable hood kept getting detached from the stroller so it would pop out all the time. I had to fasten it back on anytime I folded and unfolded the stroller. When I got it back from TSA after gate-checking it, the visor was completely bent out of shape - not sure if the blame is on TSA for that or the design of the stroller.The positive to this stroller was that it was super lightweight and easy to quickly fold down (if you had nothing inside of it), and it comes with a cupholder with extra zip storage. But I'd like my strollers to move.

Author: ore
Title: For a Baby Shower list.
Body: It's light weight

Author: amm
Title: Wanted to love this
Body: This is a pain because the wheels only go one direction. Would have been much easier to maneuver with multi directional wheels. I will be buying a different one.

Author: HulaLyn
Title: Love it!!
Body: I purchased this stroller as a second stroller for quick and easy use. It works beautifully!! I love the adjustable rest positions and the visor comes in handy. Excellent, lightweight stroller!!

Author: Alexander K-y
Title: Not extremely light or compact when folded. UPD: lopsided
Body: We bought this for out 2 year old to take on occasional trips when she is tired and needs a nap/ ride. the size is good for her, she is a tall toddler. i think we can definitely get another year out of it. the assembly was easy, just pop the wheels in and attach the hood. Seems to be good quality for the money. she likes the footrest, on our previous stroller that broke, it was basically non existent. the recline is minimal, maybe just a couple of inches, but i think will be enough for her age. I would NOT recommend this stroller for babies who are not confident sitters yet, the seat is soft - does not have the bones in it and the child needs to rely on their own posture/ back to sit straight up. i'd say it's good from maybe 8 months up, depending on the child's individual development. the built-in cargo bag is a nice feature. the storage at the bottom is pretty small but same goes for all folding strollers. the height is very comfortable for us, 5-7, 5-10 family. did not test the wheels on our New York roads yet, but they seem fine, not too small. handles well. the hood is generous size. overall very satisfied. One con is when folded, it's still pretty long (definitely will take the width of our trunk) and not super light. There's no good way to carry it when it's folded, ex. no shoulder handle etc. so it's not a super compact stroller for sure. UPDATE: after taking for a ride, turned out the stroller is way more flimsy that i thought. One wheel does not touch the ground, so the entire frame is slightly lopsided, it's super annoying that wheel is just going crazy by spinning freely and the stroller does not move smoothly because of that.

Author: Doan
Title: Easy to use and travel with
Body: Easy to travel with. Light. Easy to open and close. One negative: some parts are a bit flimsy and gets re-shaped easily.

Author: Maria
Title: Disappointed! Tire does not spin!!
Body: One of the wheels does not spin or touch the floor. Very disappointed and not worth trying to return.

Author: Marika
Title: Not easy to maneuver
Body: We bought this for an upcoming trip since our other stroller is too heavy. This is lightweight and folds great, but... you can't multitasking. You have to have both hands on the stroller to make it move, the wheels also don't turn very well and I've found myself having to tilt the front end up and pivot it. That's my only complaint but unfortunately while this stroller meets my size requirements, it won't make my trip easier.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Its damage
Body: I was so excited about my baby new stroller but it arrived damaged with signs being used with scratches and hair around the wheel, this my second one I order and have the same issue. I will try a third time and see if its better

Author: Jason P. Kavanagh
Title: Good for 50 bucks
Body: Assembly was easy, folding and unfolding are easy. If i had to pick an issue i would say the overall height is a tad short for me, i find myself leaning over a bit while pushing and im only 5 9. Also the snaps for the overhang wont last very long IMO

Author: Crharri
Title: Buyer beware‚Ä¶.Not as advertised!
Body: This stroller does not have multi position recline as advertised.Very unfortunate, because this this the primary reason we purchased it.Definitely will be returning it!

Author: Michelle V.
Title: So convenient
Body: I bought this for my grandson who is 3 and is autistic so it's much safer for him to be in a stroller on walks and in public . It's a great stroller and I strongly recommend

Author: Veronica
Title: Me fascino
Body: Muy buena compra no le hace falta nada a las dem√°s caras jiji

Author: Kristina H.
Title: Best dang stroller!
Body: We have a huge stroller that we use for shopping trips but we were taking a family vacation with all 4 kids, we needed something compact but still comfortable with a sunshade because we were going to be outside ALOT for our trip. It reclines just enough for the 10 month old to still nap, his fan attached to the side with no problem as well as his toys. It has the 5 point harness so he couldn‚Äôt yeet himself out of the stroller. The little basket underneath held 3, 64 ounce water bottles just fine and the cup holders held his sippy cups with no problem too. This was the best $55 spent and I‚Äôll buy each one of my friends one that‚Äôs having babies too. I love it, so much better than the cheap umbrella strollers!!

Author: MBP
Title: Mini low end version. For a very small child or baby.
Body: Definitely mini. Photo compares a red average sized umbrella stroller to this mini stroller. My big 20lb baby fits nicely in it and I imagine he will grow out of it by 2 years old. It is too small for my averages sized 4 year old to sit in. Next time I would pay the extra money for the regular version. Non removable Cup holder nicely fits a bottle. A larger cup can easily spill. Zip storage space can hold a wallet but if not positioned correctly will cause the cups to spill out. The bottoms of the cup shares the same space. Fold very easily. Is very lightweight. Small under storage doesn‚Äôt hold much and is hard to access when reclined. Recline goes back a couple inches but is still in a sit up position. My Baby does not sleep well sitting up. Maneuvers fine but the plastic tires will not likely last long on city bumpy sidewalks. Seatbelt is easy to buckle. Overall it is a fine compact stroller for occasional use. Not an everyday stroller. Worth going up a model or two if you stroll every day. Shade is large and great for most angles of the sun.

Author: Ashley Kettner
Title: Great stroller
Body: We needed a new stroller for my toddler, and this one is great. He absolutely loves it. It also has great storage for us moms that always carry everything.

Author: AmazonProductReviewer
Title: Scratches Baby
Body: On July 1st, the seam of the plastic scratched my baby's left arm. Today is July 27th, and he now has a scar. Not impressed.

Author: Mikeisacooldude
Title: Broke Five Months
Body: Lightweight, cheap, broke after five months. That‚Äôs how I can sum it up. Go for the more expensive ones if you want one to last.

Author: Esmeralda
Title: Mine came ripped from seatbelt
Body: Yes it‚Äôs a nice stroller but mine came ripped from the seatbelt

Title: Great compact stroller!

The media could not be loaded.

The front wheels don‚Äôt move on both sides. And before you guys say my baby might be to heavy. He isn‚Äôt. He‚Äôs 17 pounds so there‚Äôs no excuse for this not functioning correctly. I‚Äôve changed the wheels nothings worked. I was sooooo excited for this stroller and although I‚Äôm not 100% disappointed I do believe just fixing the wheels would be a plus.

Body: It is not well made. Wheels on two sides are not even and the outside wheel on the right hardly touches the ground. Besides, the two handles are not of the same height.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: 10/10 recommend

Title: Terrible

Two of the wheels stopped spinning and was making it a difficult time to push. By the end of my 4 day vacation, this stroller is trashed! Take your good stroller. This thing is not light enough or more convenient. In the end you will hate it!

Body: As a first time dad, this was an amazing buy for me and my daughter. I can easily fold and unfold the stroller. Took a minute to figure out how to tighten straps tho there a bit unique in style. All in all tho works great and my Lil girl loves being pushed around the store instead of couped up in car seat.

Author: Milly G. Velez
Title: Comfortable and a breeze to maneuver.
Body: Love this light weight carriage. It maneuvers very well and it‚Äôs comfortable for my 20 month old toddler granddaughter. I also own a fold up carriage made by a well known expensive brand which is a total drag to maneuver. Presently I‚Äôm very happy with the Summer Infant 3D mini carriage.

Author: E
Title: Stopped working correctly
Body: Stopped working properly after what I consider minimal use

Author: gorunchelsea
Title: Zero Stars Deserved.
Body: We bought this stroller for a trip. Light weight compact- it seemed ideal! We were so very wrong. The first part braking occurred after we gently set it down in the bus to take us from the airport parking lot to the terminal. this was only the beginning! Since that first use, the seat ripped, the handle foam tore, and the most frustrating, the seat strap broke and could not be repaired. When we used it again on our return home (note, we left it in the car the entire trip because it was not safe), the front wheel was broken! This stroller is a JOKE and waste of $50. I learned, you get what you pay for.

This was the least expensive lightweight stroller I could find that could be delivered to our hotel in a timely fashion. I wouldn‚Äôt but for a full time stroller but if you need something cheap in a pinch, it will work for that, for a couple of weeks anyway.

Body: Between two kids, we‚Äôve gone through 4 strollers. This is my instant favorite stroller! It is easy to push with one hand, lightweight, and folds up small. I love the built-in cup holder and zipper pouch and area underneath. Most importantly it doesn‚Äôt take up my entire trunk. We got this for traveling and it‚Äôs the perfect stroller for that!

Author: anjellyca
Title: Front wheel doesn‚Äôt turn
Body: Purchased this to take on a trip as our City Select is SO heavy and difficult to travel with. I love how easy it folds & it is about half the weight of the Baby Jogger City Select. What I do not like is that the front wheel doesn‚Äôt turn. Sometimes it doesn‚Äôt even spin. I imagine if it worked properly I would‚Äôve rated this stroller 5 stars, but because it makes it difficult to maneuver when turning, I cannot give it 5 stars. I don‚Äôt regret purchasing it for this trip and avoiding the hassle of our huge city select stroller.

If you‚Äôre looking for a decent stroller that is great for limited travel space, this does the job.

Author: Knitty
Title: Folds eventually if you turn it upside down and bang on the bottom repeatedly with your shoes
Body: Wish I could return this!Bought this stroller specifically to take on the NYC subway. The weight is OK but the fold is impossible ‚Äî I had to turn the whole thing upside down and then basically stomp on the folding mechanism to get it to budge. We ended up carrying the whole thing up and down the subway stairs at every station. I would never recommend this stroller for use on public transit.My recommendation for bus or train: Either buy the $20-$30 cheapie umbrella stroller, which would fold better than this one and be smaller and lighter, OR get the Uppababy G-Lite, OR get the Yo-yo.

Author: Lorena
Title: I love it

Author: Kas
Title: Not Impressed
Body: I was never impressed with this stroller. I wanted a lighter weight stroller for my son (now 21 months). The front wheels never worked properly. All of them are not on the ground at the same time which makes steering impossible and annoying. Also the sun visor was bent in the box and never went back to the correct shape so after a few weeks I removed it. If everything worked properly it would be a good stroller for the price. It is lightweight and easy to pack in the car. The bottom pouch doesn't hold much but that's not a big deal for us. Back in the market for a new stroller since the one I received was not build well.

Author: Larkin's Surplus
Title: Cheap, wheels don‚Äôt rotate
Body: I just bought this stroller for a trip and we are about to go to Walmart and buy something else. The front wheels are not balanced so one wheel doesn‚Äôt touch the ground. Plus the front wheels don‚Äôt turn. It is so hard to maneuver. For the money, you would be better off with a $20 stroller from Walmart.

Body: Worst stroller I ever got. I regret this buy.

Author: Kate Fox

Body: I opted for this rather than a normal umbrella stroller and am glad I did. It was simple to put together. Very lightweight yet also sturdy. Extremely simple to open and close, and it latches itself when closed, so it won‚Äôt open again unless you want it to. The cup holders and basket are helpful also. The basket underneath isn‚Äôt large but still handy to have! The harness straps adjust easily also. All in all a great simple stroller!

Author: Kinley Farr
Title: Easy to use!
Body: This is a very lightweight and easy to use stroller. Opens and folds closed very easily. My 8 month old granddaughter is very comfortable in it. My daughter actually has a larger stroller but often prefers to use this one since it‚Äôs more compact. Takes up very little space in the trunk of my car.

Author: Sima Narine

Body: Very Poor Quality 100% garbage

Author: Isabell Parker
Title: Great inexpensive stroller
Body: I wanted something to push around the yard on the few days a week I watch the grandbaby.This works great for that and has no problem rolling through the grass yard. The canopy provides enough shade and it seems comfortable - my grandbaby is 6 months And I‚Äôm sure he‚Äôs going to fit in this for a long time to come. I like that the wheels lock so it doesn‚Äôt roll unless I want it to.On a hard surface one of the double front wheels doesn‚Äôt completely touch the ground - But it didn‚Äôt bother me enough to send it back for a refund it works just fine.

Author: Brandon Erlacher
Title: Simple, inexpensive easy-to-fold stroller!
Body: We got this to keep at our house for our grand child. The price was right and it fits the bill. Easy to fold and lightweight.

Author: allison

Body: Not strong enough to hold toddler in seat

Author: KaylaB
Title: Hate it
Body: I cannot describe how annoying this stroller is. There is next to no room in the basket underneath, the canopy might as well not even be there and the wheels don‚Äôt even all roll together. I just hate this stroller. Umbrella strollers yuck!

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Rear wheel axels bent
Body: The good: light weight, inexpensive compare to others, easy to use.The bad: front ‚Äústraight‚Äù wheel lock engages often, only reclines half way (both of these problems aren‚Äôt really a big deal). The big problem; rear axels bent and now it‚Äôs too difficult to pushWe bought for a vacation and it made it through that so it served its purpose‚Ä¶if it weren‚Äôt for the rear tires being all cattywhampus we‚Äôd probably still be using it often for the convenience as a small trunk stroller

Author: Rachel M Ball
Title: Great every-day lite-duty stroller
Body: Absolutely love this stroller! It is light weight, though not as light as some similar strollers. The basket is tiny but has been a bonus compared to the cheap Walmart umbrella stroller I picked up. The cup holder pouch holds my refillable water bottle without the bottle toppling out like it does in my Graco Verb. The sunshade covers quite a bit which is perfect for how much time we spend outdoors. For an umbrella stroller it maneuvers faily well, but does tend to pull or get stuck on bumps. So glad I bought this as a more compact option for quick outings and traveling!

Author: Mauri
Title: Perfect Lightweight
Body: This is absolutely perfect for traveling! It folds easy, moves great, and perfect for travel. It is now my go to airport pick for small kids!

Author: Tashika Amy
Title: front wheels dont move right
Body: The front wheel don't turn the right way. sometimes one or more of the wheels dont move at all. the pull tab on the back of the seat is really not supported

Author: Dee
Title: Piece of Junk
Body: This is a piece of junk it came to my house with the box busted up & holes in it! The wheels are cheap plastic and look like they have been used this was clearly a return directly shipped to me! The place for the baby to rest their feet is cheap plastic it‚Äôs just a cheap stroller overall the canopy is a joke . I was so excited to finally take my baby out this weekend with my stroller to find that i can‚Äôt even use it.

Author: Kaycee
Title: Should be cheaper...
Body: I do like how light weight and easy this stroller is to fold. I like the zipper pocket at the top. However, there are 2 wheels on each side at the front. Only one of those wheels actually touch the ground. The metal bar like thing you push up and down with your foot to open and close the stroller....I was walking in the mall and my foot accidentally hit the bar but not very hard and it caused the stroller to fold with my grandbaby in it. I did not realize it at first, I just noticed it didn't feel right while pushing, well, it's because it was folding up. My grandbaby wasn't hurt but still, it should be more secure. It shouldn't be that easy to unfold

Author: jacqueline
Title: The seating is very thin and your baby will fill the metal Bars
Body: I think the seating and back part can have cushion in it, it‚Äôs a cheap Stroller I guess you get what you pay for.

Author: Erika Olvera
Title: No great
Body: I like the how lightweight it is, however the front wheels are always turning or not turning making it hard ro maneuver.

Author: Sam
Title: Bang for your buck
Body: I live in NYC and was looking for a stroller that can easily maneuver and fold small. This takes the cake. Super easy set up. So light weight. 10/10 recommend

Author: Ed
Title: Wouldn‚Äôt recommend
Body: The front wheels don‚Äôt spin they stay straight wouldn‚Äôt recommend

Author: Emma
Title: Very cheap
Body: Very cheaply made. Awful wheels, rough material/loud where the kid sits, metal bar for folding and almost get pinched in every time. Not even worth the $50.

Author: Joe Hacobian
Title: Perfect for Airports AND braving the park
Body: My wife and I take our son for walks often and being 100lbs, she prefers lightweight strollers.The mini-stroller we'd been using had seen better days and frankly it was too short, didn't lock when folded and the wheels were too small to handle anything other than perfectly smooth concrete, forget grass.This stroller is amazing! Rugged yet still lightweight, she can fold it easily and it locks automatically, the wheels are large enough to handle grass, mulch, rough asphalt and concrete sidewalks with uneven joints.Highly recommended for children 1 year to 4 years!

Author: smes
Title: Does the job
Body: The front wheels do not turn, the hood gets detached very easily (can get lost during airline transportation). The rest is all good.

Title: Perfect for travel
Body: We were looking for a light affordable travel stroller to take to Europe this summer.Everything is really easy to assemble, wheels, canopy. Easy to open and close. The drinks carrier and pocket are a great addition. So far we are really happy with this purchase!

Author: Ashley H
Title: Make sure the front wheel locks are off!
Body: I keep reading reviews about the front wheels not turning. At first ours didn‚Äôt either and I was about to give up on this stroller, but then we looked closer at the manual and realized there are also front wheel locks! Once we figured that out it was smooth sailing. I‚Äôll bet the people who said the front wheels don‚Äôt turn easily had them locked without knowing.This stroller is exactly what we were looking for for summer activities, instead of lugging our big clunky full size one from our travel system. It folds up nicely and takes up way less room in the truck! The only things I wish it had were a storage bag and a cup holder for kiddo, but I‚Äôm sure I can find outside solutions for both. Overall great buy!

Author: Chelsea B
Title: The Best Stroller!
Body: I got the stroller 3 days earlier than expected and it was just in time for our trip out of town. After reading the reviews for the stroller, I had to try it. I‚Äôll say that it‚Äôs the best stroller I‚Äôve ever used with my daughter (this is the 3rd stroller I‚Äôve purchased in almost 3 years).I love that it reclines just enough for my daughter to sleep and sits up for her to see. The cover extends enough to completely block her face from the sun, partially block her face and of course to not block it at all.The storage space is good when the seat is not reclined, but becomes a bit tighter when it is reclined.The wheels are not hard to lock/unlock. It‚Äôs easy to fold and unfold and doesn‚Äôt take up a lot of storage space. Overall, this is a great traveling and everyday stroller.I‚Äôm satisfied with my purchase.

Author: Jane Austin
Title: Dirty wheels end up inside stroller when folded
Body: I wanted to like this stroller because it is lightweight with great maneuverability. Very nice-looking, nice cup holders, storage pouch and storage basket. It also fit easily into my car when folded.It‚Äôs easy to fold but unpleasant- you have to reach down to the exposed metal frame in the back, by the back wheels, and use your hand to pull it out and then push it up. The frame edges are sharp.I couldn‚Äôt get my 7-month old granddaughter strapped in because the hooks to detach the straps from the harness are very hard, rigid plastic. It took me a very long time to detach one, practicing in my living room, so that wouldn‚Äôt work out in the world. That was the deal-breaker.Another negative was the fact that when you fold the stroller, the wheels - and the dirt on them - end up right inside the canopy, and in close proximity to the seat back, which of course touches the child. I thought I could work around that by carrying a plastic bag to put over those wheels before putting the stroller away, if that had been the only thing I didn‚Äôt like. If you Google the stroller instructions to see how it folds up, you will see what I mean. Also, it doesn‚Äôt stand up when folded. If you lock the back wheels with the foot brakes, however, you can prop it against a wall or your car.When I found I couldn‚Äôt even get the straps over the baby‚Äôs shoulders because I couldn‚Äôt detach them to open them up completely, I decided to return it.

Author: Carrie Anne Moore
Title: Eh..
Body: Like that it's lightweight, I guess I received a dysfunctional stroller mine has never closed right it always gets jammed.

Author: Jenna Newell

The cover doesn‚Äôt cover the whole seat AND it unsnaps and pops off CONSTANTLY.Other than that, it works, my kid doesn‚Äôt hate it, and aside from the canopy it‚Äôs in one piece.

Author: Arthur J Kim
Title: Footrest Broke in 4 months & Customer Service is Patronizing
Body: A few years ago, I bought a stroller by Summer as we needed a pretty lightweight stroller for traveling overseas. It lasted about 18 months before the wheels started to get wobbly and the rubber/plastic footrest finally gave out.For our recent trip, I bought another one since my youngest is 4.5 and we only really needed it to travel and such. I noticed the quality wasn't as good, but I figured we'll be fine if I get 1 year out of it. The footrest busted in about 4 months and the wheels are already wobbly.I let the company know and was told that the warranty is only good for 90 days and The foot rest is not meant to be stood on at all, but is meant for the child to rest their feet on.Really? I wasn't supposed to have my child just stand on the footrest and just not use the seat to sit down? Figured I'd let people know about how much they stand behind their product.

Author: Koulton
Title: Good travel stroller
Body: This stroller has potential it‚Äôs lightweight it folds easily good for traveling however the wheels are very cheap and the stroller does not turn very well not recommended for trails other than that it‚Äôs a decent stroller for the price

Body: I wanted a smaller stroller in addition to our jogger. This is perfect for crowded areas on smooth surfaces only. We like this one because it reclines a little too. The only thing that sucks that other reviews have stated was the wheels are not leveled and they don‚Äôt maneuver well.

Author: Luis Ar. Zuniga
Title: Good stroller, terrible and unrealistic shipping
Body: The stroller works fine for what it‚Äôs worth, its simple stroller but gets the work done. However, both times (one for each grandparents home) I‚Äôve ordered them the shipping time frame they give you is a dishonest estimate. They take more than a week to arrive and claim YOU as a customer put the wrong address. Also, the ship them in a beat up box that arrives open and torn up. Very displeased with their shipping practices. Would highly recommended NOT to get them if you need them soon unless you have at least 1 1/2 weeks to wait for them.

Author: pamela
Title: Hard to use

Author: A. Rose
Title: Great value for basic portable stroller
Body: It's a convenience stroller. Can't go wrong here. It's not top end, but for the $45 price tag it feels pretty darn well made. Easy to fold and unfold, light, takes up little space. Basket to hold some basics and I love the zip pocket and bottle holders for the adult. I bought this for a 2 week road trip with my 7 month old and it was money well spent. Much less space taken in the car than my big expensive jogging stroller, and it's small size was a plus for going into stores, restrooms, and gas stations. We even used it on rough gravel and dirt trails where it really didn't belong but it did ok. Since I've been home I've still been using this one more than my big stroller, it's just so easy. I'm happy with my purchase. And I love the blue color, a real bonus for me!Cons: the hood is too small, it's pretty useless. And the seat angle is just not quite right. I've tried all the adjustments but my baby looks a bit slumped and uncomfortable in it, although he hasn't complained so it must not be too bad for him. I wouldn't use it for super long periods of time. He's very tall for his age, but maybe when he's older it might fit better? I definitely wouldn't recommend it for a younger baby.

If you are looking for a fancy high quality feeling stroller keep looking

So I had to have my husband rig it with hair ties that I had to get the strap to secure our son in it for the time being.

Body: We bought the Summer 3D Lite stroller for our family cruise and a trip the Disney with my 18 month old son. The plastic part that attaches the wheel scratched up my sons arm every time we set him in the stroller. They were pretty painful. We tried to file it down so it didn‚Äôt scratch up his arm anymore. Otherwise it was a decent stroller.

Also my child leans far forward in it. So she never can nap compared to my jogging stroller. But good quality and I can close and open with baby in arms.

It's just fabric that you tighten or loose in the back. So it's a little flimsy. But everything else I love. Easy to put together, easy to close. And wheels don't stick when turning. And the sun shade has great coverage.

Body: We got this as a vacation alternative to our big stroller There was a small metal part on the left from the rod that scratched my son! Didn‚Äôt notice till after we saw the scratches! No wonder he hated getting in it!! Parents make sure you check for no sharp edges!! So mad!!

It just feels cheap all the way around; the straps, the wheels, the mechanism to raise and lower the back of the seat. On my particular unit, the right set of wheels doesn‚Äôt touch the ground when strolling‚Ä¶Fine for what it is but wouldn‚Äôt say it‚Äôs even worth this amount of money.

For example, you need a stroller maybe four times in a year, or you need one for very short walks around the neighborhood.If you are after comfort for your baby, and if you want durability, look elsewhere.They even short changed the sun visor! If you extend it to shade the baby‚Äôs face from the sun, the baby has to sit ALL the way back against the seatback in order to be shaded. It‚Äôs too shallow.

Also it doesn‚Äôt fold and unfold easily. Going through security with bags and holding an infant I was expecting to be able to fold and unfold this thing with one hand but was unable to without a struggle. Author: Amazon Customer

Body: I bought this one because it advertised it was ok for up to 35lbs. and I thought good just for travel o use between flights, not outside much. I found that the wheels in the front would not maneuver very well even on slick flooring indoors. My grandson is 30 lbs with clothes and I did not hang anything on the handle bars.What I did like was easy fold, light weight, seating seemed comfortable for grandson with front rubber bar he could rest his feet and the attached cup holder worked fine, not stiff so no problem when folded.

Author: Amazon Customer

Author: Krystle K.

Body: A really nice compact, lightweight, easy to use stroller. I got this so that we don‚Äôt always have to lug our jogging stroller around and it was the best $50 purchase.

Author: DJ
Title: Game Changer
Body: We bought this stroller as a smaller option to use in airports/on vacations. It was a lifesaver on our trip and we have since used it on many other occasions. It's lightweight and super easy to maneuver. I was able to fold it and unfold it with one hand while holding my baby while going through security. I would recommend this stroller to everyone!

Author: Vanessa A
Title: Buena relaci√≥n entre precio y calidad
Body: Result√≥ una buena compra en comparaci√≥n con el precio, llevo dos meses us√°ndole con un ni√±o de 4 a√±os y se mantiene en buen estado

Author: John Gleason
Title: Does not turn well
Body: It‚Äôs easy to fold, can do it while holding baby with one hand. I like that the handles are taller than a traditional Umbrella stroller. Only bought it because my bob is very cumbersome to travel with. It does NOT turn at all. The wheels don‚Äôt even move. Going straight is fine but that‚Äôs it. I had to physically lift the stroller anytime i wanted to turn. So in the airport for limited use it‚Äôs fine but other than that it‚Äôs a terrible stroller.

Author: melissa maradei
Title: Falls apart
Body: Lost nutts off the stroller with in 1 week. Went to return for replacement and amazon made it hell. Fixed it myself but be careful unless you are at least a little handy to do repairs

Author: Robert Guzman
Title: Perfect size for compact car
Body: We bought this to fit in my wife‚Äôs Honda Fit, which could fit a regular stroller but we lost all space if we needed to go grocery shopping or use the trunk for anything. This freed up tons of space and now we don‚Äôt have to keep taking the regular stroller in and out every time we need to use the trunk.

Author: Erica
Title: decent
Body: So I wanted a backup light stroller and this does the job. It‚Äôs not that compact and not the lightest. Kind of bulky when folded up. The front wheels are a little tricky to unlock. You actually have to put the stroller upside down and press the unlock button. If you try to unlock with it standing normal it won‚Äôt work. Other than that it works fine around the block and the color is nice and chic. Basket space is decent and the upper compartment for drinks is a nice plus. The shade is held on by Velcro so it doesn‚Äôt open flush consistently. Doesn‚Äôt seem to have that much back support but my chunky 9 month old doesn‚Äôt seem to be bothered by it.

Author: FishnChic
Title: Perfect for my needs as a Grandmother
Body: This stroller is not the best of the best, but I wasn't willing to spend $300 on a stroller to be used once or twice a month. It IS sturdy, and easy to fold. Wheels are wide and easy to maneuver through rocks and soft dirt. I have 2 grandsons, one twice as big as the other, and changing the straps to fit each one is easy. Highly recommend.

Author: Dana
Title: Not worth the price - a little cheaply made
Body: Not quite what I was hoping to receive. The wheels are a cheap plastic and it doesn't recline back very far at all, nor does it have any support in the back. I bought it to use when I'm watching my new grand-baby (2 mths). I hope it will do the job, he wasn't to happy in it when we recently tried it out. Its not awful but I wouldn't buy it again! I'd research something that's a little more sturdy and better quality.

Author: Gross Reader
Title: Bought for cruising with a toddler
Body: This stroller came highly recommended especially to use on a cruise for toddlers. It is small, does fit in the doors of a cruise cabin and is lightweight. Beyond that, it‚Äôs nothing ‚Äúspecial‚Äù. The front wheels are stiff making it difficult to maneuver the stroller. While the seat does recline, it doesn‚Äôt lay back. So it‚Äôs not great for napping. And when you have the seat in an upright position it eventually sags into the reclined position. I do like that it has a cup holder and place for your phone and keys and a small basket underneath. Im not in love with the stroller but I don‚Äôt hate it either.

Author: Amanda Thorp
Title: Broke on first use
Body: I saw so many good reviews for this product, so i bought it for a disney trip. The first day of our trip (and the first time using the stroller) the handle broke. The metal completely snapped. We had an entire day at the park and couldn't push the stroller with no handle, so we still had to rent a stroller at the park. We couldnt carry the stroller with us all day, so we unfortunately had to throw it away after determining it was not fixable. I can't ask for a refund or replacement because I dont have the stroller to return :/.Disappointed for sure after having such high hopes.

Author: Bella Roberts
Title: Don‚Äôt buy this item
Body: I hate this item. The wheels lag and would work better for a doll moral of this story this stroller is deciving and horrible do not buy this!!

Author: Erin
Title: Does not recline
Body: I specifically purchased this because it advertises ‚Äúmulti position recline‚Äù But upon receiving it, I realized it does not actually recline at all. Wasted my money

Author: KD
Title: They don't lie about it being for shorty's...
Body: I am 5'5 and it's perfect...my husband is 6' and it's a tad too low for him. The cup holders will hold a standard can (like a can of soda) or water bottle, but they will not hold a large tumbler. I was very impressed by the overhead shade, it comes down much further than the picture lets on, so the kid's face is out of the sun. It's good for sidewalk walks--This will not do in rough terrain...i.e. anything off-road, so if you're preparing to do a lot of grass/woods walks, go for something more heavy-duty. It folds up easy and it's about the same weight as a car seat w/o the kid. Worth the price!

Author: FP
Title: Be careful with assembly. Read carefully!
Body: Good stroller for the money. Very lightweight. Take your time putting together. I misassembled one if the wheels and it could not be undone to correct it. Even though that was on me giving a 4

It also has good sized wheels- which helps it function as a stroller well, but keeps it from being super small and super lightweight. It‚Äôs great for what it is though. The only objection I have to it is that the handle length is non-adjustable, and it‚Äôs like 2 inches too short to be super comfortable for an all day event. For running through the airport, or parking at a game, it‚Äôs great though.

Sounds like plenty of folks have no issues so it seems like we just got a crappy defective one, and we don‚Äôt use it much so we are outside of the return window or it would be going back because it‚Äôs pretty much useless and harder to push than any other stroller me lol or my husband have used. The fold down isn‚Äôt the easiest (takes me both hands), but it‚Äôs very lightweight, skinny, and handles fairly well. Having used the traditional Summer stroller I prefer that one, but this does the job.

The child sits too far forward in the seat so that they have constant pressure at their perineum/diaper area.. The mechanism to recline is a joke, trying to get it back up from reclining with a child in it is crazy hard. I recommend the delta pilot instead for $10 more...

This stroller is definitely a step up from the old umbrella stroller I had for my daughter. Haven‚Äôt used it with a kiddo yet but it seems to maneuver well. Some reviewers complained that their front wheels don‚Äôt turn but I have a feeling that‚Äôs user error. The front wheels have a gray lever which when up, lock the wheels from turning. When the lever is clicked down, the wheels will spin completely. Looking forward to many adventures with our LO and this stroller!

Body: I got this because it was lightweight and looked nice for my 6 month old. The wheels don't turn which means I cant go anyway but forward or backwards with ease. Some of the tires stay off the ground. I'm disappointed.

Author: A & J
Title: Here‚Äôs how you close the stroller
Body: I cannot be the only one who could not figure out how to close this thing. After 45 minutes of trying to physically close it, reading every Amazon review (and just seeing that it‚Äôs hard to close but not HOW to close it), and watching multiple videos, I finally figured it out. You kick up the metal bar on the back, THEN pull the latch at the bottom away from the bar. Then it collapsed no problem. I honestly haven‚Äôt even put the wheels on because I was going to return it I was so frustrated, so I have no idea if it rolls well or how the canopy is. The whole thing is very flimsy, but I was looking for something super compact.

Author: Lorena Maldonado
Title: Practico

Also height wise I would be aware that the handles come up low thus you will be leaning to push it if you are over 5'5 which can cause your back to ache.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Not my favorite
Body: This stroller is easy to fold and is lightweight. That‚Äôs all I like about it. The sun shade doesn‚Äôt stay in place and is very flimsy and cheap. The front wheels do not turn and I have to tilt the stroller onto the back wheels to turn (not great if you have a cup in the cup holders). The storage bin underneath is hardly a storage bin. It‚Äôs not accessible at all, can‚Äôt get anything in or out unless it‚Äôs very tiny. This was a cheap stroller so you get what you pay for I suppose.

Author: Kindle Customer
Title: Works great as a travel stroller

This stroller just wasn‚Äôt for me.

It looks nice and not heavy but it is not worth the price and doesn‚Äôt recline. Buy a different stroller I don‚Äôt recommend this one I will be returning it.

The cup holders are nice and I like that it is lightweight. There isn‚Äôt much room under the seat. I can‚Äôt recline my baby much and it doesn‚Äôt seem that comfortable for him.Edit: 4 stars to 2 stars. My toddler is almost 2 1/2, still not even 30 lbs and this stroller is cheap and flimsy. It‚Äôs made for very short people.My daughter also stood up in it while I was walking her and immediately went face first into the sidewalk. My fault for not having her bucked in, but I‚Äôve never bucked her into any of our strollers before. This was a first. Materials are nice but it‚Äôs poorly designed.

Body: The good parts of it is the stroller is lightweight and very easy to fold away and open up.The parts I haven‚Äôt liked from day one and have just keep getting worse is the maneuverability. The front wheels are just off kiltered and are getting worse every time we‚Äôve used it, probably like 8-10 times now. Not a smooth ride at all. It‚Äôs like if you got shopping cart with the wheel that gets jammed up, it still works but it‚Äôs super annoying.I‚Äôm also not super happy about the way the baby is slouched down in the stroller, we‚Äôve tried adjusting it and it doesn‚Äôt make much of a difference.Overall, I‚Äôm not happy with the purchase.

Author: Katherine
Title: Amazing. Better than my $500 one
Body: What a great purchase. As a first time mom 2 years ago I bought the extravagant $500 stroller after weeks of research and comparisons. I think I‚Äôve used it a handful of times because it didn‚Äôt fold up compact and was so heavy to lug in and out of car.I have already used this $40 stroller more in the past week. So light it‚Äôs a total of about 8 pounds, folds easily with 2 easy latches that snap into place. Small basket underneath, and 2 cup holders which surprisingly don‚Äôt spill easily. Used in airport and maneuvers great. Can go up sidewalks and bumps easy.My guy is 2 years and 4 months old, fits great and room to grow. Feet do not have any issues dragging on the ground like other reviews I saw

The wheels would get stuck or caught up on themselves often. I wish I could give this a higher review but I wouldn‚Äôt use this for any major walking/ event.

Body: the UPS driver told us when he dropped it off it might be damaged before we even opened it. Well, we opened it, and the back wheel's metal knob that holds the wheel on was broken off. We could hear it rolling around in the box. We were able to push it on, but I didn't feel it was safe for my son, so we are returning it. I will probably still get it as it was a good height and what we were wanting, but just disappointed as it took over a week to get to us.

Author: Demetrio D.

Author: kiarra t.
Title: Great Stroller!
Body: I brought this stroller today from somewhere else and I set it up and I love how it looks its kinda light ! (I'm a weakling) its easy to put together and you can keep it in the car and I love the fold up lock system it seems very secure and it's just perfect can't wait to put my little 6 month old cutie pie in and take her for a stroll. I'd say definitely a good stroller and the price is great if you don't wanna spend a ton of money

Author: Michelle C
Title: Wheel already broke after one month
Body: Love how light and small this stroller is- so perfect for travel! It made flying across the country with my toddler so much easier- I could push him in it, roll it folded, or carry it through the airport. It‚Äôs a pretty basic stroller but meets my needs- adequate underneath storage, cup holder for parents built in, decent sun shade, can recline a bit.CONS: one of the back wheels is stuck with the brake on- it seems to have broken somehow because when I release the brake, the back wheel still won‚Äôt spin. Super frustrating!!! I‚Äôve only had it a month and used it about a dozen times. Other issue is that my toddler is tall, and so while he is well below the weight limit, his feet drag on the wheels or ground unless by some miracle he keeps them on the footrest.Overall love this stroller, but super disappointed that it broke so soon after purchasing.

Author: Bobby Davidson
Title: Unsatisfied with this purchase
Body: These are cheaply made strollers and I was looking for a small but durable stroller so was unsatisfied with this purchase

Author: Saeideh
Title: Nice stroller
Body: lovely

Author: I. Giron
Title: Great Light weight travel stroller, 3Dmini vs Kolcraft Cloud
Body: I bought this stroller because I wanted a second light weight stroller for second vehicle. I also thought it may be better quality than our Kolcraft cloud stroller. Upon comparison this stroller has a larger basket, better safety harness, built in fabric drink holders, locking mechanism for front tires, a fabric adjuster for inclining the seat and maybe two more inches in height on the handles. The cons.. shade provided not as good as the Kolcraft, tires are a bit shorter, although a little bit wider, the seat may get got because of lack of air flow unlike Kolcraft which has a back that you can roll up which is great if you live in a very hot area because it allows for air flow, the locking mechanism in back seems a bit unsafe and could easily be accident pushed unlike the Kolcraft cloud. Overall, I like this item just as well as the Kolcraft but price point in better on the Kolcraft Cloud. As far as delivery, arrived several days after delivery date.

Author: Chenelleyy
Title: Does not fold and front wheels dont work
Body: Very light way. Would be perfect for travel but it does not fold and front wheels dont work, making turning difficult

Author: lola
Title: My baby is super comfortable in this stroller.
Body: i love it! Absolutely easy to fold and its super light!

Author: Hannah Foley
Title: Not impressed
Body: Good stroller until it moves. The maneuverability is horrible. Just wish it was overall better. I was not personally impressed

Author: Iveth
Title: Perfecto justo lo q esperaba
Body: Todas mis espectativas fueron al 100% con este producto

Author: SugarSugar
Title: Great for the price
Body: I got the stroller because I live in NYC and the buses have a stupid rule that strollers must be folded but you can totally bring a shopping cart full of stuff and not fold that. But I digress. My main requirements in an umbrella stroller was that it should have the basket. The basket in this stroller is fine it is harder to use than the basket in a larger full-size stroller but that makes sense and I don‚Äôt expect it to be any better, this had a pleasant surprise of having cupholders in the back and I love them. There‚Äôs also a zippered pocket in the back I keep baby wipes in there and an extra mask, sometimes my keys but you can literally put anything in there like a phone or whatever it is great. My main complaint about the stroller is not the stroller it‚Äôs self in anyway but the horrible YouTube videos I watched about an hour worth of different videos and I could not figure out how to fold it, it was driving me crazy. Then I googled and found simple instructions which were not included with the stroller for some reason and the photo instructions showed to pull out the hook at the bottom before trying to kick up the metal piece in the back, success.

Author: Melisa
Title: Durable
Body: Great

Author: Mercedes B√°ez

Body: Es muy pr√°ctico perfecto para lo que necesitaba pero la tela muy mala calidad me lleg√≥ agrietado osea roto

Author: BH
Title: Works great as a lightweight..
Body: Great only for when I cant fit the big stroller in trunk due to other stuff BUT I wish the seat would adjust better for reclining(doesnt even recline much) & the top doesnt block much sun wish it eould go further down. Storage underneath can barely fit anything but a tiny bag or so but I expected that not have much room since it is a lightweight stroller. Got this only for when need to travel on a plane or if no space in trunk at times..

Author: JB
Title: Cute, but flawed
Body: Super cute and convenient design, but a few cons:-Son who is barely 20lbs didn‚Äôt fit comfortably.-Front wheels are impossible to turn-Storage is too small

Author: Topiwala
Title: It‚Äôs not good
Body: It‚Äôs not that strong

Author: Tiffany K
Title: Worked well when traveling
Body: Worked perfectly for us when traveling. Make sure you know how to fold/unfold though! I actually had a TSA agent show me üòÖMy only complaint is about the wheels. They don't turn very well like my on other stroller. Its not one fluid motion.Anyway, it was worth the money for us!

Author: Lisa McRoberts
Title: Perfect for traveling
Body: First of all, I was kind of skeptical about purchasing this stroller based on reviews that people had written about how the front wheels didn‚Äôt turn on their strollers, but there was one reviewer that said to unlock the wheels and it would maneuver just fine (I‚Äôm sorry I don‚Äôt remember who that was), so I made the purchase. I‚Äôll admit, I didn‚Äôt figure out how to unlock the front wheels until we were through security at the airport, but I hadn‚Äôt tried it until then, and while it‚Äôs very simple, you do have to push down on the little lever tab kind of hard to get it to click. I was a little nervous I was going to break it because it‚Äôs not super substantial, but once it clicked I never re-locked the front wheels (back wheels also have locks).I specifically purchased this stroller for a trip to the mountains of Colorado with my 18-month old daughter. I was flying there to meet my parents and I wanted something smaller than the other two strollers we currently had because I was going to be in the airport by myself with my kid (plus luggage). This stroller met all of my needs and to my surprise was very resilient on crushed granite mountain roads! Now would my BoB or Vista have worked better? 100%, but the thought of having to gate check either of those strollers gave me so much anxiety. This $50 umbrella stroller is so worth the purchase, I can‚Äôt recommend it enough! I hope this helps someone make their decision.TL;DR: unlock the front wheels and this stroller will be your best friend while traveling.

Author: Carol
Title: Wheels keep falling off. Have to contact the company.
Body: Love this product except the wheels keep falling off.

Author: My
Title: More like a toy
Body: Not what I expected. There's no room for the baby to grow. It's so small it's like a toy. I wish I would have just went to Walmart to purchase a stroller. So I could have seen what I was purchasing. Way over priced for what you get .Don't waste your money.

Author: Kathrine
Title: Compact and easy to store
Body: I bought this stroller to bring along on my N. Carolina vacation! We had limited space in the car, so my initial thought was to get an umbrella stroller but I shy'd away from it because there was no storage capabilities. This stroller exceeded all my expectations and then some and I am so glad I purchased it. The cup holders secure your cup and there is a little zipper pouch that you can put your phone or keys into as well. The storage space underneath the stroller is pretty limited, but was still good enough to hold my diaper bag and a few other smaller things that I purchased when shopping. The stroller folds up just like an umbrella stroller and is lightweight. My daughter is almost 3 years old and around 30 pounds, she was very comfortable in the stroller and never seemed to want to get out of it! Highly recommend this stroller to anyone that is limited on space.

Author: OH, it's jason
Title: A simple bargain stroller
Body: We bought one of these strollers to squeeze in the car for vacation. It was easy to assemble, takes up a lot less space than our usual stroller, and worked great. It isn't as supportive or sturdy as a bigger stroller, but if you need something portable for a toddler who can sit up on their own this is a great option for a fair price.

Author: Teresa
Title: no shade
Body: hated it everytine i used it. too small when my son fell asleep his body tilted forward absolutely no shade the thing wouldnt stay on so i just took it off. used to hit himself with the two metal bars one on the left one on the right cuz its soo small. i recomend u only buy for an energency but not everyday use it sucks

Author: Janet
Title: Good buy
Body: I have to say for the price it‚Äôs good quality with a few exceptions of the wheels . I read some reviews didn‚Äôt like the canopy was too high but you can actually bring it down closer to your child for coverage handles are comfy bottle holder is great small storage on bottom but I‚Äôm ok with that easy to assemble and I love it gives me 90 days to return . Only thing I would say they can improve e is making straps to buckle in a little longer for bigger kids .

Author: Carolyn Lively
Title: Just what I wanted.
Body: My great grandson and to take him out in my yard, etc. Perfect.

Author: Yia
Title: Convenient
Body: Very convenient product and easy to use. Easy to fold, move around, and does not take a lot off space. Great for traveling with the little one.

Author: Amy Smith
Title: Wheels don't turn!
Body: Got this for a road trip to have a smaller stroller for the car.....wish I would of read the reviews! Yes it's light and saves space. But baby wants to get out after 10 minutes....Im thinking it's because she isn't comfortable, she has no problem staying put for long walks in her other stroller. And as for making turns, horrible the slightest turn is impossible unless you pick up the front wheels. So if your only going to be going straight for less then 10 minutes it will be a fine stroller.

Author: Trinity Johnson
Title: Front wheels did not turn!
Body: The wheels on the front did not move to turn made use very hard, I would not recommended for this reason

Author: Jillian Benedettini
Title: Broke on first use.
Body: Not easy to unlock but easy to fold. It‚Äôs lightweight but the wheel was broken upon arrival, attempted to fix and use but it broke permanently while in the airport so we had to throw it away and can not send back for return.

Author: Lauren
Title: Great for travel
Body: I took my 13 month old on a trip by myself so I got this specifically for the airport. I was able to easily fold and unfold one handed while going through security. It‚Äôs very lightweight and durable. My baby seems comfortable in it too.

Author: Breona
Title: Cheap.
Body: Cheap....bought it for our trip to NY. Brake broke and got stuck in between the wheels. Most of the time it did not roll. I think we had a defect order.....some of the wheels did not touch the ground or turn.

Author: Alexis Callahan
Title: Decent, but reviews hyped it up too much.
Body: I was kind of disappointed with the quality of the material. But for the price, I guess it‚Äôs to be expected. The steering and the maneuverability is awful. The storage underneath is a decent size for the size of the stroller but it is very hard to fit anything in it because of the framing blocking it. You almost have to shove everything in through the sides before loading your child. Overall, it‚Äôs not a horrible stroller and it will get the job done, but I may have expected too much after reading all the reviews praising it.

Author: Pamela Smith
Title: I really don‚Äôt care for this stroller
Body: It isn‚Äôt very smooth riding or pushing at all. I wish I could send it back

Author: Jessica Johnson
Title: Nice travel stroller
Body: Light weight, and convenient size. It‚Äôs not easy to fold up one handed and the wheels are a little funky, but it works really well for our travel stroller when I don‚Äôt want to lug the big one around. The cup holders are great, the under carriage pocket just barely holds her diaper bag, or two sweatshirts and my pocket book.

Author: France C.
Title: Perfect
Body: My one year old like it

Author: Cynthia G. Lane
Title: Back wheels easily broke
Body: I got this a couple days ago and the back wheels are already broken. I need replacement wheels or something. I love the stroller but I‚Äôm so bummed about the wheels.

Author: Kathy Moore
Title: Stroller wheels don‚Äôt even spin
Body: The stroller wheel doesn‚Äôt even touch the ground. You push it & it doesn‚Äôt spin because it‚Äôs lopsided. Not impressed

Author: Katie
Title: DO NOT BUY
Body: DO NOT BUY. Were currently at the airport, this is the first time we‚Äôre using this stroller (apart from a quick test drive in the house) and the wheels don‚Äôt work. They‚Äôre all unlocked, but stuck and not rolling. This is going to be a long trip. Going to return or request a refund.

Title: Just ok

Author: yassir zahroof
Title: Terrible product don‚Äôt buy!!!
Body: I had purchased this stroller for travel. It hasn‚Äôt been 3 days and the stroller broke. The latch used to lock the stroller open broke and wouldn‚Äôt stay open. My child was in the stroller and it kept folding. Very unsafe. I had to leave the stroller in the street at a garbage can. SAVE YOUR MONEY!! NOT RECOMMENDED!!

Author: Savannah Thompson
Title: Broke the 3rd time we used it..
Body: This stroller is simply not worth a dime. We bought it for vacation. While on vacation we were shopping at an outlet mall and the seat of the stroller caved in. One of the screws that‚Äôs holds the seat in place snapped in half. For being a brand new stroller this is extremely disappointing. Our daughter is well within the weight limit as well (she is only 22 lbs). This happened on the 2nd day of our vacation, leaving us with no stroller for rest of our 9 day trip. DO NOT BUY THIS STROLLER.

Author: Kristen D.
Title: Very small age window of usability, get something that will last longer
Body: Pros: super easy to fold and unfold, very light weight, takes up minimal space in the trunkCons: the front wheels do noy turn easily and our left front wheel basically doesn't even touch the ground for some reason, my son is still 10 lbs under the max, but he's outgrown the stroller, so he leans forward and his feet touch the ground so we sometimes have to tip it to the back 2 wheels so he doesn't drag his feet (main reason I'm in the market for a new stroller), the under basket is basically useless for anything larger or more structured than a sweatshirt because the crossbars that allow it to fold block the opening and it's tiny, the handles are short (I'm 5'6 and have to hunch forward, so pushing it for any extended period of time is uncomfortable, but it's perfect for my 12 yo to push as she's 5'1), the shoulder straps click into the crotch buckle, making it super easy for my son the pull his arms out which gives him way too much reach if we're in a store with breakables or something, and lastly, there's no snack tray available for this even to purchase separately, which makes keeping track of a snack cup and sippy more difficult.FINAL VERDICT: this would be a good stroller for maybe 6 months to 12 months and that's about it (I wouldn't go younger because while the seat does recline slightly, that puts the child resting on the crossbars which I can't imagine is comfortable).

Author: damaris413
Title: Not Recomend
Body: Canoppy keeps falling, very hard to maneuver wheels don't rotate for turns.

Author: crystal

Author: MsGarito
Title: Returned after one use (and one attempted use)
Body: Had high hopes based on reviews but this one isn‚Äôt going to work for us. The wheels are made of plastic and didn‚Äôt all touch the ground on flat surface, so there is definitely a balance issue there. The second time I tried to use the stroller one of the wheels was stuck in the ‚Äúlocked‚Äù position and wouldn‚Äôt roll. The folding mechanism was sticky and definitely needed two hands. A friend has the model one (possibly two) price points up and it looks like the wheels and folding mechanism are much more functional and of better quality. I may purchase one of those after returning this one.

Author: Not Hollywood
Title: My friend's daughter was so happy with this portable stroller
Body: I bought this stroller for a friend's daughter, a shower gift. The mother-to-be was so happy with this gift and said it would be the stroller she took with her on her long move across the country!

Author: Heather Sanchez

Author: Amazon Customer

Body: I purchased this stroller in February and first used it in March. It's now June and the stroller is unusable. Today one of the wheels broke off. Obviously inoperable now.

Author: ELLE B.
Title: Perfect lightweight stroller for a quick jaunt
Body: Got this stroller as a potential candidate for going to Disney. Both my husband and I have differing opinions on whether our kid will need it there at 5 and he didn‚Äôt want to bring down our larger stroller. However, this one isn‚Äôt as easy to steer, doesn‚Äôt have as much storage underneath and doesn‚Äôt have as much of a recline for napping as we would like as my thought is at Disney she will get tired and want to fall asleep in the stroller. So- perhaps not a Disney candidate.Here‚Äôs the good- I love that this stroller takes up a fraction of the space as the chicco bravo we have. It is easy to fold and unfold when you figure out how to do it, but it is awkward to fold compared to our one handed fold on the Chico Bravo. It also noticeably lighter. I will plan to leave this one in the car for when we‚Äôre just going somewhere quickly like into stores. But for Disney I think we‚Äôll just take our chicco bravo.

Author: Touseef Nawaz Khan
Title: Unfortunately didn‚Äôt work for us.
Body: We got this product after reviewing few other options: unfortunately didn‚Äôt work for us. The durability is all good, but left a lot of scratches on our daughters left arm. I‚Äôve attached pics for your review. When we notice the first scratch we didn‚Äôt really know how it happened. But later when ever we used it saw new small scratches, the big one happened last evening, we initiated a return.

Author: konard edwards
Title: work very well
Body: very good

Author: MJ
Title: Excellent
Body: So easy to open, close and manuver. Have used many and this was the easiest without getting pinched when trying to close/fold up.

Author: Ashley SB
Title: It served a purpose
Body: Only got this to drag around Disney or I would be upset. The fold is done by an exposed piece of metal that you have to bend under the seat to release! The front wheels kept locking into a forward only mode rather than rotating (which is an odd feature for a stroller this size with static back wheels to have anyhow.). Basket is barely useable. It only fit a pack of wipes and a couple diapers and even that was impossible to reach once baby was in the stroller. The seat is so unstable that by day three, my baby realized she could hold on to the sides and pull herself up (I was afraid she would flip forward out of the stroller!!) not great! It did not seem safe in the least!

Author: jose marin
Title: Holes in fabric
Body: √çtem shows holes as it was expose to cockroaches...

Author: Chace Matthews
Title: Not worth it
Body: Never have I been disappointed with an ‚ÄúAmazon Choice‚Äù item until this arrived.

Author: Julie
Title: Great stroller for price
Body: This is a great stroller for price. The back is easy to adjust and easy to fold. Folds very compact so will be great for our vacation in few weeks for plane. Son loved sitting in it even cried when I took him out. Love that it‚Äôs got cup holders and zipper for cell phones. One down fall is basket underneath is not big enough to hold a diaper bag.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Small and compact with all the bells and whistles
Body: Perfect stroller for grandparents! I wanted something that was small and light weight but still had the convince of a basket and cup holders. This is perfect to keep tucked away at my house for those days that our grandson visits.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Nice compact option
Body: I needed an alternative to my infant car seat/stroller combo and this works perfectly.. takes up less space in the car and is lighter to get in and out . Easy for quick shopping trips or the park. Assembly was easy (once I found the instructions that were folded up inside of the folded seat). Maneuvered well at the park. The basket is small but that is the trade off with a more compact stroller

Author: Kindle Customer
Title: It‚Äôs cool
Body: It‚Äôs light weight and so much better then the regular big strollers. I bought this stroller when my daughter was 3 months and she fit good. The only downside is it‚Äôs hard to open it and the plastic wheel has a mind of its own at times.

Title: Is very compact!
Body: I love this stroller!

Author: Deb P

Body: Easy to use. Wish it reclines a little more and that the top provided more shade.

Author: Zbenny
Title: just whip it out like an umbrella.
Body: had it for a year so far it takes up like hardly any trunk space, works every time i need it, just whip it out like an umbrella and the baby's fine. i dont go anywhere without at least this one nearby. weighs like 2 umbrellas, no problems with maneuvering its pretty small even good while shopping.

Author: Jk

Body: I wanted to love this stroller, but all wheels would not balance nor rotate..

Author: Amanda Bishop
Title: This is a very nice stroller.
Body: This is a very nice stroller. I wanted something more compact than the big stroller I already have for traveling. This is perfect. But I strongly believe that the wheels are backwards. The ones that move are on the back instead the front like they should be making it difficult to turn. Other than that it is very well made and very sturdy. I put almost all my weight on it and it held up very well. (I weigh 200lbs) So I believe it can hold more than 50lbs.

Author: Poly
Title: Visor is not as shown
Body: I like how the stroller folds. The visor is not as shown in photo... EXTREMELY disappointing as I live in Florida and the visor is the reason I decided to purchase. It also pops on and off to connect/disconnect visor. Can be extremely dangerous. It also came with markings and an strong odor that subsided a bit after being opened. I was under the impression my stroller was new but it seems they sent a used one. I'm not sure just an assumption.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Front wheels don't swivel
Body: So far The front wheels don't swivel. Unbelievable

Author: Amy Click
Title: Not a good purchase.
Body: Not really impressed. I‚Äôm sending it back and I‚Äôll be purchasing a better stroller. It‚Äôs not easy to fold, my husband pinched the crap out of his finger trying to fold it up. My daughter looked and was clearly uncomfortable sitting in it. It doesn‚Äôt recline well either. The tires were so uneven as well! Just overall not a good purchase.

Author: D
Title: Very sturdy
Body: I gave it as a gift. It was sturdy and looks like it will last forever!

Author: Danielle G.

Body: Looks great, sturdy, easy to use, perfect for going on a flight. Only thing missing is storage basket under or in back of stroller.

Author: JnK Gibbs
Title: Great inbetween sized stroller!
Body: It was easy to put together. The color is just as the picture showed it to be which was a black and really pretty blue. The stroller folds and unfolds nicely too. It is a great in between full sized and umbrella stroller with spots to store stuff while still being light weight and folding like an umbrella stroller.

Author: StephanieS
Title: Difficult to maneuver
Body: Wheels do not turn the way a normal stroller does. Makes it very difficult to maneuver. One of the front wheels, of mine, doesn‚Äôt touch the ground all the way. I do like the sunshade, but there is no ventilation if it is down. My kid was miserable after about an hour at the zoo.

Author: Linda

Body: Great purchase

Author: Caroline

Body: Ordered this specifically for height. I am 5'10 and we had a cheaper stroller that was just a SMIDGE too short and it KILLED my back on walks. This is a great height and overall good quality stroller.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Came apart in 5 minutes
Body: Just got the stroller took it out for the first time on the corner of my street and the shoulder pad and strap ripped off the back and sewing on the side of the stroller is unwrapped again I've only use this for five minutes
