Author: Teressa Sutherland
Title: Poor quality
Body: This product broke with 24 hours of using. The wheel broke off and we needed to purchase a 2nd stroller to finish our vacation.

Author: Chadd
Title: Easy to use
Body: Got this as a second stroller for traveling. Folds easy and works great.

Author: philjan
Title: One wheel doesn't allign.
Body: One wheel doesn't allign. Hard to maneuver.

Author: Nell
Title: Highly recommend
Body: Perfect for my girl! Easy to put together and fold. Fast shipping.

Author: Angel
Title: Highly recommend!
Body: I love it. So simple and easy.

Author: mary myers
Title: Hard to handle. Hard to close doesn‚Äôt fit baby properly-Better strollers out there!
Body: This was rated highly & I'm not sure why. I bought this for my 10 month old grandson for shopping & maneuvering through small areas like restaurants & stores. I don‚Äôt love it. I raised 4 kids with umbrella strollers which were so much better than this. It‚Äôs not particularly easy to fold. The metal folding bar pinched my finger. A peddle closure would be & was easier. I‚Äôve had lots of umbrella strollers with my 4 kids in a 10 yr span. We have several homes & I kept them at each one. This stroller doesn‚Äôt turn easily & the front wheels go all over the place making it hard to steer. I‚Äôm also not thrilled with the seating. It isn‚Äôt shaped the best to be sturdy. My 10 month grandson gets twisted even with the straps &harness tightened. I‚Äôm sure there‚Äôs a better stroller out there. I‚Äôll keep looking... I guess the high rating is because new moms haven‚Äôt experienced better little umbrella strollers.

Author: Tanea Guyette
Title: Front wheels barely turn.
Body: Came in handy for our weekend trip to Vegas. However, the front wheels barely turn. I was practically doing wheelies to turn smh.

Author: emily tindle
Title: super easy to fold!!
Body: Fits anywhere. Great buy!!

Author: TARR
Title: Lightweight stroller
Body: For the price this stroller does what it should. It's lightweight , easy to open and close and I have arthritis so that's a bonus. My 3 yr old fits in it, just fine and he's tall. I'd buy it again.

Author: Eli nesser
Title: easy to use and store
Body: loved it easy to use and store does not take up much room

Author: homebody
Title: Great Little Stroller!
Body: I bought this stroller based on reviews to use with my now 9 month old grandson. I wanted something that collapsed and could be stored in a small space. I've had it for almost 2 months and we use it daily for 1- 2 mile walks usually on bumpy dirt roads. It handles better than anticipated. I've not adjusted the seat much, but love that I can. I use the cup holders for my phone and keys. He loves it.

Author: Mrs Lynne
Title: Do not buy
Body: Received and it was broken when i opened the box

Author: Elaine Gonzalez
Title: Would recommend!
Body: My husband and I LOVE this stroller! Yes, there isn‚Äôt much space underneath for extra items, but it was still perfect for us. I love that there is a compartment for small items by the handle that zips! Easy place for my phone & wallet!

Author: xFuZiion21
Title: Amazing
Body: It works so good

Author: J
Title: Easy fold, lightweight, perfect for the airport!
Body: Wow this stroller is perfect for the airport! It‚Äôs so small and easy to maneuver and super lightweight. For the price I‚Äôm surprised the wheels haven‚Äôt fell off like I‚Äôve had others break on me :(I bought this stroller specifically for airport usage and let me just say it‚Äôs perfect. I give this stroller five stars for the price and how strong it is. The ONLY issue for me is the storage on the bottom. I went to buy a gallon of water and no where can I store it. Not even half gallons fit. That under the stroller stoat she is only good for maybe a pack of wipes and very small things such as toys or baby bottles but nothing big fits. Which is alright with me seeing that I always have a diaper bag with me. This stroller is very easy to put together, I did it in two minutes. Very light weight easily folds and the price is wonderful! Highly recommend!

Author: Kristen
Title: Great product! Perfect for travel/Disney!
Body: Purchased this stroller for our trip to Disney world and it was PERFECT. It‚Äôs the perfect size, the quality is great. Easy to collapse, easy to maneuver. It was the perfect size for traveling through the parks, airports, and easy to fold on the buses! I purchased a couple additional stroller pockets which worked great to be able to haul our necessities throughout Disney. Would definitely recommend. Very pleased with this purchase.

Author: Heather rittenhouse
Title: Not bad for price
Body: The front wheels do not swivel at all. Very hard to turn.

Author: Andrew P
Title: Sturdy, easy fold umbrella stroller
Body: Lightweight, love that it folds with the canopy in place and snaps shut easily. It‚Äôs easy to carry with one hand and can even steer with one hand for short periodsOf time. One wheel is a little off balance but not bad. My 3 month old fits but I wouldMake the straps slightly more adjustable for smaller babies if I could change anything.

Author: Jaime Ham
Title: Love this!
Body: Love this stroller, it‚Äôs lightweight and folds up nicely to fit into small trunk space. Easy to push and turn. Baby seems comfortable. Love that it had a recline option, and the cup holders are awesome and hold the cup steady! Baby is 2 months old üëçüèª

Author: Kate
Title: Weird wheels
Body: I really wanted to give this a better review but the front wheels on this are weird. On most strollers all 4 front wheels roll but on this one only 2 of them roll unless on grass or some other uneven ground. I thought I had put it together wrong but I double checked and I didn't. The front brakes get hit all the time and make it so you can turn the wheels but can still push the stroller straight.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Not what I expected
Body: Front wheels do not spin. It is hard to fold it.

Author: Jane Hynes
Title: Not real great.
Body: Don't much care for this stroller. It's not adjustable so the child must remain in a reclining position. My granddaughter wants to sit up and look around so she fights against the straps securing her in the seat. She's 8 months old, not old enough to go without being buckled in. So she's just not happy sitting in it.

Author: heyturn
Title: Seat belt too small
Body: Bought this for my 1 year old hoping it would last a while for us since it has a high weight limit. I was very disappointed to discover that the seat belt across the waist just barely fits him. It‚Äôs tight, and he‚Äôs not even close to the weight limit. I would not recommend purchasing this product.

Author: Edgar barboza
Title: Would not buy again
Body: The sun visor never helped with the sun. It was always facing a weird angle and broke after been used about 10x. Bought 3 months ago. The wheels aren‚Äôt as sturdy. Would not buy again.

Author: Ivette cruz
Title: Recomendado
Body: Buen coche

Author: Eduardo Calle
Title: The quality is bad
Body: Do not believe in what they say about the product, i am very disappointed.

Author: Diane salatino
Title: Durability should be better and last longer than seven months and only three months of use
Body: All the above are wonderful except for it didn‚Äôt even last a year only seven months of use wheels in the back broke off try to fix it back it broke off again it‚Äôs a shame it‚Äôs a nice stroller stroller should last a little longer than seven months

Author: Jahze
Title: Not as seen on pic
Body: I didn‚Äôt like that the space at the bottom is super small and there‚Äôs metal bars behind the seat makes it hard to lean them back without them having to feel the bars..

Author: Nirupama Sumangala
Title: A well made product
Body: Satisfied with quality of the product

Author: bethbrzon
Title: Gift
Body: Gift

Author: Megan Pitzen
Title: Good harness for keeping kids secure
Body: Harness goes over the shoulders similar to a car seat and makes it tough for kids to wiggle out. Can recline seat and has a deep canopy to block out the sun. A little difficult to fold, but this stroller is better than others I‚Äôve tried.

Author: Elizabeth Moore
Title: Light Weight & Durable
Body: Love the convenience of keeping this in the car without it taking up much room! Light weight & easy to fold!

Author: Frank Vasquez
Title: A+
Body: Great item!

Author: Jreg1
Title: Works great!
Body: Perfect size.

Author: Virginia R. Garcia
Title: Make sure front wheels snap into slot for turning ease
Body: Easy to assemble but not as easy to maneuver.

Author: chase59
Title: Broken
Body: Broken piece of junk.

Author: TheZombieWoman
Title: Does The Job
Body: Since my husband and I are moving out of state and driving there, we wanted a smaller stroller for our baby instead of the huge one that took up space. With the high ratings, I went with this one. Installation was easy peasy (save for the sun cover but that is what I get for not reading the instructions until the last minute) and it appears to be strong enough for our giant baby to grow in. That being said, the straps are a big inconvenient (the fasteners aren't clips) and it isn't as maneuverable as I would like. It is SUPER compact after folding though and that is what I bought it for. This stroller will be perfect for walks or small trips but I wouldn't use this for big trips.Edit: Apparently I'm an idiot and didn't realize that my wheels were locked. Great maneuverability! Confusing locks.

Author: Yalanda
Title: Overpriced
Body: This stroller is way over priced for the quality... Walmart has similar, maybe better for $25... It does not recline as advertised... The basket underneath the seat is a joke, basically there for looks... It does the job of carrying my grandson from place to place but that's about it...

Author: MSD
Title: Lightweight but sturdy
Body: We love this. It's lightweight and the harness feela secure. For longer walks, you may want something more structured; kiddo seems to stretch out and end up with most of her weight on the crotch strap. But she doesn't seem to mind, and I think she relaxes into the seat after we get going.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Excellent
Body: Love this for my granddaughter.

Author: Wildelyn Jao
Title: Lightweight!
Body: Bought this to travel with my 8month old infantEasy to fold, it's lightweight and easy to maneuverGlad that it has a front wheel lock

Author: Nicholas Renaud
Title: when you want to use, please check metal that wil open stroller.
Body: I using this stroller for my son, very good quality and comfortable for him. light weight. have everything in the stroller. this is also high recommended for people who can‚Äôt roll it heavy weight.

Author: Brian Zwahlen
Title: Worth the money
Body: Very sturdy but lightweight. Folds easy. Compact. Love it!!!

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Lightweight sturdy safe stroller
Body: Lightweight, sturdy, and my granddaughter loves it... Score ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Author: Jenn K.
Title: Not worth the money spent
Body: The wheels are not even and don‚Äôt roll at all I‚Äôm the front. TERRIBLE

Author: Lily Kay
Title: Nice lightweight stroller
Body: Nice light weight stroller we took to Disney world. It was convenient easy to fold up for the buses.

Author: cathryn
Title: Not great as listed.
Body: It wobbles because 1 tired doesn‚Äôt even touch the floor that great. It‚Äôs okay I am trying to buy a 2nd one for my other car but for sure won‚Äôt be buying this brand anymore.

Author: JOHANNA
Title: Don‚Äôt bother Doesn‚Äôt Maneuver well.
Body: It Doesn‚Äôt maneuver how you wanted to maneuver Hard to make turns. Your child will outgrow this super fast. It‚Äôs super tiny

Author: Yaritza Nu√±ez
Title: Super ligero
Body: Lo mejor para tenerlo en el carro, ocupa poco espacio.A mi bebe le encanta.

Author: Amanda B.
Title: Definitely worth it
Body: Love everything about this stroller. Convenient. Get one if you need something small and compact. I love the neck and waist straps. Little carrier to put small stuff in and a bottom basket.

Author: Elizabeth Aguirre
Title: Love this stroller!
Body: Small, convenient, & lays back!

Author: SJKim
Title: Great for road trips!
Body: Our travel system is too big for road trips so we purchased this for our 8 month old. It is very compact and easy to maneuver. We love that it has a little storage. The only minus is the breaks are not very strong, but obviously you would use caution.

Author: Celeste mercado
Title: Stop selling
Body: DO NOT BUY... was really disappointed the front wheel moves a lot side to side and sometimes doesn‚Äôt even move at all when using and material is super cheap....

Author: Priscilla Rivas
Title: Cheap and broke on first outing
Body: I wanted to love this but very disappointed. It is super light weight, not bulky and relatively easy to fold up and carry with one hand. But it did feel very flimsy and cheap. I wasn't too bothered by that as I only needed this stroller for going into the docs office or running quick errands.However, on the very first outing with it on a side walk, there was a slightly uneven section and when I went over it, the front left wheel bent outward. Also, after only being on the concrete sidewalk for the length of a parking lot, the wheels looked all worn out (see photo.) I can't imaging this having any durability.Also, I'm 5'7 and the handle height is just right for me. If you're any taller than that, this may uncomfortable.

Author: Steven Christopher
Title: Great product
Body: I have no complaints with this product. Really glad I purchased this stroller. My child also enjoys it. If your thinking about getting a small foldable stroller this one is the one to get. The price is a little higher but the cheaper strollers don't do the job for a heavier kid. My child is 5 yrs. old and about 43 pounds and he fits great in the seat the stroller had no issues with his weight pushed perfectly wasn't hard to get around at all, he still had room on the sides of him so he wasn't crammed or uncomfortable. I have a 3 wheeled stroller that doesn't fold up anymore and I was tired of buying cheap sun strollers that would break in the matter of months, this product is awesome and very sturdy and I highly recommend this for a second stroller that's easy to fold and put away. My boy perfers to use this stroller than his big one. Well put togetter and the stitching is very well done!

Author: Js
Title: Hard to steer
Body: We wanted a smaller stroller instead of lugging the jogging stroller every where since it's big and bulky. Big mistake on my part it is so hard to turn and the seat doesn't recline or straighten out on ours. The front set of wheels only 1 wheel on each side touches the ground (I'm assuming this is why it's so hard to steer. I seen all the reviews and I'm guessing ours must have been a defective one cause I wish I never bought it

Author: Juliane
Title: Front tires malfunction
Body: Front tires go sideways! Awesome stroller otherwise but becomes unusable due to front tire malfunction

Author: Solimar
Title: Sturdy, lightweight, easy to maneuver!
Body: I bought this stroller for my 9yr old daughter to use with her dolls, she is really tall so a regular doll strollers would make her hunch to push it. Also doll strollers have become very pricey. My daughter has Cerebral Palsy so she needs something that is sturdy, lightweight, and easy to maneuver, this stroller is perfect and it folds up easy when play time is over.

Author: Kristen Moffitt
Title: Compacted
Body: Easy to fold, carry on the go, compact

Author: Latisha
Title: Get What You Pay For
Body: Stroller is light and color is great. However, the front wheels started messing up/not spinning after 2 uses. The cupholders don't hold anything larger than a bottle. I'm 5'8 and the handles are super low for me and I have to hunch over to push the stroller.

Author: Reinier
Title: Wheels
Body: my biggest concern are the wheels

Author: Daniel
Title: Perfect backup stroller
Body: It's a great backup or travel stroller. Doesn't really have any fancy features but it makes up for it by being super light and folds up really small. Not our daily stroller for walks or anything, but when you just need to grab a stroller and walk out the door, we always reach for this one.

Author: Tawnie Wagner
Title: Great buy
Body: Great buy

Author: Jenn
Title: Not for everyday use
Body: This product arrived in great condition, easy to put together, easy to fold and light weight.THIS STROLLER IS NOT MEANT FOR EVERYDAY USE.If you need a durable stroller for everyday use (i.e. you are the full time parent) this is not it. Just like any other cheap light weight stroller it is best for limited easy use. I am not a full time parent, I am an aunt who only occasionally has the kids and is it or miss on needing a stroller. For that reason this stroller works well enough.

Author: Bonnie
Title: Arrived wrong
Body: This item came messed up. The right front wheel does not touch the ground.

Author: Joseph
Title: Quality stroller with LOW quality tires.
Body: Overall, good purchase! The stroller is high quality but the tires are very low quality and plastic. I‚Äôm debating returning it for something higher quality but it should do just fine for our trip.I did read all reviews before purchasing and decided to give it a try.My son is 6mo (29inch long/25lb big boy) and he already fell asleep in it pushing around our house. I clipped the umbrella shade lower on the handle but it can be higher. If the tires weren‚Äôt hallow plastic I think this would be a 10/10. They seem secure, just low quality.

Author: Kimberly Borelli
Title: Perfect everyday stroller
Body: I keep this in my car 24/7. It is perfect!! Easy to steer, light weight, comfortable, we love it!

Author: Sandy Erazo
Title: Perfect light weight
Body: Perfect for short errands.

Author: Gildalis F.
Title: El art√≠culo no llego bien
Body: Llego roto la goma

Author: Emily Johnson
Title: Good but so hard to collapse.
Body: No matter what I do I have to use the force of 7 elephants to collapse this stroller. It‚Äôs great but this is really making me considering returning it.

Author: J.
Title: Nuts fall off easilyv
Body: We had a nut fall off one of the bolts randomly while walking and didn't notice pretty inconvenient

Author: allie
Title: Wheels don‚Äôt all work
Body: The front wheels only the inside wheel would go around the out side wheels wouldn‚Äôt move unless you put pressure on one side the entire time , but then the other side neither wheel would go

Author: CBrodeur
Title: Overall Very Good
Body: Very lightweight and easy to move, fold up/open. My only complaints are that I wish it reclined back more and the sun shade doesn‚Äôt offer a whole lot of coverage once the sun is low in the sky (late afternoon) but I do love this stroller otherwise!

Author: Fatima Rizvi
Title: Returned it
Body: Very cheaply made. Its just like a 25$ umbrella stroller. Its not worth it to spend 44$ on it. It just have a storage basket at the bottom. Thats the only thing i liked in it. I ordered the grey one for my girl and they delivered the blue. Also the back of the seat is super light and can touch the steel frame when the child sits in it. It reclines very less. Overall, i would only keep this stroller if it was cheaper just like regular umbrella strollers since it is made like one.

Author: CFT
Title: Very practical and well made little stroller
Body: I bought this for my granddaughter so I could take walks with her when she stayed with me. It is light weight and maneuverable. I like that it is quite adjustable as well.

Author: Amibear2
Title: STAY AWAY
Body: Worst stroller ever.. The first one we bought was broken.. We got a replacement and at least the time the wheels spun however, this stroller DOES NOT TURN.. I have to tip my stroller and child on the back wheels to even turn.. What a joke

Author: Justin C. Rosini
Title: Garbage
Body: Wheel fell off with my daughter in it. Then it‚Äôs $30 for a box to return the thing. Never again

Author: Michael s Butler
Title: baby stroller
Body: would purchase again

Author: Deanna B.
Title: perfect and easy to use
Body: we love it

Author: A Driver
Title: Happy enough.
Body: Pretty great. Reasonable price.My only complaint is the TINY basket underneath. It is too small to be of much use anyway, but when your baby is in the seat, you can't get anything in or out of there. I bought the stroller for navigating the airport. It's perfect for that.

Author: S.R.Thompson
Title: Garbage
Body: I have nothing positive to say about this stroller. It's too long to fit in the rear of my midsize car. The lock mechanism is stiff. The canopy is not remotely functional. It's difficult to steer, and the backrest is flimsy and unsupportive.

Author: Stacy A. Hummel
Title: I hate this stroller!
Body: Bought this stroller to downsize and replace our big hand me down stroller. We don't really use it much either but I hate it!It's unbalanced, one front wheel is a cm off the ground so it doesn't turn. Now after using it a few times the front wheels don't turn anymore you just have to slide it.Canopy also never stays in place.I will be buying a different one and chucking this.

Author: T.W. Nelson
Title: Grandkids love it.
Body: Easy to assemble! Love the light weight. Fits in a small storage area.

Author: Debbie
Title: Perfect stroller
Body: Love it

Author: Rai
Title: Great price
Body: Love everything about this stroller. So much quality for a great price.

Author: Susan D Posey
Title: Very nice, good quality
Body: I love the stroller, but I have trouble folding it. Maybe it's just me, my husband folds it w/ little problems. I think it will loosen up a bit more in time. Other wise, great stroller. Very light weight which I needed.

Author: Andrei Belikov
Title: 3 months warranty.
Body: Summer Infant provides only 3 months warranty. One of the wheels fell away after 8 months of not frequently using.

Author: JJF
Title: TERRIBLE
Body: Perhaps it was the package was beyond destroyed, too bad I did not take pictures.Perhaps it is the safety hazard of loosing a finger when trying to close the unit.Perhaps it was the legs and arms being bent.Perhaps it was the moist and foul smell of the foam handles.Perhaps amazon needs to get with it and not overlook quality control on items.and finally perhaps they need to update their system, I returned the unit with their label and have yet to receive credit for it.I am not alone on this but Amazon looses quality with each passing day, sad. I own stock :(

Author: Brandelyn Cordova
Title: Absolutely Love It!!!!!!!
Body: I purchased this stroller for a trip from Texas to California by plane. I used it for my 20 month old. It out did itself! I was pleased with the compact design and it's maneuverability. I could push it one handed and could fold it with one foot. It also unfolded easily. I loved that it was self locking when I folded it down. This stroller was a life saver. It got us through the airport with ease and had no problems getting it through the security xray machines at TSA. I also loved the 2 cup holders and zippered pocket. The basket has minimal access so it can only be used for small items but that wasn't a problem cause my diaper bag has stroller straps. Which it stayed on without tipping the stroller when my child wasn't in it. I absolutely love this stroller and plan on using it for any outting involving my little one. Highly recommend!

Author: ChilliConda09
Title: Damaged POS
Body: So, nothing against the stroller itself. The problem is that, this product has damaged wheels, not all wheels touch the ground, hard to steer. Due to this, this stroller is a POS! SO IF YOU'RE THE SELLER READING THIS PLEASE CONTACT ME SO THAT WE CAN RESOLVE THIS ISSUE! Thank you.

Author: CFND
Title: Tire worn out so quick
Body: One tire on the front left side doesn‚Äôt touch the floor

Author: Allison
Title: Nice quality without breaking the bank
Body: I think the folding mechanism is a little challenging and the maneuverability is a little challenging since the front wheels don‚Äôt turn. But this is a nice quality lightweight stroller that doesn‚Äôt break the bank and fits neatly in my trunk.

Author: Danielle K.
Title: A great investment!
Body: I love this stroller. I went from a bulky jogger to this and it is such a lifesaver. Lightweight and easy to fold, I use it every time I need to wrangle in my toddler while out in public. She rides comfortably and can't escape as easily with the harness buckling (much better than just a lap belt.)

Author: Amy Ting
Title: Wheel does not spin
Body:
The media could not be loaded.
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  
  
   The product I received has definitely been used and returned before. The wheels were scuffed and there was a very noticeable deep scratch in the hard plastic part of one of the wheels. That same wheel also will not screw in flat, as shown by the video. Pretty disappointed in the quality.

Author: Jaycie Cantrell
Title: Perfect fit for my 6 month old
Body: So light weight and easy to fold!

Author: Sara P
Title: Wouldn‚Äôt recommend it for the price
Body: Stroller is easy to fold and very light weight, but one of the front wheels does not touch the floor making it hard to maneuver also getting randomly stuck when pushing the stroller.

Author: TaShawna Crump
Title: ü§¶üèæ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
Body: The wheels go all over the place

Author: Lucia A Perez
Title: Very convenient and recomendable!
Body: This stroller is pefect for my 3 1/2 month old baby sister! It is super compact, easy to assemble, and it is also made of very good material!

Author: Ileana M.
Title: Light Weight and Sturdy
Body: Love it, read some of the reviews first and all is true, light weight, and sturdy.

Author: wendy
Title: pretty good
Body: My original umbrella stroller died after use with 5 children.. go figure. so i bought another umbrella stroller and wasn't impressed with the quality-so i tried this one. for $20 extra, you get a seat that kinda reclines, a storage basket you can sorta access, a canopy, and a drink/stuff holder for the adult. it's a great concept and i think it's a step up from the umbrella strollers available today. but baby's back isn't comfortable as the old stroller, it's got a weird triple pie shape that expands but isn't smooth so baby boy is never able to fall asleep. it doesn't recline enough back to lay his head back to sleep, and the handle is still too close to the ground for my height and i'm 5'4 -so my 6'2 husband has a tough time using it at all- but that's with almost every stroller.

Author: Luke Georgia
Title: Good for indoor jaunts
Body: Definitely a good mall or airport stroller. A back wheel started wobbling pretty quickly after a neighborhood pavement stroll when we were too lazy to get the good stroller out of the garage.

Author: Christine Sylvester
Title: Can be a little hard to fold
Body: I wanted an inexpensive stroller to have for the times that I babysit my grandson. This was exactly what I was looking for.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: great
Body: great for disney trip

Author: celia schiffner
Title: broke after 2nd use
Body: I bought this for when my grandson came to visit. It was easy enough to put together and push him around. However, after the 2nd time using it, I could no longer fold it. What good is having a stroller that you can't fold and put in the car. Very disappointed in this purchase. Look elsewhere for a dependable lightweight stroller. Do not but this one

Author: Would I buy this again??
Title: Inexpensive latch assembly
Body: Nice and convenient. But after the fourth time of trying to bucket in my grandson, the latch on the seat portion broke off not allowing for a secure connection of the seat belt. I returned the stroller for a refund but have not yet received any refund for the product.

Author: Heather
Title: Poorly made
Body: One of the front wheels doesn't touch the ground even with my child in it to weight it down.

Author: LyVea Oliver
Title: Perfect Downgrade Size Wise!
Body: So I now have a toddler, and wanted to transition from her travel system stroller. This met the 3 things I wanted: easy to fold, lightweight, and cute.2 built in cup holders. Small, but decent size storage underneath. Super easy to fold up! Took very little time finishing the assembly. Only small issue is the canopy pops off sometimes when I fold it up. Not a huge deal though. And I love the handles, makes for easier steering! I had this style handle with her travel system so I wanted it again.

Author: CZ
Title: Not bad, not great. Wheels skid, not easy to maneuver.
Body: Used this for the airport and travel. It was adequate. The back wheels both wobble and the front wheels sometimes skid instead of roll which makes it more resistant to rolling. Difficult to maneuver or even keep straight one handed. Not bad for the price ($40), but not great either. It got the job done.

Author: eileen dietz
Title: Great Stroller
Body: Great little stroller. So easy to open and close. Fits under the backseat of my truck. Worth every penny.

Author: Crystal L
Title: Great stroller!
Body: I love this stroller! Its very light and holds my almost 3 year old. I love all the compartments that it has and the drink holders. The only thing is that the wheels dont turn as good as I'd like but I can deal with it and it's not that bad. Great stroller to have!

Author: JENNIFER HELTON
Title: Awesome
Body: This stroller is perfect, lightweight, easy to handle with plenty of room for storage. The price is great for what you get.

Author: Holly
Title: Easy and convenient
Body: All around easy to use and extremely light weight!

Author: Carina Figueroa
Title: How comfortable it is!
Body: The best light weight stroller there is!!

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: PERFECT FOR AIRPORT/TRAVEL
Body: PERFECT for the airport and traveling. I could fold it with one hand, it was easy to push, easy to toss in the trunk of the car, easy to check plane side. Would 100% buy again!

Author: M. LeClair
Title: Wife wanted it... And then it won me over too
Body: So we have a wonderful, large stroller. I love the thing, my wife... Less so. Is about the size of her and she hates taking it in and out of the trunk when she wants to go for a walk with our daughter when I'm at work. I had no input on this purchase, I told her if she wants to get it to go ahead and log on my computer and buy it, so she did.I am actually really impressed with this. I was picturing those garbage flimsy umbrella strollers you see far too often. Is this as heavy duty as our big one? Nope. But, it's a great little stroller. Durable enough.. I mean I wouldn't take it hiking or something, but for going to the store, or to go walk around the park or something? Is perfect. Has storage beneath it too. Is also a fraction of the weight of the big one, and folds down really nicely to be carried.Not gonna lie, it won me over.

Author: Nikki EP
Title: It‚Äôs great
Body: It was great! Easy to fold and fast - used it during a hurricane evacuation and it was quick and simple light weight

Author: Janice
Title: Love
Body: Love it very convenient keep it in my car for my grandkids!!

Author: Samantha Wortman
Title: Stroller color good
Body: Doesnt move as smoothly as I would have liked it too but other than that it's a good product but maybe not for almost $86

Author: Tami Vinberg
Title: Small
Body: Way too small for my 2 year old. Definitely for younger kids.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Used... I was buying new.
Body: This item was used!

Author: Pavan
Title: Very good umbrella stroller
Body: This is a Very sturdy umbrella stroller, light and easy to travel with. The dual wheel design makes it very sturdy... Highly recommended

Author: Kindle Customer
Title: Not at all good for sitting posture
Body: After reading the reviews, bought this product.Not at all good. 18 month old wasn't able to sit properly. Back is not at all supportive.Baby risks getting back problems because of the poor posture. This stroller seat can't be adjusted. Not sure how it worked good for other babies

Author: Lizzie Absher
Title: Not worth it
Body: I purchased this stroller because I needed something more lightweight and easier to use than the Chicco travel system I bought when my son was born. First off, it's almost impossible to fold down because the bar you're supposed to push up to unlock it, won't budge. I've bruised the top of both of my feet pulling back and up like the instructions stated and still had the hardest time. Secondly, the design looks great online but in person, it looks cheap. Lastly, my son hated sitting in it too since the seat doesn't sit straight up, it's awkwardly leaning back. What one year old wants to lean all back rather than looking at everything? Lastly, the wheels don't operate well and after just the first use, the tread is basically gone. Overall, buy a different stroller. The price point doesn't match what you're getting.

Author: Kylee
Title: Just buy something better
Body: A lot cheaper made than I expected. The wheel became dented after my kids ran it into the counter 5 min after opening. I bought it to avoid a crappy umbrella stroller that would break in a few uses and this really didn't impress me in the least. I ended up buying a Britax B-Agile instead and well it's not technically an umbrella stroller and it's quite a bit more expensive I absolutely love it! 100 times better quality, easy fold, and easier to manuver.

Author: Leslie Ward
Title: Great Stroller
Body: I get so many compliments on this stroller.... and I didn‚Äôt think it was anything special. I thought, I need a quick grab and go.. put the baby in the stroller and just go.... and that‚Äôs what it is. Nothing fabulous just like an umbrella stroller but a tad bit more upscale and cute!! Definitely a sweet buy for the price...

Author: ELY
Title: Good for the price
Body: Easy to fold, lightweight and was easy to put together.

Author: Valerie
Title: Useless after 3 months
Body: My stroller broke after only 3 months of use. Extremely disappointed in this stroller.

Author: NC Guy
Title: Perfect for our little girl
Body: Our old stroller of 10 years wore out and we replaced it for this one. It worked great for our most recent vacation. It travels great on hard surfaces, and even on gravel. Obviously better on hard surfaces, but I was impressed with the off road abilities.Also travels great on grass.The bag holder under the seat is smaller than my old stroller, but it's still big enough.Very light, and easy to use/ fold.

Author: MyReviews
Title: Good overall
Body: Bought to keep at Nana‚Äôs house for walks. Like that it is lightweight and a good price. The front wheels do not maneuver well so that can be annoying.

Author: Stephanie D.
Title: Lost a wheel
Body: Very light weight loved it until the wheel came off on 1st use.

Author: Alysia
Title: Front wheels stick
Body: I may need to break it in a bit more. It the front wheels tend to stick if there isn‚Äôt much weight on the stroller when it isn‚Äôt occupied by a child.

Author: Veronica Hanson
Title: Not long legged friendly!
Body: Overall, this was a great buy, just not for me! My son is 18 months, long legged and very squirrely. The foot stand for him is rubbery and very flexible. He likes to get his feet under it and drag his toes on the ground. He also likes to get his feet under it and around to the wheels so it gets caught on his shoes and then I can't push the stroller... ü§¶üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è so if you have a well-behaved, short legged child, this stroller is great! Adequate storage space, good height, decent cover, easy to maneuver. I did return this to find a taller one.

Author: Hippychic1981
Title: Great stroller!!
Body: Awesome little stroller. Smooth!!

Author: Sarah M.
Title: Received broken and unable to use
Body: Received broken and unable to use and on top of that their customer service is closed and it‚Äôs not even 1pm in California. Give me a break!Seems ok otherwise but a bit flimsy?

Author: Samantha
Title: Easy to use! Convenient!
Body: This is a great stroller. Very light weight and easy to fold. The little cover on mine always pops off on one side but that probably user error and is easy for me to fix. I love having this stroller though. It takes up less space in my car and is a lot lighter, super convenient. The basket on the bottom is a bit small but that is expected with a small stroller. The cup holder and zip able pouch is also very convenient.

Author: Valerie Mojica
Title: Easy set up process and lightweight
Body: I like that it was easy to set up and it‚Äôs easy to store away and not heavy at all. I use it for my baby and she loves it and it‚Äôs easy to get around with.

Author: Claudia Mitooka
Title: Great stroller! Cup holder is awsome. Just had some hard times folding it in the beggining
Body: I love this umbrella stroller. It's lightweight, the wheels work fine. My toddler has 32 pounds but he's still confortable (for at least 6 months I hope) and he even took a nap in there. The cup holder is awsome! And it also has a storage basket for toys, even a small bag. The only negative point is: it was hard to fold in the beggining. The lock-out bar was kinda stuck. I had to watch some youtube videos and practice. Now it's ok.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: The wheels ruined this purchase for me
Body: The will gets stuck all of the time. This stroller is light weight, but so hard to maneuver because of the wheels. Also not a stroller for someone who is tall, I'm 5'6 and the handles were still pretty low.

Author: Johanna Banick
Title: Don't waste your money on this!
Body: The teeth on the front wheel arrived damaged from the manufacturer. I emailed the company direct and it took weeks till someone got back to me. Also the front wheels don't turn, making it difficult to use. Definitely not worth what I paid.

Author: Beachresc
Title: Let‚Äôs of storage and light weight
Body: Loved everything about it. Super light weight with some storagr

Author: Lisa Hilliard
Title: Great for the price!
Body: This stroller does not recline for napping position as advertised.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Wheels I not touch ground
Body: The front wheels do not touch the ground completely which makes it difficult to stroll at times. It is also short. I do like the double cup holder and the shoulder straps.

Author: Jessica
Title: Do not buy
Body: I was very pleased with this stroller at first. Love the hanging basket with cup holders and storage at the bottom. Within a couple days of using this stroller one of the wheels stopped spinning and started making this squeaking noise that is extremely annoying. I will be returning my stroller.

Author: Evan A.
Title: I love it for my baby
Body: I love it for my baby and he loves it too. Its light weight, easy to maneuver yet well built. My wife uses it some times to put my baby to sleep by rocking him in it. The front tires can be adjusted to make sure it goes straight only for smooth front and back motion. Very happy with the purchase and great price as well.

Title: Everything
Body: Disappointed.

Title: Cheap but lightweight!!!
Body:

   It‚Äôs lightweight enough for me to lift without straining myself.I have a heart condition that cannot handle physical stress; so this stroller is perfect for someone who can‚Äôt lift a lot of weight.Easy enough to fold...Quality is not very good but is worth being lightweight with an undercarriage & 2 cup holders!The wheels are made of cheap plastic and didn‚Äôt do so well on the park trails-but survived!Great for light shopping sprees.My baby is 6 months old and weighs about 15 lbs. she is not a sitter yet-and is able to be secured safely by the stroller‚Äôs straps.Click-easy...Straps are easily adjusted.The canopy is junk. I just put a hat on her instead.I hope this helps you.

Author: Aly Montalto
Title: Great!
Body: Great stroller! We bought this as a second stroller so we wouldn‚Äôt have to bring our big bulky one on our vacation. It was very portable and easy to steer! Love having the storage basket underneath as well as the storage with cup holders unlike the traditional small umbrella strollers.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: good value
Body: great value compact well built

Author: click and go
Title: Disappointing for the price
Body: The wheels on this stroller are very cheap. The box it came in was crushed, I was surprised that no pieces were missing with the gaping hole in the box. You must put the wheels on yourself. One set of wheels isn‚Äôt aligned properly, we tried to bend them back into place, but still not perfect. The wheels are very flimsy plastic. Overall the fabric of the stroller is also very thin. Not sure it could hold up to 50 pounds as stated. The latch to fold and unfold isn‚Äôt easy to use either. This umbrella stroller would get a better rating if I paid under $30 but for $69.99 it is very cheaply made. I don‚Äôt expect it to last long. If I didn‚Äôt need it immediately for my visiting grandchild I would have returned it. I‚Äôm very surprised that this umbrella stroller got such good reviews. I do not recommend.

Author: Ellie
Title: Low quality
Body: We did not like the quality and returned back.

Author: christi
Title: Great value!
Body: Works great as a spare! Baby seems very comfortable in it and the straps are very secure.

Author: PhayesJ
Title: Not crazy about it
Body: The sunshade pops off every time I try to adjust which is super annoying. It seems to pull to the left. Just not a fan.

Author: meredithrutland
Title: Excellent stroller for traveling!! Highly recommend!
Body: We got this to take with us to Disney! It did not disappoint! Love the storage pocket- that was hard to find on these small strollers. Cup holders are so convenient. Very easy to fold and unfold quickly which was great for Disney transportation. Lightweight and doesn‚Äôt take up much space. Love the recline feature. She fell asleep in it before we left the park. Perfect size for my 3 year old that‚Äôs about 30lbs.

Author: kgprice
Title: Love this stroller
Body: We've been tons of places with this stroller. It's super easy to fold up and lightweight to get in and out of the car. Our kiddo loves anywhere we go in it! It holds two water bottles and has zipper storage, perfect for keys and sunglasses. The bottom storage is sufficient for travel diaper bag and a few other small items.

Author: Jess
Title: Lightweight!

Title: Great size for travel
Body: Arrived really quick, my husband was able to put it together very quick. It is great for a quick trip and a gives you more storage room while traveling. What I don‚Äôt like is how low the handles are and it is small so I can tell my daughter isn‚Äôt comfortable compare to her other one we have

Author: Magdalena
Title: Easier to carry around
Body: It‚Äôs a little beat up but it‚Äôs really lightweight and easy to maneuver! So glad I don‚Äôt have to push around and carry the huge stroller that comes with the car seat 9/10 Definitely have much more room n my trunk as well

Title: Decent but not overly flexible
Body: Great portability and sturdiness; only real big issue is that the wheels in front and back do not swivel to make turns very easy. I find myself dragging the stroller during turns which is annoying.Otherwise love the overhead coverage and cargo net below to hold a few small items. Cup holders have come in handy too!

Author: Sumer_Shopping

Body: Terrible stroller, wheel came off right away, the shade top gets folded and doesn‚Äôt unfold properly. Very poor back support for baby, cant sit up very well, spend a little more on a better stroller.

Author: Janelle

Body: Quick shipping! Easy to assemble! Smooth for the baby but the only thing is folding the stroller it‚Äôs hard so, I have to kick it to fold it. Other then that the price is amazing!

Author: Whitney Hill
Title: You get what you pay for
Body: I wanted a good middle of the road umbrella troller for travel. Having used it a couple of times, it‚Äôs okay at best. It‚Äôs really challenging to fold. They did not have a mom with her hands full in mind when they designed it. If you have high expectations for a umbrella stroller, I suggest spending a bit more. Looks better than it performs.

Author: MamaDoc
Title: Just buy a $20 stroller.
Body: Bought this one based on recommendations rather than a basic $20 character umbrella stroller and we are regretting it. This thing feels cheap and is hard to push, it goes every which way all the time. The handle is too short for my husband and I (though we are tall) and requires both hands of course, and we always end up kicking the back. We thought this would get us through until we can get our Baby Jogger back (quarantined!) but we are here to buy something better because this thing is such a struggle.

Author: Layla
Title: Lightweight

But, we made it through the first few months and highly recommend!! Love that I can keep it in my trunk and still have room to put the groceries in the trunk!

Author: Happy Dancer 66
Title: Great light weight stroller
Body: We needed a stroller that would roll on any surface and this one works well on grass or carpet. It was easy to assemble and we love the sun bonnet.

Author: Christina Fordyce
Title: Best umbrella stroller for the price - bonus features
Body: This is probably the best umbrella style stroller out there for this price. You won‚Äôt find others for this price that have a canopy, cup holders, and basket storage. The five point harness is great - prevents my toddler from leaning forward out of the seat. It‚Äôs a little rough on a bumpy sidewalk, but you‚Äôd expect that from plastic wheels. You get what you pay for. That being said, this is perfect for a little portable stroller to throw in the trunk or to take traveling. Great alternative to our big travel system. The basket doesn‚Äôt have a ton of space - can‚Äôt fit a diaper backpack for example - but some storage is better than none. I can throw a couple jackets and my wallet down there and a water bottle. The cup holders are also handy and I like to stick keys, Kleenex, or wipes in the zipper pouch between the handles. The adjustable reclining seat is also a huge bonus for an umbrella stroller! Makes stroller naps easier. Highly recommend.

Author: Dominique
Title: Great Stroller
Body: My daughter loves it. Has grown with her from 1 month to 11 months

Author: Sydni Loftus
Title: Replacement pieces
Body: Part of the buckle that fastens baby in broke. it's the little hope that attaches the shoulder strap to the strap that goes around belly. Not even sure how it happened. We are not rough this stroller and use it only here and thereThe manufacturer offered ZERO assistant we dont replace bucklesI am outside of the 90 warranty that comes with stroller, so its bascailly a useless stroller after 8 months. Which is quite lousy. I have a two year old and a baby on the way. We use this for air travel and to keep kiddo under control when she has to come to work with usThe next foldable stroller I buy will most certainly be a different brand

Author: Andrews
Title: Wheels are not good everything else is
Body: I loved this stroller the second I pulled it out. Why only three stars? I loved the seat, the handles, set up was easy. It wasn‚Äôt until I started pushing it that everything went downhill. One of the wheels doesn‚Äôt touch the ground but that didn‚Äôt seem to affect performance. The material of the wheels is made of some sort of foam which is worse quality than my $10 plastic wheels. That wasn‚Äôt the deal breaker, though. The thing I couldn‚Äôt stand was how the front wheels didn‚Äôt swivel so the stroller was impossible to turn without scraping the wheels on the ground. Those foam wheels will not last because they do not swivel and have to scrape to turn. I returned for that alone.

Author: Griffin and Kirsten Cholger
Title: Not Durable
Body: I‚Äôve had this stroller for about a week and have used it about 5 times, taking it from the trunk of the car, going for a walk, and then back in the trunk. Today while on my walk, I noticed these tears. Very disappointed.

Author: Melissa
Title: Love it

I have to wrestle it to drive straight and the wheels keep getting stuck in weird positions or not spinning (even when I have them locked in a forward position). I always end up using my heavier jogging stroller because it works so much better.

I also wanted one that had storage underneath. This has been perfect so far and I like that it also has a cup holder for the parent and a little zip storage by the cup holders that I usually put my phone in. The bottom storage isn‚Äôt huge, but works well enough for a day trip holding the necessary items. Would recommend this stroller especially for the money

Body: Really good stroller frees up a lot of space in my trunk folds just like a regular umbrella stroller Really recommend it Especially for traveling with a toddler this stroller would be perfect My toddler is 15 months 26 pounds she fits perfect in the stroller and still have lots of Room to grow in The canopy also comes in handy it does give a lot of shade The cup Holder it's OK not that big but the bag you can actually put a lot of stuff in it The bottom storage is not that big but not too small like the kolcraft one Again it's a really good stroller for the price way better than having A bulky stroller this is more of a regular umbrella stroller with all the features of a bulky stroller The only con but I would say it have is one of the wheels does not touch the floor much It does not affect the Handle of it I think eventually it will wear off and touch the floor I am 5,5 And I have no problem with the height of the stroller I don't kick the wheels I don't have to Hunch down its actually Higher than a regular umbrella stroller .

Title: Excellent for short and local walks
Body: I bought this inexpensive stroller for my five-month-old grandson, who spends three days a week with me. It is ideal for my (and his) needs. He is able to sit in it quite comfortably because he is a very tall boy for his age. The ride is smooth and comfortable. Storage is perfectly adequate.If I were to look after him for five days, say, I would choose a lighter-coloured stroller (to repel the sun) with a less plasticy texture. I think that, in summer heat, this stroller will make any baby sweaty and sticky if trips are too long.In short, excellent value for the price.

I‚Äôm constantly having to pull it back to the sidewalk. It isn‚Äôt super easy to fold up and I don‚Äôt like the way it ‚Äúreclines‚Äù. I wish I had paid more for the next model up.

It is light enough for him to flip over, he loves to spin the wheels, he can climb in it and slide out (when in the house playing with it unbuckled), he pushes it around with no problem. He is 13 months and i love that he love it. Yes its easy to just fold up and put in your trunk, smooth ride, front wheels rotate 360. Has a tray for him and storage at bottom. Yes i would definitely recommend this stroller.

Author: Shannon Lojeski
Title: Good price for a decent stroller
Body: Hey everyone! If you‚Äôre looking for an affordable umbrella stroller this is a good fit!We‚Äôre heading to Nashville in July and currently own a big britex car seat. It was a little to large to want to deal with at an airport so I started to search for something smaller and lighter.Our britex feels as tho it is 40-50lbs when it is folding and lifting it into an SUV.This is maybe 5-8lbs it is very light.When fully put together I can lift it over head no problem beside it being top heavy.Once folded it is even easier to lift.A few things I noticed and did not like.The back of the seat isn‚Äôt very comfortable. The bars that lower and raise it from slightly laying down to sitting up stick out.Once laying down it is much better (does not fully recline)The pockets for the cups are pretty small and would be best for taller skinny cups no cups with handles.It definitely is better than the $24 ones at Walmart but I think over $40.00 is pushing its value.

Title: Exactly what I expected
Body: Nice stroller for the price.The original stroller came with the canopy unable to fully open because there was over stitching on one side. The seller reached out to me the day after I left a message. They don‚Äôt have individual canopies for this stroller so they had to send me a whole new stroller. It arrived quickly. I printed the return label and sent the original one back. Too easy!Our little guy is just turning 10 months and is 24 pounds. I have a Bob stroller but needed something quick and lightweight for errands. This stroller fits that need but nothing more. I wouldn‚Äôt want to have to push it a long distance or through the mall but it is great for a trip to our pediatrician‚Äôs office!Overall this stroller is exactly what I expected. I would recommend it to anyone looking for something quick and easy for running errands but not for parks or anywhere with uneven surfaces or long distance.

Author: B. Kim
Title: Decent price, ok stroller.
Body: This stroller is great for quick stops while traveling with baby. However.... it has its pros and cons.Pros:Very lightweight.Easy to fold.Easy to turn.Sturdy.Handle grip is comfortable.Has a harness that most strollers this size does not have.Easy to buckle.Nice padding.Easy to wipe down.Compact, and great for places you know a regular stroller would be just too big.Cons:The umbrella is way to high and does not fully shade baby.The umbrella only folds partial way forward, and DOES NOT SHADE baby.The umbrella has to come off each and every time you put away the stroller.The ‚Äòbasket‚Äô underneath is hardly a storage compartment. There‚Äôs no room to slide your had between the bottom of the seat, and into the basket storage area.The front wheels are kinda weird. Sometimes they touch the floor, and sometimes the inside wheels are up, making it a little hard to maneuver, or steer.Overall, it was a decent price, and it‚Äôs lightweight, great for quick trips in and out of the store.

Author: Christy D.
Title: Hated it...returned it immediately!
Body: I thought I could get off cheap and get this umbrella stroller for my almost 1 yr old son. I searched so long for one that was nice enough to use as my everyday stroller, mainly to take up less space in my truck and be lighter weight. This was NOT it! The minute I removed it from the box I could just feel and see what a cheap product this is. It's flimsy, they seat is so uncomfortable. My son didn't even want to be in it 5 min rolling around my living room. And even though it says reclining...it's a pull strap that brings it slightly up and down. It's very hard to close and the ride isn't smooth and effortless. I returned it and ended up spending the money on the Uppababy G Lite, which is amazing. This stroller, definitely not. Even if you need to stay in this price point, I would keep looking.

It just did not seem comfortable at all.Yes, it was lighter- but that was not reason enough to make it better. I also loved the fact that the Graco reclined significantly more.Unfortunately this one is going to be returned.

Title: Easy to maneuver and a little extra storage

On our flight to and from New Orleans, 3 days sight seeing in New Orleans, 9 days on the cruise ship, excursions at all 5 ports. It is fast to fold up and put down and easy to maneuver. The storage under the stroller is small but able to hold diapers, wipes, sun screen, change of clothes, her tablet and sun hat. It has 2 cup holders and a smaller pouch with a zipper that I stored my phone, sunglasses, a small package of animal crackers and chapstick. This is a little but mighty stroller.

Title: Great travel stroller
Body: I bought this to lug around my toddler for an upcoming trip. Honestly, it has everything I like in a stroller: easy to fold, easy to maneuver, decent storage basket, good sized canopy, and a cup holder. It help up well for our trip but it isn't sturdy enough for daily use in our neighborhood (lots of old brick sidewalks and cobbled streets). The only cons are the independent brakes (it's just an extra step to brake two different wheels) and the build quality (one of the four wheels on the front doesn't touch the ground and the canopy pops off on one side every time i folded it). That being said, for the price, it is an excellent purchase. Very pleased.

Title: Disappointing
Body: Very disappointed in this stroller. We purchased it for an overseas vacation and it just didn't hold up for those 10 days. The wheels went out of balance and one set completely stopped spinning because it wasn't touching the ground. Then, another set got messed up and wobbled like a broken shopping cart wheel. This all made it really difficult to maneuver, since it couldn't be easily pushed in a straight path. The stroller does fold down to a manageable size, but not as small or light as I had hoped. Honestly, we should have just gone with the cheapest possible umbrella stroller. Lighter and fewer parts to go wrong. We ended up ditching it after the trip. It wasn't even worth bringing home, sadly.

Title: Keep looking, don‚Äôt buy this one.
Body: I‚Äôm not one to be picky and usually don‚Äôt mind a few minor inconveniences to save a buck, but this stroller is junk. The canopy won‚Äôt stay attached, always popping off the stroller. The front wheels have a locking feature to keep them from turning, but even when unlocked, they only turn sometimes. Most of the time you have to slide the stroller sideways. The wheels are so slick and made with the thinnest cheap plastic, it feels like running over a small rock might dent the wheel. The overall material is cheap and was not comfortable AT ALL for my baby. She was sliding down the whole time, and the buckle doesn‚Äôt fit snug or safe. We bought this to travel, but I used it one day and carried her the rest of the time, and we returned it as soon as we got home.

Now when I stroll her, I can see that these outer wheels do not move at all so it is only on inner set...is this a defective piece? I am traveling day after tomorrow and don‚Äôt have time turn this back and get a replacement. I don‚Äôt know what I will do.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Tall enough for someone just over 5'5. Folded and unfolded perfectly every time!"
Body: I'm 64 years old and do not have a baby. I do have balance issues. I fell about 5 years ago and it changed my life and limited my walking and travel. I came up with the idea of using a light weight stroller and adding weights so it didn't pop up while I was walking. I purchased ankle weights that worked perfectly. The velcro straps fit through the openings and still allowed the stroller to fold and unfold without any added effort. We just came back from a trip to Pittsburgh and Falling Water. I was able to keep up using my stroller on every kind of surface, including loose stones. We folded it and took it on public transport and into restaurants. It gave me the support and flexibility to walk like a normal person and not have to hold on to a cane and my husband. We stopped in St Augustine on the way home and walked 6 miles in one day! I could not do that without this little stroller!

Author: Chris
Title: 3D Mini compared to Graco TraveLite
Body: I ordered both the Graco and Summer 3D stroller. Here is my opinion on the Graco compared with the Summer.Graco has taller handles, great for taller people, not necessary for my husband and me since we are of average height.The storage bin is much more accessible and is larger on the Graco due to thefolding mechanism (see photos). I prefer the Graco when it comes to folding and unfolding, they have provided larger handles for those maneuvers. However the latch that keeps the stroller closed doesn‚Äôt keep the stroller as compact as it could be. Graco has provided a carrying handle mounted onto a side bar, a nice feature I think. The seat does recline, but certainly not suited for a baby under 6months. The straps are adjustable, but the Summer stroller allows for much more adjustable variations. Both strollers reclined with ease. One downside of the Graco strap: when unbuckled the over the shoulder straps don‚Äôt stay attached to the waist straps. This make for 2 issues. 1. The strap comfort pads slide off every time you unbuckle 2. You have to reattach these every time you want to buckle up the kiddo. I appreciated the Summer stroller in this aspect, the shoulder straps clip onto the waist straps. Allowing them to be removed, only when you so choose. I preferred the Graco cup holder over the Summer, because it‚Äôs removable and plastic. The Summer cup holder is made of material, it is flimsy, and not easily cleanable. The plus on the Summer stroller cup holder is that it has a zipper pouch for accessories, phone, etc. The Graco has a removable lap bar, while the Summer stroller does not offer this feature. They both seemed equally easy to push. The Graco has bigger wheels, making it easier to push through dirt and rocks. Overall the Summer Lite Stroller is smaller, more compact, and lighter. My husband ended up picking the Summer Lite Stroller due to its smaller size and he preferred its features over the Graco. We gifted the Graco to my 6ft tall sister and brother-in law who we thought would appreciate its larger/taller size.

I wish I would‚Äôve went with the graco stroller.. lesson learned spend a little more on a quality stroller!

It is longer than my old big stroller, so it doesn't fit back between the wheel wells in the trunk like I'd hoped, but generally takes up less space, which was the point. FYI, if you are having trouble opening it, you have to release the strap that is used to make the seat back go from a reclined position to an upright position. If that strap is tight, you won't be able to get the stroller opened. Otherwise easy to use. So lightweight I have to be sure to strap in the toddler before I load the stroller with anything, and vice versa.

Author: J. Meilahn
Title: Not what I was looking for
Body: I was hoping to love this as I am looking for a great light weight stroller. I want one stroller for everything and this is not it. The basket is ok size, but hard to get to because of the frame, so that is not going to work for me. I want something I can throw the diaper bag, purse, blanket, toys or snacks in without having to bend down and try to fit it in between some bars. Also, I want to be able to fold this with out bending down to left up the lever and that wasn't possible either. Not a fan of the canopy, not big enough. Took back to the store after wanting to love it because it was less than 15 pounds and $50. Still looking for a great stroller that is easy to fold, light weight, doesn't take a up a lot of room in car, has large basket, and canopy that serves the purpose. The hunt continues.

Author: Debbie-K
Title: Perfect for travel with small toddler
Body: Folds easily. Super light weight. Easy travel.But....my tall 2.5 year old was too big for it! I should‚Äôve caught it before buying it. Just keep that in mind when you order.My daughter is 98th percentile in height‚Äîso I‚Äôm sure she‚Äôs the exception. :)

Author: elsie almodovar
Title: Perfect
Body: As described. Just what I need!

Author: Katterine Nesta
Title: Awesome Stroller
Body: Love this stroller! I was looking for something more lightweight than the travel system stroller I had. So So So Easy to take out of the trunk and fold! Love it. Great for quick shopping and small trips. Awesome everyday stroller. Do wish the bottom compartment was easier to get to and a bit bigger. But all in all it was a great purchase.

Body: The quality of this product is poor. I used it for the first time to go out of town and the wheel got messed up and the soft part of the handle started to come apart. I regret this purchase.

Body: We bought this because we needed something practical, lightweight and easy to fold. For these three aspects we‚Äôre satisfied.

Body: Just used this for my son's 1st flight and it was perfect! Easy to push with one hand while pushing luggage. Folds/unfolds easily and the extended cover is great. The only downside is that the shade kept popping off but it's easy to reattach so no big deal.

Author: Jerriana Roland
Title: Good inexpensive stroller
Body: As far as inexpensive strollers go, this one is a good buy. It is a little tricky to fold up. I wish it had a little more durability. It seems flimsy and the tires don‚Äôt turn easily. But it gets the job done.

Title: Not smooth to push
Body: Doesn‚Äôt maneuver easily, wheels stick

Author: Laydbug
Title: Good for the price
Body: Lightweight, easy to fold and easy to travel by airplane with. Small basket but more storage than most umbrella strollers including small pocket and cup holders that came in handy. Shade came loose a few times after being folded, but easily reattached. A little narrow. Would have been perfect if the seat reclined more so my son could‚Äôve took a decent nap in it.

Author: Trevor William Jones

Body: If you don't want to use a huge stroller, get this light weight and easy to use one!

Author: WorkinLady
Title: Great Stroller!
Body: I bought this stroller for my 5 month old daughter to take on vacation with us.It folds easily and quickly and takes up minimal space in the car. I like that it has the shoulder straps as she cant sit up by herself unassisted yet. She seems very comfortable in this stroller. Wheels work great and it is east to navigate. The storage underneath (while not large) was very convenient for storing small things during our 3 day trip. The cup holders on top were in the bag were deep and i was able to fit my phone in the included bag as well.im 5'2 and this stroller was a great height for me. but i could see a tall person being uncomfortable with the handle height.for the price this is definitely a 5 star stroller in my eyes

Author: Ann Harrison
Title: Perfect

Author: Emma
Title: Perfect for a super tall three year old for international flights!
Body: Took it on a loooong international flight. Three layovers. My daughter is 3.5, very tall. Worked like a charm!!! It's weightless, folds in one second, can be easily dragged with one hand when folded. It reclines enough for a child to be able to sleep in it. Perfect all around. Can't believe how such a quality thing can be so cheap!

Author: Lise
Title: Amazing
Body: Obsessed with this stroller. I literally got 2 other friends to buy it. I never thought i would be so excited about a stroller lol light weight, comfortable to walk with, nice storage, reclines. It‚Äôs so much better then a normal little light weight one.

Body: This stroller is convenient, easy to put together, and works well on normal surfaces! It's light and fits great in my Ford Fusion trunk! We are taking it to the beach with us this coming week so I will update my review if needed!

Author: Melissa crosby
Title: Niceee
Body: Really liked it! It made with through a day at the beach üòÅ

I like it so much better than my big jogger, for one, because my plus smartphone actually fits in the pouch.The only thing I‚Äôd like better would be if we could adjust the height of the handles. They‚Äôre an inch too low.

Author: Agnes Dabney
Title: Great to travel with
Body: For when he has doctors appointment

Author: joannie
Title: Too Short for taller babies/toddlers
Body: I bought this hoping to upgrade my 2 year old into a light-weight stroller.Pros- Very compact, light weight, and easy to put togetherCons- The stroller seat is Very short and my son's head hung off the top of the seat by 2-3 inches, he is 34.5 inches tall.Returned the stroller and still on hunt for a better stroller....

Author: Mamicandy
Title: Great product for price.
Body: My 5 month old is very comfortable. The stroller has a 5 point harness. Has a bit of cushion to protect from straps in the ears. Have a visor to protect from the sun. A compartment to hold things on the bottom of the stroller and a compartment to hold moms or dads water. Folds into an umbrella stroller. All in all worth the money. Thumbs up. Does everything a big gigantic stroller does.

Author: Meaghan M
Title: Wheels wobbly on second use
Body: I bought this stroller specifically for some flights and travel we have coming up this summer. After our first trip (second flight, coming home) two of the four wheels are now wobbly and feel like they're going to fall off at any second. Doesn't really feel safe taking my daughter on any more trips in this stroller as she is just getting jerked around. Also the sun shade comes to a really dumb looking point, (I assume from being folded) not a rounded shade how it looks in the picture. This doesn't affect the functionality at all, but doesn't look that great either. For the price, I would have said it was worth it, if it lasted longer than one round trip flight... bummed.

Author: Jonathan Golden
Title: Not for chunky/big-booty babies!!
Body: This stroller has potential! I agree with other reviews that it is not for tall babies or chunkier babies. My big-booty baby was so uncomfortable like there wasn't enough space between the back of the stroller and where their legs dangled. We used it twice and then sold it. Steering was easy! Loved the little basket/cup holder for adults. Basket underneath is a joke. Overall wouldn't recommend unless you have a tiny baby or a very slender baby. Upgrading to the Baby Jogger City Tour Lux which is 5x the price but worth it for all the fails this stroller has.

Author: JN
Title: Great upgraded version of a standard umbrella stroller
Body: Not as easy to fold close as it is to open, but not too difficult. Love the zippered pouch - great for storing keys, cellphone, etc. But the storage area underneath is difficult to use - it's not easy to put things in and take out of it (you have to be able to shove it through the stroller's poles). Also really like the deep cup holder pockets, holds drink pretty snugly and there's less spilling when going over bumps or up and down steps.

Author: Momof1
Title: Super light and has a recline!
Body: I have and love the 3D tote but wanted even lighter stroller. More of an umbrella stroller but with a recline for napping. I spent a really long time looking at lists reading reviews and comparing the few options for a light weight stroller with a recline . I was torn between this one (the Mini) and the Lite convenience but the Mini was on sale here and I'm so glad I went with this one. It does seem more slender than the Lite but my 38 tall 40 Pound kid fits great. It is noticeably significantly lighter (at 11 lbs) than the Tote (17.5 lbs I think) which is a pretty light full size stroller.

Author: KMoss
Title: Great for travel
Body: Great travel stroller-good handlebar height for taller parents, easy fold/unfold-fits right through scanner at airports. Convenient parent cup holder/pocket

Author: Jessica
Title: Quality
Body: Very durable product and was easy to assemble and is light weight and easy for traveling or putting in a vehicle.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: The sun visor is too small
Body: Good stroller but the sun visor is too small don‚Äôt cover good

Author: Donna Emslie

Body: Kind of hard to fold down, for me, others may find it easy

Author: Darlinsky
Title: Nice
Body: I love this stroller, very light and easy to fold

Author: Christy Bradley
Title: good quality
Body: great for day trips

Author: Sean O.
Title: The differences between this and the 3D Lite
Body: I just bought this Mini, as an upgrade from the cheap Cosco umbrella stroller from Target and Wal-Mart. I haven't used the Lite, but looking at the listing for it, it seems the main differences are:1) Folding mechanism. The way the Mini folds is similar to the basic Cosco, with a metal bar that hinges in the middle. The Lite appears to have a fancier mechanism, with a footstep and handle that you pull.2) Recline mechanism. The way the Mini reclines is by pulling a strap which tightens itself behind the fabric at the top area of the seat. Very simple. The Lite appears to have 2 red buttons on each side that you push to raise or lower the seatback into 3 set positions. Seems a bit more complicated, but also might operate a bit nicer? Certainly would contribute to the price difference at least.3) Built in carry strap. Mini doesn't have one. The Lite does.4) Cup holders. The mini has 2 in a piece of fabric that stretches between the handles. The Lite only has 1.5) Basket. Mini's basket seems a bit smaller and holds less than the Lite.6) Folded size. When folded, the Mini's wheels by the handle stick out a bit, takes up a bit more room. The Lite looks like it gets more compact.7) Weight. The Mini is about 2 lbs lighter than the Lite.Features that look the same, or nearly the same: Similar child size capacity, 5 point child harness, cushioned seat, 5 wheels, swivel front wheels that can lock into position, and have some shock absorption, a basket, shade and sun visor, good handle height and space to not keep stepping on wheels as you push.Conclusion: I'm happy with my purchase. I got the Mini on sale for $33. Compared to the $90 price for the Lite, I'm more than OK not having the few other features, they're not worth paying 3x as much. I just want a lightweight stroller that's easy to push, holds a few extra things plus my kid, and folds up small. The Mini fits my needs

Author: Dale
Title: Good size
Body: Great little stroller

Author: Deserie Peguero
Title: Great price as well!
Body: I love this stroller, perfect for those times you need light travel options.

Author: Sarah

Body: This a great, budget friendly yet quality umbrella stroller. The built in cup holder is amazing and the basket is adequate. The recline is nice for naps while out and about. The sunshade leaves a bit to be desired, but its not the worst. The 5 point harness with strap covers is easy to adjust and comfortable. Overall its a good quality stroller at a great price.

Author: Devon Pavlek
Title: Great light weight stroller
Body: This stroller is perfect for what I needed. It‚Äôs so light weight with great features. Love the bottom storage, the soft cup/zipper pouch on the handle bars.

Title: Great extra stroller
Body: We love this stroller for errands, quick trips downtown and to just keep in the car for unexpected uses. We haven't traveled with it yet but will in the future. I wanted a small stroller with a canopy and storage basket. The storage basket is on the small side but it's a small stroller so that was expected. Its definitely large enough to hold the essentials (diapers, changing pad, wallet etc). The cup holder caddy is great for water bottles/car keys etc. My only gripe is the canopy Velcro comes apart very easily when you put the canopy down. If the Velcro was a little stronger or had longer pieces it would hold up a little better.

Will be buying a different more expensive stroller that is easier to maneuver and fold.

The sunshade is great but took a few minutes to find where to clip it to put it on. If my daughter pulls really hard on it to open it she can pull the velcro and snap off (she is 3 years old). But it's simple to put back on now that I know where the snap is. Overall we are very happy and will enjoy taking this as our travel stroller!

Author: Kimberly
Title: Amazing!
Body: I love this stroller! It has two cup holders, which I didn‚Äôt realize how much is like. I have a jogging stroller for outside, but this is great for the mall and other places with flat floors. It is so lightweight! Perfect for what we needed!

Author: Betty Migueles
Title: Great
Body: I would have given this a 5 stars but the basket is small and difficult to get things in and out unless it‚Äôs small. Besides the basket it‚Äôs an awesome umbrella stroller and the price is great.

Author: Amazon Customer

Body: This stroller is great! Our little guy gets so excited when he gets in it. We are taking it with us to Disney soon. It's lightweight, easy to fold up, and rides smooth. So excited about this buy!

Author: mountain mama

Author: lucyeth

Body: I purchase to use on vacation and specifically the airport and flight. What a Disappointment! The quality was so cheap that I returned it right away. Honestly the ones at Walmart that you get for 15.00 are better than this one. Front wheel didn‚Äôt even roll on one side. Stroller was difficult to maneuver and fabric looked cheap. Assembly was easy. Just snap on wheels and canopy. It was harder to get back in the box than to assemble. Not worth 50.00.

Author: Hey Yu
Title: Missing canopy
Body: The stroller is lightweight but the package arrived missing the canopy which was very disappointing as we can't really use it now going to the sunny place we are traveling to.

Author: Amazon Customer

Body: Perfect for on the go, it's light weight/slim design makes it fit perfectly in the back of my Tahoe. I am able to just leave it back there all of the time so I never have to think about grabbing it before going somewhere. Great value for the price point.

Author: Terry
Title: Nice stroller but.....
Body: Nice stroller for the price, has a lot of cool features...but the wheels are very hard solid plastic...which is pretty horrible on roads and rough surfaces. They vibrate and chatter loudly, plus get road damage and chewed up easily. They should have a soft rubber covering of some sort to decrease the vibrations and lack of grip on hard , rough surfaces.

Author: EK

Author: Megan Hensley
