Author: Francee
Title: Great affordable stroller
Body: I had a cheap umbrella stroller before purchasing the Summer Infant 3D Mini Stroller, so this is like a Cadillac in comparison. I test drove it with my 11-month old through our house and he was happy in it. Super easy to assemble. The cupholders (two) and zippered pouch are handy. The basket is a little small and partially blocked by the frame, but at least there is a basket. One piece of advice on the recline: have the seat completely upright before sitting your child in it. It's hard to get it out of the recline position while they are in the seat.

Author: T Dailey
Title: Lightweight but difficult to fold.
Body: Came fully assembled except for sun shade which was nice. Lightweight and doesn't take up much space which is why I bought it. Difficult to fold up, I have to flip it over on the ground and kick the folding mechanism. My baby doesn't like it, he doesn't sit very comfortably in it. He's 6 months old and his legs dangle low towards the ground.

Author: CHRISTINA Moore
Title: Great Stroller
Body: I love how light weight the stroller is. It is very easy to assemble as all you have to do is snap the wheels on. Love that the visor goes down far enough to keep sun out of my son's face and also block wind. Easy to clean. And the storage compartment is nylon so if it were to get wet is will dry easily and quickly.

Author: Mama
Title: Handles are Not Awkward
Body: My husband wanted a stroller that was y‚Äôall enough for him and not awkward. This seems to be just that. I like all the storage! The bottom pocket is deep and the cup holder on top is perfect! It folds up easily with the stroller and is sturdy for whatever I need it to hold. The umbrella part of the stroller keeps popping off while in storage in the back of my car, but everything else is great! I also like how easy it is to latch together so it doesn‚Äôt unfold.

Author: Becky L Sines
Title: Do your research first
Body: Love this lightweight stroller. Only flaw is the umbrella part doesn‚Äôt stay on it pops off and unbuttons and I thought it laid further back so it‚Äôs hard to feed my grandson while pushing him and the steering of it it‚Äôs tough and wheels stick and you have to roll it backwards and then push forward again several times. Would of done better research if I knew all of that.

Author: Lisa
Title: Light weight, good storage, amazing value!
Body: This was the best stroller I could have asked for for our 7 day vacation in NYC with a 19 month old!! It had a surprising amount of storage space for how small it was! The first day it felt a little hard to steer and I was bummed, but it just needed to be broken in a bit. Now we‚Äôre home, and I‚Äôve used it for more of our outings than I do our usual heavy duty stroller!

Author: Leinababes
Title: Best traveling stroller
Body: I‚Äôm not the best at assembling but even I figured this stroller out!! I was looking for a lightweight traveling stroller and this is it, it‚Äôs easy to put together, easy to fold and has a latch so it stays folded! The stroller is heavy duty for such a lightweight stroller and I‚Äôm very pleased with my purchase

Author: lois ann ripley
Title: X
Body: It was easy to put together. I‚Äôm waiting on my great niece to come over and check out how it fits her but it seems nice

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: A lot of great features for the price!
Body: We bought this stroller for quick errands since our other strollers are a tad too bulky to be throwing in and out of the car all the time just for a short trip into a shop, bank, etc. So let‚Äôs start with assembly- it is very simple to put together, all you have to do is snap on the wheels, the parent console, and the canopy. This stroller is thin but fairly tall and lightweight. It folds/unfolds very easily and leaves a lot of extra room in your trunk when traveling. The wheels on this stroller swivel which makes it super easy to get around with. It has a great muti-angle recline to allow your child to sit up and sight see or lay down and take a nap. Another great quality of this stroller is that it has a storage bin at the bottom- not great for large items like big diaper bags since the bar gets in the way, but it‚Äôs great for smaller items. It comes with a great parent organizer for two drinks and a zipper pocket for phones, keys, chapstick, etc. The seat of the stroller is fairly narrow- but it‚Äôs a mini convenience stroller, it‚Äôs supposed to be that way! The canopy doesn‚Äôt come out super far, so it‚Äôs not great when the sun is out infront of you, but it works for when the sun is overhead. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô2 and my husband is 6‚Äô2 and we can both push this stroller comfortably. This stroller has a lot of great features for its low price and it definitely gets the job done!

Author: Sandra
Title: great value!
Body: Excellent quality for this price!

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Love this stroll r
Body: Light easy for travel yet has everything you want in an umbrella stroller

Author: Gen Marceau
Title: Sun canopy is useless
Body: Granted for the price this is a good stroller, but its difficult to fold and unfold and the canopy pretty much becomes useless after you fold it up for the first time. The canopy is supposed to open up and cover my son, and since we live in Texas, a sun shade is vital. However, the other day I unfolded it for a doctor's appointment and the plastic canopy ribs are now suck in a V shape instead of the U shape that need to be, which means I can't fold the canopy up anymore. This was only the second time its been used and already one of the most important pieces is useless. This is a great stroller if you want something mobile and lightweight but DON'T need the sun canopy. I unfortunately will need to find something else.

Author: Jason Sipp
Title: Excellent stroller for traveling alone with a child in airports
Body: Bottom line: Purchased this stroller specifically to use in major airports and I‚Äôm very pleased with its design and performance. I highly recommend it if you‚Äôre traveling alone with a young child.What I needed: Because I regularly fly alone to visit family in a different state with my toddler, I needed a stroller that is lightweight, maneuverable with one hand, and easily collapses; I got my money‚Äôs worth with the Summer 3D mini!What I got: This stroller is compact and utilitarian while comfortable for my growing child. The handles are at a good height and angle to avoid wrist fatigue and the wheel distance is sufficient so I‚Äôm not always kicking it (I‚Äôm 5‚Äô5‚Äù). I was extremely pleased that I can push it with one hand - after a little practice - so I am able to pull my suitcase behind me and be self sufficient from the curb. You do need to reach down and use your hand to disengage the safety mechanism to fold the stroller, however it automatically locks into the folded position and easily unfolds with one hand (I just use my foot to secure it in the open position). For child security, it‚Äôs got an adjustable 5 point harness with padding that is simple to operate for an adult; I like the additional shoulder straps so the kid can‚Äôt reach forward and pull the stroller over. The double wheels are perfect for stability and maneuvering on any surface, even on a gravel hiking path in the rain!Perks: It comes with under seat storage, albeit minimal. The designer was smart and added a double drink holder that‚Äôs got a zipper compartment. The sunshade is detachable (DO remember to remove this before you gatecheck the stroller, it might pop off if the baggage handlers are rough with it!) and long enough to be useful at sunset/going uphill facing the sun. The seat reclines slightly to keep a sleeping child‚Äôs neck at a safe angle.My only frustration was figuring out why the front wheels weren‚Äôt moving properly, but this is actually a happy problem. Apparently, both the front and back wheels each have a way to lock each individual wheel in place so you kid doesn‚Äôt roll downhill. The front pair have a little switch to lock them that is often bumped when the stroller is folded and being handled by airport staff, but ultimately I‚Äôm glad they do lock so it‚Äôs a minor inconvenience.Why I love it: I HATE inefficiency and being stuck in airport security and this stroller helps me streamline my boarding process for a less stressful (I am flying with a toddler, let‚Äôs be realistic) traveling experience. I‚Äôve flown with this stroller multiple times and both I and my child like it so much it‚Äôs now my go-to stroller for walks and shopping trips. I highly recommend the 3D mini: it‚Äôs durable, worth the money, and has all the features!

Author: Thria L.
Title: Very lightweight and easy to use!!!
Body: I haven't tried this stroller outside yet, but compared to the my old one ( universal stroller fram that we used for the airport/travel) this stroller is very easy to maneuver, and to put together and to put away. It is so slim very light weight. For the price it is definitely a good purchased!! Will update more when we use it outside next week!!! Can't wait üòâ

Author: Tia
Title: Buy this one!!!
Body: We loved our first one so much we bought another one for the newest addition to our family. Sun shade is great, never any issues with the wheels, super lightweight, parent organizer is fantastic! We tried other umbrella strollers, this is by far the best! My 12 year old son picked the first one out after trying it out at Babies R Us, we had several others that the wheels kept getting locked or turning side ways when going straight. He would get so frustrated, (proud big brother always wanted to push the stroller!) so when we needed a second stroller he said to order this one again. Best Umbrella Stroller we‚Äôve found!

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: It‚Äôs ‚Äú

Author: Sean
Title: Poor Quality
Body: This stroller was great for quick trips, and was easy to fold/unfold. However, the quality was very poor as the canopy did not stay attached and had to continually be reattached, and the plastic buckle cracked and broke after minimal usage. I ended up throwing the stroller in the garbage.Also, I am relatively tall, and had to walk bent over to securely hold the handles.Overall, this stroller is not worth the money. You'd be better off buying something else.

Author: farmfreshk
Title: Worked well for bigger kids at Disney
Body: Got it for Disney. Worked really well. Would easily work for kids that are 7-8 years old and marginally over the weight/height limits for pushing around an amusement park. They can't use the shoulder straps and sun shade obviously, but this was the best cheap option stroller for our 7 yo that we found and it didn't disappoint. Cup holders and zipper pouch were handy.The latch that holds it closed when folded is about 1 too long so it doesn't close as tight as you think it should when folded, but that can also be useful if you want to leave a raincoat or blanket in the net under the seat and still fold it up.If you're over 6ft tall you might wish the handles we're a couple inches longer, but that's literally every umbrella stroller.

Author: Joanne R. Allen

Author: Bobby J Jones

Author: Jessica
Title: Not a bad investment at all

Author: Holly Pitner
Title: Nothing love everythinf about it
Body: Love it was easy to put together and love that it has everything of a regular stroller but folds up for easy fast storage.

Author: Matthew Floyd
Title: Love everything about this stroller
Body: I just got this stroller for my grand daughter who is 1 and a half and weighs almost 24 ibs. It was very easy to put together and use. She climbed in it right away. We went for a walk for an hour or so. First off i was not expecting the pouch with cup holders. Was great! Held her cup great and could hold my Tervus cup easily. It will also hold everything i need for her. The space underneath is decent size it will hold her smaller diaper bag which is great for us. The wheels rolled very easy and smooth. It was also very easy to push and folds up very easily. Nice and compact. Not to short for me either and i am 5'7. She was very comfortable and fell asleep while on our walk. It lays back nicely. I am happpy i choose this stroller and would recommend buying it.

Author: Ryan Carpus
Title: Great features!
Body: I'm happily surprised with this stroller. It's pretty good quality for an umbrella stroller and has a lot of features that most don't...all at a better price than many of the others! It has cup holders for the adults, a small storage area underneath, and the seat is able to recline (not a ton, but better than nothing!) It's very easy to use. The only downside is that the wheels don't turn (obviously they spin, but only straight). Overall, great stroller at a great price.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Doesn't fit 25 pounds
Body: I loved it when I first tried it, but after a couple weeks I noticed the buckle was too tight on my son who is only 25 pounds. It is supposed to fit up to 45 pounds, but even all the way loosened barely clips and is uncomfortable on him. My return window ended but amazon is amazing and let me return it anyways.

Has everything I need at a price point I love - Would def buy again!‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-Update: after 1 year - still love this stroller. Parlant de roues, elles sont en plastique et pas en caoutchouc. Donc oubliez √ßa de sortir dehors avec !

Author: Maverine Volaine
Title: Quality is not what it once was
Body: As a busy mom of 5 who‚Äôs family travels often I have purchased this stroller more than once.So when I was looking for stroller to take on a long weekend getaway I knew this would be perfect‚Ä¶ NOPE! Firstly it arrived after the quoted time,it had clearly been sent back before,as it was without any tags or plastic wrap. Once I put the wheels on I noticed the canopy was busted and could not be repaired. None the less I needed it for the next day. Then the first time I used it (on Clifton Hill in Niagara Falls) I found that the shoulder strap that attaches to the lap belt was broken so my son was strapped into the stroller and I was able to wiggle out on an extreme busy street! As you can imagine I was not impressed. I have now shipped the defective stroller back and to my dismay, I have to wait for it to reach somewhere in the USA before receiving my refund! Not acceptable. As a Prime member I am supposed to have benefits that make returns easy. This is not what I expected.

Author: Jennifer Tremblay
Title: Great small and light stroller but...
Body: Very good stroller for foldability and lightweight. However, it's not squared correctly, so all four of the wheels never touch at the same time, only 2-3 at a time. The basket underneath is useful if a bit small, and the cupholder/top zip pocket is great for tissues and drinks, is standard sized (all of our water bottles fit in it, including the 360 cups). The seat seems comfortable, and can be adjusted to cant a bit backwards but not enough to sleep comfortably without a cover or something for baby to put their head on. The front bearings for the swivel feature are a bit gunked up and don't swivel as easily as in the beginning but we did some dirt road walks, maybe stay only on asphalt and concrete? Comfortable handles for the parents, they're the perfect height for me (5'1) but a bit on the low side for my husband (6'2). Would recommend as a second stroller (we have a big jogger type as a primary stroller) or for visiting the city (folds easily and quickly, and weighs next to nothing).

Title: You get what you pay for. Not great.
Body: This was the cheapest travel stroller I could get in a pinch. The price was great, but unfortunately the product was not. I have other products from this brand and have loved them, so was shocked I didn‚Äôt like this one. The wheels don‚Äôt turn on the back so you physically have to lift the stroller to pivot. One side of the alignment is slightly higher and one of the wheels isn‚Äôt level with the ground. The most frustrating thing is collapsing it. It‚Äôs this tiny little button on the steel frame that you can‚Äôt even press with just your foot. You need to get down and use both hands. Impossible to collapse with sandals on in the summer. My kid also leans right out of it. The straps aren‚Äôt super restricting, which isn‚Äôt the best safety wise. Save yourself the hassle and spend an extra hundred dollars or so to get a better travel system.

Author: Chris Hogan
Title: Great option for an easy to use, light weight daily driver with plenty of storage.
Body: This stroller is deceiving. It is light weight and might have you 2nd guessing if it will stand up to daily use. With over 2 years (2 kids) use on it, it has proven to be a better stroller than our first impressions left us thinking it would be. We had another stroller that cost much more and we wanted to spend less on a 2nd one. As it turns out, this stroller saw much more use than originally planned. It's no moving closet it but it stores more than enough to go shopping, a few hours in the park or day trips. It folds and opens up very easily and proved to be quite stable. The brakes are not as strong as your other stroller but they did their job. This model does not feature a full decline for sleeping purposes (it stops at about a 45¬∞ angle) but neither of our kids seemed to have been bothered by that.Based on our experience, it has proven itself over time and I do not hesitate to recommend it.

The wheels are hard foam, not plastic, which is good for grip and lifespan. My only real complaint is that the handles are too short. Im 6 feet tall and i cannot comfortably push the stroller because the handles aren't height adjustable. I have to lean over or use my knuckles on the handles instead of a nice solid grip. I guess dads weren‚Äôt the target demographic for this product. Other than that, i have no complaints.

Title: Great stroller great price
Body: Before I bought this I read the reviews. I took them with a grain of salt as some of the things people were complaining about were a little ridiculous. This stroller is easy to put together. It is light weight. I read some reviews that said the storage compartment isn't big. Well it's umbrella stroller so I want expecting the basket to be big. But it did the sun works and the rain shield perfectly. The Sun shield does only work depending where the sun is. But I never just rely on those I always put an additional sunshield over my daughter. This stroller works well when you need to go into a mask or a store as it is lightweight, easy to fold and doesn't take much room in the car. I love that it is a five point harness. I also love the fact that you can move the straps on the seat depending on the height of your child. For the price this stroller is exactly what I expected/needed.My one issue is my boyfriend is taller then me and the handles do not raise so he is hunched over when he pushes it.

Author: Kaz
Title: It's all right.
Body: Reasonable quality for the price. It's a heavy for the form factor, due to the cheap steel tubing. Better materials like aluminum or graphite could probably get this well under ten pounds, but not for seventy dollars. It is probably no lighter or heavier than other umbrella strollers in this size and price range. Wheels don't track on a level surface properly. Front leftmost wheel and rear rightmost often do not spin, causing uneven tire wear. The sun shade is a bit of a joke. When folded, the stroller is quite long; it will not lie flat in the trunk of my compact car. This is actually quite a silly design because even though the unit is made from three short sections (back/handle tubes, front wheel tubes, rear wheel tubes), when you fold it, the rear wheel tubes and handle tubes align end-to-end to form a straight line, causing the folded unit to be as long as it can possibly be. The handles are not adjustable, but due to their curved shape and vertical orientation, a 6'1 and a 5'2 person can grip this with equal comfort while maintaining a good posture, which is a big plus. The kid likes it. When going out, he points to the new stroller to say he wants to ride it instead of the big stroller, so this is kid approved. it. He loves to buckle himself these days, and it's easy to do with this stroller: it has a five point system, but with the shoulder points being attached by a kind of accessory hook, so the shoulder straps do not detach from the hip straps when the buckle is unlatched. That means it has the ease of buckling and unbuckling of a three point system.

Author: Lk
Title: It's alright but needs some work

You can straighten it up a bit but it just goes back. Wish it was even and flat with padding. I don't like the fact you have to release the seat yourself in order for it to recline and how you have to pinch the clasp while pushing it upright to be in seating position. For the price of the stroller sure maybe it's ok but still kind of a pain. I do however love how easy it is to fold compared to the 3D lite. There should be a carrying strap on the side also. Unfortunately returning it because I preferred the lite better even though it's more complicated to close. 4 stars only because I can close it within 3 seconds which is convenient.

Not big enough to hold my purse for easy access (I would really need to jam it in).3. The sun canopy looks like it should extend further based on the amount of material left by only goes so far. Your babe may need some sunglasses until they get tall enough for the visor portion to be effective.All in all I think it's great for the price point. I wouldn't use it for a long walk but for the mall or a quick walk to the park it's awesome.

It has cup holders but I don‚Äôt think I will use them unless it‚Äôs something I can close completely. It can‚Äôt be a hard cup holder because it needs to be able to fold but it‚Äôs nice there‚Äôs a zipper compartment with the cup holders. I have used it once and it worked great. The only downside is the ‚Äúrecliner‚Äù is like a tether you loosen and tighten. And the seat seems looser to me but I think I might just be used to the basic one we had for our daughter that was not as good as this one. I like that it has a locking mechanism to hold the stroller together when it‚Äôs folded. The basic ones don‚Äôt. The storage under the seat is small like some of the other reviews said but I didn‚Äôt expect much for a more compact stroller. It holds our change mat and a smaller purse if needed. I‚Äôm happy I spent the extra money for this one instead of buying another basic one.

Body: Been using it for over 4 months and it has stood up to its expectation. Light weight to carry, fold and put it up in the trunk. Easy to unfold and use it wherever we can. It is not super easy to fold/unfold compared to other strollers as well as when it is folded it is very long. I have to position is sideways in my SUV trunk because of how the tires stick out when folded. I will definitely have to return this product unfortunately.

Author: Tiphanie & Luigi Salfi
Title: Compact, lightweight, and easy to use!
Body: This stroller works pretty much as advertised. It's lightweight and easy to open and close. It was off balance, so when we first started using it one of the wheels didn't touch the ground. That has changed as our child gets heavier. The sun shade gives better coverage than our big Graco stroller - pretty awesome. The recline is good enough for a lightweight travel stroller for my child to have a nap - something that lightweight strollers aren't known to have.The only issues I really have are that the sun shade is supposed to fold up with the stroller but it does not - half of it needs to be reattached everytime we set it up for use.Another issue is the harness. I have not figured out how to tighten the straps without tying the ends into a knot in the back of the stroller. It is not easily adjustable though we have worked out a system with ours.Final issue is storage. There are small pockets for essentials, and bring a compact lightweight unit, I understand something's gotta give, but there is no storage under the stroller. The basket underneath is pretty pointless unless you have alot of small items and can survive without a diaper bag. Because the stroller is so compact, during most items between the bars and into that little basket is hard, and it is not meant to carry much weight so be prepared to carry a backpack of essentials as you will need them!

Body: I did a TON of research before I bought this product.Overall, the product matches the price point.I received my order very quickly and it was extremely easy to put together & fold back up.BUT THERE IS SOMETHING WRONG WITH THE FRONT RIGHT WHEEL!The front right wheel does not touch the ground, or spin when you push the stroller.I tried different floor levels (in my house, on the sidewalk and on a gravel path) and the front outside right wheel never touched the ground so.,.I returned it thinking it was just an issue with this one and then received a brand new one 2 days later. THE SAME ISSUE. The front right wheel does not touch the ground so now I am thinking this is a product defect. I will keep it, as I can still push the stroller but there is definitely a defect...not sure i that is why the price is low.Also, it can only fold as small as the box if you take the wheels off....once wheels are on it is pretty wide when folded.

Author: Sewist and the Geek
Title: Bought for my grandson
Body: I take care of my grandson quite a bit and we love to go out and see the city, travelling mostly by bus and metro. His daily carriage was way too bulky and awkward for me to manage up and down metro stairs and carrying this big boy (almost 30lbs) is not really convenient. So I set out to find a stroller that would allow me to travel around the city with him without having to set out a course only visiting stations with elevators.The first stroller I bought was not suitable, it was good but the handles were way too low, even for me at 5ft 1. So after a little research I decided on this stroller and I am so happy I did.The handles on this stroller are high enough for me to comfortably push for hours, the baby loves it as it gives him full view of everything going on and interact with the dogs we pass on our daily outings. There is also space for his water bottle and underneath for a toy or two, snacks, my wallet and my phone. The umbrella is really great because of the added flap that helps prevent direct sunlight for getting into the baby's eyes.I like the way this folds up and locks instantly. No fussing for me to find the lock trigger and it fits snuggly in my front closet. It is very lightweight and I can easily fold it up at any stairs and carry the baby and the stroller up (or down) without issue.The only thing is for sleeping, when the baby falls asleep it looks so uncomfortable to me. I would like if it could be laid back a little more, that would be the only thing I would change.I highly recommend this stroller to parents and grandparents alike. :)

It's super easy to get in and out of the car and really easy to fold and unfold. I like that it has a reclining seat and a 5 point harness with strap covers. The cup holder and pack are a nice feature and are perfect for keys, a phone and a wallet. The sunshade issues others have talked about must have been fixed as I have not had an issue whilst folding/unfolding.Cons to this stroller are: The basket is not worth much as it's ridiculously tiny and hard to access, but it's there nonetheless. The front wheels don't always touch the ground completely which I don't love. For the price this stroller gets the job done and was definitely worth the little bit extra.

Title: Pretty much all you need in a toddler stroller
Body: Our main stroller used to be the CitySelect mini gt. As my little one got older, i got this Summer Infant 3D mini stroller because I wanted something lightweight and compact.What I like:-It‚Äôs really light and much more compact.-My toddler sits a lot more upright in this vs the CitySelect.-It comes with a storage pouch and cup holders so no extra cost needed to buy that.-It‚Äôs very easy to fold down and unfoldMy dislikes:-The bottom storage basket is very small-The wheels are foam and I already see quite a bit of wear and tear on them (after a month of outdoor use )-The wheels don‚Äôt all contact the ground at the same time. Depending on how my daughter is sitting, one of the front wheels will barely touch the ground.My Conclusion:Yes, it would be nice to have a peek-a-boo window in the sunshade or a one switch break system but that would add to the cost. All in all I‚Äôm really happy with this stroller. It‚Äôs at a great price point and provides all you really need for a toddlers daily stroller.This stroller maneuvers well in tight spaces. I would suggest that you only use it on side walks and inside malls as I don‚Äôt believe the tires would last long on rough terrain.

Author: J.B.81
Title: Good secondary stroller. Frees up lots of trunk space.
Body: Purchased this stroller as a lightweight alternative for a trip. Our regular stroller is much bulkier and takes up way more trunk space so we needed something smaller for airports, theme parks, etc...I also really wanted one that has a basket to throw small things into and that is why I chose this particular stroller. It turned out to be pretty easy to put together. It also folds up much smaller than our primary stroller so it frees up a lot of trunk space. It is also relatively light so it is easy put in and out of the trunk, carry around, etc...My only warning is that this really is a 'convenience' stroller. It feels flimsier than I am used to. So it isn't a stroller I would be comfortable taking on very long walks or out in the rain, etc...It is good to throw in the trunk with suitcases or shopping. It is good for a walk through the mall or airport. I wouldn't be comfortable taking it for walks on gravel or mulched park paths or on long excursions around the city. So if you need a second, lightweight stroller this is a great choice. It isn't really sturdy enough to be a hardworking, primary stroller.

Title: Lightweight and easy to use
Body: I bought this open box from Amazon. I had a pleasant experience. The box actually had never been opened and everything was there and easy to assemble. Not to mention very lightweight and compact. I'm looking forward to using this on our upcoming trip. The only negative that I would have to say would be the area under the stroller to store things isn't very large.

Author: Kay
Title: Amazing stroller to travel with!!
Body: I bought this stroller in anticipation of our trip to Mexico. We needed something lightweight for our 15 month old that wasnt going to be a hassle to carry, push, store items, unfold, fold up.I was not disappointed. This was the BEST stroller for the money spent.It folds up so nicely and easily. When you're ready to put the kid in it's an easy unfold and you're done. My kid enjoyed being in it when we were strolling around the resort.The bottom storgare compartment looks small but we were able to fit our sandals, lotions, snacks, 2 beach towels and hats in there. I love that the handles are separate (not a single bar across), because we found it useful to hook my backpack and the kids water wings onto when our compartment was full. We literally threw everything we needed for the morning/afternoon onto and into this stroller.The down fall I can see for some parents is that the back doesn't recline flat, it's about a 45 degree. My kid didnt mind, he fell asleep.Other than that, its super light weight, easy to use, and has many storage options!

Author: Court95
Title: Best umbrella stroller!
Body: Seriously love this stroller!! My little guy is super comfy in it! Love the double cup holders and pouch. Has a good size sun shade. You seriously can‚Äôt go wrong with this little guy.

Author: Abby
Title: Very good value
Body: I was quite impressed with the quality and features of this stroller for its price. I didn't think it's very comfy for sitting there long as the back is soft but I'm getting it as a travel stroller so that's fine. It has all I need - kinda light weight, foldable, some storage, adjustable seat and cup holders. Nothing to complain about its value although price dropped 25% right after I ordered LOL

Author: Tom bunclark
Title: Great price for what you get.
Body: It's very light weight, can close with one hand. Great for going shopping, can still fit groceries in with it. It is small, so even my 11 month old daughter had her legs hanging off the front. All in all it's great for the price and it's way easier than lugging a bigger one around.

Author: icemanbob
Title: A few things to consider before buying
Body: This is pretty awesome! It's feature-packed and very useful.Pros:+ cupholder is great, many 'umbrella' strollers don't have something like this at all+ folds up well+ lightweight, about 11 pounds (not as light as the minimalist umbrella strollers we've had before)+ sun shield is a great add+ little bottom-mounted pouch is perfect for a small diaper bagCons:- as with many umbrella strollers, the wheels are not high quality; the locks are sort of cheap, especially the front wheel rotation locks which sound like they are breaking when we click them off- the wheels are basically a hard polymer material that's very barely squishy to the touch, not as good as a rubber tire- the seat adjustment strap on the back of the seat is very difficult to adjust, even without a kid in there- the handles are not height-adjustable; I have a couple of herniated discs, and I'm only 5'11, for me to be bent over pushing forever is painful; given this, and my long stride, I also frequently kick the back of the stroller which is also really aggravating- also with many strollers, a two-handled approach means you can't push with one hand, at least not very well or without strugglingI wouldn't buy this again, I'd put up with the pain of paying some extra for adjustable handles at the very least.

Author: Kris B.
Title: just another umbrella
Body: This is our third stroller in the Summer Infant 3D line -- and of the three, this is the only one I'd say is nothing more than an umbrella stroller.For its price, I expected much more... and I can't recommend purchasing this over the $20 special from one of the big-box baby stores.

Author: Mr. Fahrenheit
Title: Deluxe umbrella stroller simple assembly, easy storage.
Body: Out of the box this stroller took 5 mins to assemble without the instructions that were hidden in the stroller. The bonnet is very long and wide giving it great coverage and it clips on which makes it very simple to remove on days you don' need it. The wheels are very similar to other umbrella strollers I've had but the front ones have direction locks. The handles are nicely padded and there's two cup holders and a zippered pouch for storage. The five-point harness is easy to operate and fully adjustable too. Overall, I really like it and it's very well designed. It has one flaw and that's the same flaw as any umbrella stroller; it's a pain in the winter if you encounter much snow.

Author: REX
Title: A very light and inexpensive stroller.
Body: This stroller has great value to cost ratio. It‚Äôs very light and compact, light enough for most people to carry around and when folded small enough to fit into very small spaces. If you have limited space or weight considerations this stroller may be exactly what you are looking for.This is the stroller I use when I am running an indoor errand, or in situations where I need to carry the stroller more than usual. It‚Äôs great for malls, or any other place that has a smooth surface. The wheels are not meant to be used on very rough or uneven surfaces, I use another stroller in those situations. When on a smooth surface this stroller moves very easily with minimal effort, the lightweight design really pays off in this situation.Other aspects of this stroller that I like is the drink holders that are great for carrying bottles, and coffee! :) There is a decent amount of storage, but I would not weigh it down with anything very heavy. The adjustable safety belt and padded seat are of decent quality. The sunshade and visor are extremely helpful, being able reduce unwanted light is a must.Overall it‚Äôs a decent stroller that is best for shorter outings on smooth surfaces, and in situations where weight size and space are the most important considerations.

Author: justnanastuff
Title: Remember the word CONVENIENCE
Body: It‚Äôs important to realize that this is a Convenience stroller.It‚Äôs not meant to be any more than that.It‚Äôs easy to set up.It‚Äôs easy to fold down.It‚Äôs easy to lift.It‚Äôs easy to store.It‚Äôs well made.It‚Äôs CONVENIENT

Author: thychubbz
Title: Very compact umbrella stroller
Body: This stroller is great for people that don't have a lot of space, especially in their trunk. This stroller folds up like an umbrella, and is surprisingly compact. It does not take up much space, perfect for storing in your trunk. The price is great too, every grandparent should have one of these in their trunk.Being a compact stroller doesn't mean that you have to sacrifice features either. I was really impressed with the sunshade with the integrated sun visor for those extra sunny days. You even get two cup holders at the back, perfect for bottles or two coffee cups.Overall, this is a great stroller that folds up well. You don't sacrifice any major features, everything you want is included.

Author: Dana
Title: Standard lightweight stroller, needs adjustable handle
Body: Lightweight stroller that fits an older child comfortably. Pull down sun visor is a nice addition to the canopy for when the sun is lower in the sky.Favourite feature is the ability to lay the child back when they're sleeping, runner-up is double cup holders that are flexible and deep so I can carry coffee and put my cell in the other. I also love the bottom cargo area for my purse when we're in the mall.Least favourite feature is non-adjustable handles, which are a smidge too low to be comfortable for long walks if you're tall, and not so easy to carry one handed in a pinch.

Author: Luke
Title: Easy to Set-up, Quick to Fold and Put Away and More Premium than other Umbrella Strollers
Body: Arrives in a long, slender box and frustration-free packaging. The only things needed to be done to set-up is to take off a few styrofoam ends from the metal edges, unfold the frame and pop the wheels into place. All done within 2 minutes. It's also very easy and quick for fold back down. For an umbrella stroller, this is really well built and sturdy. It features a complete seat belt that will hold the child more comfortably. It's got two cup holders and a big pocket, as well as a compartment below for bigger items. It's got easy to use and access foot brakes on the back wheels. The wheels also look more durable than on other umbrella strollers. The only complaint is that the front wheels sometimes get a little jammed and don't go exactly where you want them. That can be remedied easily by turning the around, which resets it. This is a more premium stroller than most other convenience strollers out there.

Author: Crystal A
Title: Portable and Decent
Body: This Stroller is easy to put together (pending instructions are followed), and easy for the baby on the go.It's definitely a lot lighter than the huge strollers I typically see, and it's easy to navigate on flat surfaces (not so great on uneven surfaces due to the smaller wheel size).It includes a fabric holder for bottles and little items, such as your wallet - but nothing too big or weighty, as the holder tends to sag with too much weight.The seat is slightly padded, and includes a basic seatbelt to hold my niece in without her toppling out.There is a slight recline to the seat, just enough for a sit up nap.It folds up easily and fits in the back of our car without taking up much room at all.It's a basic stroller, but perfect for every day normal-person needs.

Author: Fred G
Title: Great little stroller
Body: The Summer Infant 3Dmini Convenience Stroller, Dusty Blue, is a perfect little stroller for young ones - up to 45lbs. It is easy to put together, great price point, and relatively good quality. I like the hood and the large storage area to make shopping easy. At this point, I don't have anything negative to say about it, but will update this review as needed if something breaks or isn't working properly.

Author: Krm
Title: Light cheap easy to open and close
Body: A lot of great things about this stroller. It comes nearly assembled all you have to do is click on the wheels and the sunshade. It is super lightweight and folds up small about 1/2 the size of a bag of golf clubs. Decent amount of storage and two cup holders are nice. Adjustable buckles so you can grow in it. My only complaint was that one of the wheels was melted/deformed a little. It doesn't affect the stroller much though since there each wheel consists of 2 wheels side by side and the one beside the deformed one still works fine. When you're all done it easily folds down with one click to toss in the car

Author: IamMe
Title: Travel stroller
Body: This is a pretty good umbrella stroller for a great pricepoint.Really easy to put together - it arrives with the wheels off but you just need to click them into place. My 1.5yr old is able to climb into the stroller by herself. It can comfortably seat my 3.5yr old as well though steering is obviously a little harder with my bigger kiddo. The wheels are plastic so there is no worry about flat tires. It comes with a sun hood which is great, and it does have a small basket underneath where you can put a small diaper bag. There is also a cup/bottle holder!This stroller is perfect for airports and such. It obviously wouldn't be as comfortable as a regular stroller for all day pushing especially if you are tall, but for trips where you just need an easy compact stroller this one is awesome!
